loans.name: Donozio

texts.en: Donozio used the previous to buy oranges,maize and sugar cane for planting. He has been in agriculture for 21 years located in the rural area.In addition to the retail shop he also has a motor cycle transport business as another source of income. Donozio started business to improve on his life with the great hope of becoming a model farmer in his town, thereby increasing his income. He faces a challenge of unpredictable weather. He will use the loan to pay for farm inputs like manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs like manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Butunduzi Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Gideon, a 45-year-old man, is married with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been growing bananas for 15 years in rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from growing maize and Irish potatoes. He is faced with the hardship of lack of enough capital to buy manure and fertilizers to expand his banana plantation farm to a large-scale one for increased profits.

Gideon is a member of an agricultural village group. The members guarantee one another instead of pledging security. He is requesting a loan to pay for labour for the banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labour for the banana plantation.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is a general store keeper and deals with different people in a day. She is an old BRAC customer and honest borrower.  She is in her 4th loan cycle and has invested the previous three loans in her current enterprise. She has established her general store through these loans.
 
She has repaid her previous loans and wants to be a member of Kiva this time. She wants to take a new loan to grow her general store. She will buy flour,  rice, detergent, biscuits and chocolates.

Majeedan 48 years old and her husband is a security guard. She feels proud to be a member of BRAC.  She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, detergent, biscuits and chocolates to sell from her General Store.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.en: Valeriano is a repeat customer and a resident of Rukiri Rushenyi Ntungamo district, whose major activity is farming. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000. He wants to use the money to buy mulch and pesticides which will improve his banana plantation and the quality of the bananas. He is faced with the challenge of low productivity with his farming due to poor farming methods. His prime target is to yield a high output from his plantations and also to take his children to better schools in the country. But he is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams. With this loan, he believes his production will improve and so will his lifestyle in society after getting an increase in his income.He is hard working and proud of the kiva partnership.

loans.use: To buy mulch and pesticides

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a professional driver and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Noreen  has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. He wants to buy new tires and complete engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Noreen thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain an Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, aged 54, is living with her seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She took a loan for the business of her husband. 

Shehnaz’s husband supplies the raw material of crushed plastic to the manufacturers of different firms. In fact, he buys used plastic bottles and plastic accessories from scrap dealers. After washing and crushing them into small ingredients, he then sells them to the manufacturers. The manufactures give it different shapes through compression molding machines.

One day during crushing, a hard plastic bottle stuck inside the crushing blade of the machine. Its blade was damaged badly and needs replacement, but he does not have enough money to buy a new crushing blade.

Therefore, Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Through the loan amount, her husband will be able to buy a new crushing blade easily. 

Shehnaz thanks to Kiva and is tension free now because her husband can run his business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy a crushing blade for crushing plastic bottles into raw material for selling.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 29-year-old enterprising young woman and a resident of Isunga, a village within Kagadi county.

Her business is poultry-rearing where she sells products like chicken and eggs, a business she has been doing since 2012. She is also a community development officer with a local sub county.

She has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy chicken feed to generate more income.

She dreams of getting married and having children whom she can easily take care of. She also dreams of completing her house in Kagadi town. She encourages fellow women to be enterprising and get out of the debt burden.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Faleala

texts.en: Faleala is 45 years old and married with 9 children.She operates a small business selling fish,crabs,and octpus in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Faleala has requested a loan to buy more fishing gear and equipments for her fishing business such as fishing nets, fishing strings, bullet nets, and also to pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Faleala will try and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipments like fishing nets, strings, bullet nets, also to pay for school fees

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and two of her children go to school. She takes care of two additional family members, older parents. 

Justine sells secondhand clothing on a retail basis. She sells her clothes from door-to-door and works for seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last three years. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her major business challenge includes transportation and seasonality.

Her goal and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to get a permanent business location. 

She lives in a rented house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Justine’s major expenses include food, power, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 31 years old, and from Nyahururu, Kenya.  She is married to John and they are blessed with four children aged 8, 7, 4, and 7 months. 

She has been involved in the mixed farming business for the last three years.  She has applied for her first loan of 5,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy maize planting seeds.

Her monthly income right now is 8,000 KES and she has plans of using profits realized from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay this loan back to VisionFund Kenya.  In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy maize planting seeds.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidiis a married woman with 8 kids, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

Sidi operates a vegetable selling stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors.  She faces a challenge with the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan she wants to pay school fees for her kids.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids

loans.name: Anociata

texts.en:
Anociata is a farmer in Nyakabare in Mashonga, which is located in Kyamuhunga Subcounty, Bushenyi District. She is a 32-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. 

Anociata started farming in 2006 with a hope of earning enough profit from the business to provide for the needs of her family. She is also a primary school teacher, which boosts her income because she earns some money as a monthly salary. She is a very hard-working woman, who puts in eight hours in the tea garden each day worked. She hopes and believes that her hard work will be rewarded. 

Anociata would like to use the requested loan of One million shillings to buy fertilizers, which she will apply to the garden so that she can increase her harvest and hence make a lot of sales, in turn giving her enough profit. Her main challenge is the unpredictable weather, which affects her tea garden negatively, especially when it rains. Despite the challenge, Anociata is determined to carry on tea farming with a hope that it will give her enough money to provide for her entire family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes, jeans and clothing material for resale

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is aged 32 and living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Lubna’s husband has been running a general store where he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store; his few relatives like to purchase from his general store as well. 

He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior, he has built up very good relationships with his customers. Due to these good relationships, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so that he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her husband's general store such as sacks of rice, sugar, flour etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bowls, spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: 04-07-10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Chuyền is 55 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is dependent; the other is grown up. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Chuyền is the group leader of the 04-07-10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members.

Chuyền has a food production business making nem chua (fermented/cured pork). She is requesting a loan to purchase pork and banana leaf which are needed to make nem chua. Chuyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Chuyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Chuyền hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase pork and banana leaf to make nem chua (fermented/cured pork).

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hương is 44 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the Hương's solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2013, Hương joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Chỉ's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chỉ operates a food stall/restaurant and sells cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle to sell.

Chỉ is 44 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the Chỉ's Solidarity Group. Chỉ supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Chỉ joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Chỉ has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chỉ hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell.

loans.name: Reyma

texts.en:
Reyma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Reyma is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Reyma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Thiet

texts.en: Thiet is requesting a new loan to buy another sewing machine and clothing materials. Thiet's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and clothing materials

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha, age 64, lives in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district and has four children. She and her husband are farmers who have grown rice for 20 years. To supplement the income, she has been selling snacks and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 56,000 KHR per day but she can save about 24,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is a micro loan for Sokha’s group of five members who are all female. Sokha is a ninth-cycle client with VisionFund. The past two loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan. Sokha, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Voern Hen's Group

texts.en:
Voern is 43 and widowed with four children.  She lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She earns a living growing sesame and corn, which they have been doing for 23 years. The current business earns them about 33,000KHR per day. 

Voern’s group consists of two female members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. 

As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income for her family. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Lyah

texts.en:
Lyah runs a small stall, which sells groceries, snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. She lives south of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Lyah is married and has two children.

Lyah began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has around $6 - $8 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales).

She took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using printer

loans.name: Imam

texts.en:
Imam runs a small stall that serves as an internet cafe, sells mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. Imam lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Imam is single.

Imam began working with Ruma four months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $30 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales).He took a loan to get a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payment).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using printer

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 47-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Shabana’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily fare because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra-poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older, and their needs are growing as well. He was worried for many days about how to abstain from paying a daily fare, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Shabana has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing was short some money. Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw, with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that now her husband will not have any need to pay daily fare; this will become the cause of an increase in income. 

Shabana hopes that now her husband will be able to have more income because now he will not pay daily fare to anyone. She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is 52-year-old poor lady.

The financially condition of her family is not good, and the living standard not seemingly for humans. She wants to establish her house and change the living standard of her family. 

Her whole family is dependent upon a single earning person. Her husband drives a rickshaw, which is the single source of income; she wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well.

Her son wants to put together a new auto rickshaw from a manufacturer; he has almost collected the full amount, but is short some of it. 

Therefore, Shamim is taking a loan for her son so he can complete the remaining assembly of his auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son so he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family. 

Shamim hopes that her son would be stable in this profession, and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. 

She is very thankful Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to get the remaining amount for a new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 47-year-old lady; she lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is turner by profession; he manufactures and renews spare parts of vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufactures the spare parts of various vehicles. His lathe machine has become out of order due to continuous working and it needs maintenance. He has spent all his savings to buy raw material for manufacturing spare parts and does not have cash in hand to fix the lathe machine.
Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the deficiencies of the lathe machine. She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate the lathe machine again. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for a lathe machine.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is 54-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a milkman by profession; he sells milk nearby in his community, and is getting a reasonable income for his family. He purchases milk from a wholesaler, and sells it as a retailer in his shop. He wants to offer yogurt because there is demand, but he does not have money to buy more milk for the production of yogurt.

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to purchase more fresh milk to sell. 

She hopes that she would be able to make savings through the profit amount.

Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell from the milk shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric spray, fabric materials, tapa, glue, glitter, rolls of thin wire, varnish, paint brush,  fabric paint, glitter, tape, machine, school fees.

loans.name: Jerom

texts.en:
Jerom is a hardworking 20-year-old man. He was working his part time job as a butcher attendant to help him in his studies. He studied BS - Criminology at the university. Her father earns from his business as a butcher and his mother is vending vegetables in the market. He has four siblings depending on his parents.

Jerom is someone who is very dedicated to his family. He wants his parents to be proud of him. 

He is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. His goal is to continue his studies and work for the success for his better future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been doing embroidery with a machine at home to support her family. She has become an expert in embroidery with her machine but a few days ago her machine broke due to continuous work. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business. Therefore, Azra has requested a loan to buy a new embroidery machine so that she can stitch more embroidery dresses to sell and could grow her income.

She is a mother of six children; she is motivated to provide for her family good clothes and education. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children. Azra thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and associated materials.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
She is aged 39 and mother of six children. Her husband works in a small firm on very low daily wages and comes very late at night. She has to pick up and drop off her children herself, manage routine work, and complete her tasks for embroidery as well. 

Shazia is taking a loan to buy stock of sequins, pearls and gum for pasting over shawls to sell to the retailers. She has been pasting sequins over shirts for many years and feeding her children. She is a responsible mother knowing her duties and responsibilities regarding her family members very well. She always keeps busy and is ready to provide the better facilities for her children.

Her dream is to construct her house according to the population of her children; for this purpose she is making savings.

Shazia is very happy and relaxed after receiving this loan because this loan will be the cause to increase the monthly income and savings as well.

loans.use: To buy stones, pearls, sequins and gum for pasting over shirts.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with three children

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sumber Tanjung Group

texts.en:
As the head of the Sumber Tanjung group, Ni Ketut has the responsible to coordinate all of the members to make their payment. The progress of the pigs business this period is quite good. They can sell the pigs together, and earn a profit. 

Ni Ketut, 44, is married and has two adult children. She maintains seven pigs, and has sold them all. Each pig she sold for 650,000 IDR, and she got 4,550,000 IDR in total. After deducting the loan and paying for the feed, she can use the rest to fullfill her family needs. 

Seeing the significant result from the last period, the group asks for an increased loan size, which MUK approved. Now the group receives 20,000,000 IDR and each gets 2,000,000 IDR. 

Ni Ketut has a primary job as a fish seller. The pigs business she does after she finishes selling the fish around her village. 

She use her loan to purchase superior piglets, and also as capital for her fish selling business. 

To reduce the cost of feed, she’s also giving the pigs traditional feed made from various kinds of leaves, such as banana leaves and cassave leaves. 

She hopes this new loan gives her more profit and more welfare to her family.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and also as capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon is a 46-year-old married woman and a loving mother of eight children. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises poultry at home for a living. Her husband has given her his full support in her work, helping her at home and working on the rice farm when she needs help. Her family’s income relies on the farming business. She has been involved in farming for nearly 30 years now.

Phon would like to obtain a loan that she will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members, so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phon is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a young woman who always tries for the well-being of her family. She was born in 1995. She is not married and lives with her mother. Her father died some years ago. She is a student. Now, she is going to organize her own business as she and her mother need money. 

Nilufar is going to organize a business of selling food items. She will buy food items in bulk from the central market and sell them in a local bazaar in her village. She is going to pay for her tuition from the profits. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy food items for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, 37 and a mother of one, operates a retail store for a living. She has been doing this for five years earning well to support her husband's income from working as Overseas Filipino Worker. With her generated revenue, she was able to provide their daily household expenses. 

To increase sales, Melanie had to add to her stock for her costumers’ choices. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional cosmetics, cellphone accessories and ready to wear cloths for sale. In the future, she wants to improve her business to earn more for a better future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetics, cellphone accessories and ready to wear cloths for sale

loans.name: Gac

texts.en:
Gac is a father of five children; yet all of them have moved out and he lives with his wife. 

The loan that Gac is requesting now will be used to build a hay barn to store the cow's fodder in. Up until now, he had kept it covered and waterproof.  They have a dairy cow that makes approximately 20 kg of milk a day, which is way too much for him and his wife to use; hence, they sell it to a nearby dairy farm. 

A bit about the village: according to the archaeological excavations it is very old and dates back to the Illyrjan era; all residents are of Catholic faith and women for generations used to make carpets using primitive hand looms.

loans.use: to build a hay barn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one cow, 4 sheep, and 80 pcs of binding of alfalfa.

loans.name: Munif

texts.en:
Munif runs a small stall where he sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits, and processes bill payments. He lives in west Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Munif is married.

Munif began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business. For the last month, he has had around $20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales).

He took a loan for getting a printer from Kiva to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using printer

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa  is from Oroquieta-Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. She is 45-years-old and married. 

In 2010, Nelfa applied for her membership with Kiva partner PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Nelfa asked for financial assistance of Php 20,000 to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and fertilizers.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 54-year-old married woman, living with her husband and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is an old man and sits idle at home. 

Musarrat owns a small business of clothing at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells it at a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now that the summer season is about start, she wants to buy the clothes for the summer season for reselling purposes. But she does not have cash in hand due to household expenses.  

She has requested a loan so she can buy clothing for the summer season to fulfill the demand. 

She wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better living standard to her children.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 47, living with her five family members in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her son has been running a DVD shop for 12 years, and been generating income for his family. He wants to offer mobile accessories such as chargers, body, data cables, etc and provide the re-charge facilities of different networks. 

In his town, the demand has increased for mobile accessories and for re-charging. But he does not have enough cash in hand for the further investment into the business because he already has spent his all savings on household expenses. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her son so he can buy additional mobile accessories for his DVD shop, and extra credit for the re-charging facility. 

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy additional mobile accessories to sell.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 59-year-old widow; her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of nine children; she has been facing rainy days after the death of her husband. Earlier, her husband was running a furniture shop. After he died, her son took over; he makes wooden tv trolleys. He has been making trolleys for many years, and learned the art from his father. 

He wants to grow his business so he can generate sufficient income to support his sibling. This is the reason he wants to buy make excess tv trolleys to sell. But, he does not have the capital for the investment into the current enterprise.  

Therefore, Bashiran has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy raw materials such as chip board, glue, glass, etc. for making tv trolleys. 

Bashiran is very thankful to the Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy wooden raw materials for making tv trolleys.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Taxila, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own business of stones and jewelry for many years, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family as well as manage the household.

Farzana's husband wants to purchase different kinds of tools and a cutter for his stones business, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will provide financial assistance to her husband so that he can buy all of the above accessories to fulfill his business needs. 

For this financial assistance, Farzana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of tools and a cutter for her husband's stone business.

loans.name: Siline

texts.en: Seline is a 39 years old married woman with 05 children. She has a plantation and grows cabbages,green onions,tomatoes,green pepper,carrots to earn a living. She also grows flowering plants which is sold every Saturday at the market for Church flowering decorations on Sundays. Seline also has a cattle farm which has 21cows. She has been doing this for 04 year. Through this new loan scheme, Seline wants to expand her cattle business. Therefore, she has requested a loan to buy more cows for her cattle farm, Barbed wire and nails for her fence. Seline has been a member of SPBD since 2007. With her profits, Seline hopes to not only reinvest in her business, but also to take care of her family needs and especially providing good education for her kids.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and tools to improve her business

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: La señora Maria Eva es madre soltera de 4 hijos de estos solo uno depende de ella el cual esta en escuela, la señora se esfuerza por sacarlo adelante, trabaja de lunes a domingo en un puesto de comida en el mercado desde hace 31 años, antes la señora trabajaba como ayudante de cocina en le negocio familiar siempre de comida pero decidio ahorrar y poner su propio negocio, es una señora muy luchadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante, solicita el financiamiento para compra de granos basicos por quintales al por mayor para obtener descuentos y mantener inventario en su negocio con el fin de ver mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Maria Eva is a single mother of four children, only one of whom still depends on her, and said child is attending school. She works hard to support him, and has been working Monday through Sunday in a food stall at the market for 31 years. Prior to that she worked as a kitchen assistant in the family food business but decided to save up and set up her own business. She's a very hardworking woman who strives to get ahead, and is requesting financing for the wholesale purchase of hundredweights of staple grains to get a discounted price and keep her business' inventory stocked, with the objective of obtaining higher profits.

loans.use: To purchase hundredweights of staple grains, rice, oil, sugar, beans, and vegetables

loans.name: Argen

texts.en:
Argen is an agronomist from Yenoqavan village. She lives with her husband and son, who works as an army officer. 
Argen and her husband run a farm. They keep livestock consisting of cows, sheep, and calves, and cultivate wheat and grass. 
Argen also owns an orchard where different types of fruit trees are grown (plum, fig, nut, apple, and pear trees). Argen and her husband work hard to be able to gather a good harvest and earn income for their living. 
Argen has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase 3 calves and increase the livestock numbers.
 Argen will be very grateful to lenders if they support her with improving her farm.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves

loans.name: Margush

texts.en:
Margush lives in Amasia village with her son. She works at a local art school, and also is engaged in agriculture.  She keeps livestock (cows, sheep and pigs) and also cultivates potato and wheat. 

Margush and her son work hard to gather a good harvest and sustain their living. 

Margush asks for this loan to purchase seven oxen and forage for the livestock. 

This will be a big support for their farming business, and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seven oxen and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha was born in 1982. She is a married woman living in a sector of Jordan called Dair Alla. Her husband works in construction. Maha has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions by running her project of selling blankets. She started her project two years ago selling a small quantity of blankets to her friends. Then, she started expanding it gradually. 

Now, she needs to add summer clothes for the coming season in order to attract more customers at the beginning of summer. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for the coming season.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a conservative woman. She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Basma was born in 1975. She is the mother of four daughters. 

She and her family established a small coffee booth, where her husband is currently working to support the family. 

Now Basma is applying for a loan to add a coffee machine to the booth in order to raise her productivity.

loans.use: to add a new coffee machine to her booth

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 41 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's household expenses, but now it requires replacement of some important spare parts and the body. However, due to lack of availability of funds, he is unable to buy spare parts and replace the rickshaw’s body. 

For this reason, Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He wants to buy new spare parts and a new body for his vehicle. 

This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes for his business.

Razia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and replace the rickshaw’s body.

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is a 40-year-old married woman; she lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very populated area. A few days ago he was in a road accident; he was looking for the passenger standing beside the road and a speedy car collided with the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fractures, but the rickshaw’s body got seriously damaged and a replacement body is needed. Her husband is short some amount to buy new body for the auto rickshaw.

Therefore, Naeem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the new body of the auto rickshaw.

Naeem is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: To buy the body of an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a Palestinian guy from Gaza Strip. He is 45 years old, married and  father of three childrens, He chose to take a loan from ACAD to buy seeds for new crops. Raed started by using his own land, planting it and raising livestock like sheep and birds.  Because it is the main source of income for him and his family Raed decided to take care of it.  In the future, he is looking to expand his profits by adding more kinds of crops including fruits and vegetables. Concerning the challenges, most of them are Israeli barriers created by closing the borders. Finally, Raed wants to thank ACAD and Kiva for giving him a chance to share his story. Thank you so much.

loans.use: to pay the price of the seeds and crop cultivation

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en:
Maksim is photographed at the back of their family house. He is 36, married, and has two children, 8 and 4 years old. From the shape of the house shown in the photo, one can tell the poverty level of Maksim’s family. The covered spots with waterproofs are called ‘warm beds’; is the place where seeds are thrown to thrive to seedlings; afterwards, they can be planted outside.  
 
Maksim, whose main activity of practice is agriculture, wants to buy potato and sage seeds, medicinal cane cholla flower seeds, and dig a water well.

Mostly he plants green beans, peas, wheat, tobacco and flaxseed; tobacco is widely planted in the villages around. 

He’s got a dairy cow as well, to cover the family dairy needs; he sells the rest, since his cow produces about 20 kg milk a day.

loans.use: to buy potato and sage seeds, medicinal cane cholla flower seeds, and dig a well

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is a 32-year-old married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) is running a small general store. He is good in dealing with customers and makes a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures. He offers various goods of daily use. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Saiqa applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). It will help him to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at his store. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes in his business.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Marlin Soriek

texts.es: Marlin es una joven de 39 años, soltera, responsable, honesta, dedicada a su trabajo  y a su familia, se desempeña   como promotora de crédito en una cooperativa de ahorro y crédito, manifiesta estar agradecida con Ceprodel ya que con los créditos que se le han brindado a podido suplir los gastos de la universidad y parte de los estudio de sus dos hermanos, actualmente solicito un crédito para pago de matricula de sus hermanos que ingresan a primer año de la universidad y cancelación de aranceles de su trabajo monográfico y así lograr su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Marlin is a 39 year old young woman who is responsible, honest and devoted to her work and family. She is a loan developer in a savings and loan cooperative.

She states that she is grateful to Ceprodel because, with the loans they have granted, she has been able to fund university expenses and part of the studies of her two brothers. Currently she is requesting a loan to pay the registration fees for her brothers, who are entering the first year of the university and to repay the tuition fees for their monographic research material.  In this way, they will achieve their dream of becoming a professional..

loans.use: to pay for her brothers' tuition and school supplies and monographic research material.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 47-year-old, married man from Gaza City. He is a father of one son and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mazen has a  medical issue and he must have surgery, but he does not have enough money to pay for it. 

Mazen took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for the surgery. By taking this loan, he will be able to recover and go back to work. 

Mazen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for surgery a  medical issue

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi lives in the Muranga area of Central Kenya with his wife and he has two children who are all grown up now. He has been farming for ten years where his source of income comes from the sale of tea,and milk. He stated that he enjoys farming because it is a source of income for his family, while his biggest challenge is a lack of capital for his farming projects.

He chose Juhudi Kilimo because he wants to develop in farming more, and Juhudi helps farmers to improve the way they live. This loan will benefit his family in that they will get food and cater for other needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blankets for resale

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 52 years old, married, and a resident of Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. Starting with capital of 7,000 PHP, she opened a small restaurant (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last February 2011 and has taken out three loans. This loan is to restock raw ingredients for her restaurant.She wishes to maintain her position as a member in good standing and to be able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for future needs. Anecita only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and be able to help her nieces and nephews in their college education obligations.

loans.use: To restock raw ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Karachi, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1992, Khalid has been an electronic goods repairer, which is the only source of income for the family. He can repair washing machines and air coolers. All of his customers appreciate his services.

Currently, he is in need of purchasing electronic goods for repairing washing machines and air coolers. However, he finds it difficult due to financial constrains. Khalid has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to continue his business, but he will increase his net income and savings as well. He hopes to provide quality education for his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electric goods to repair washing machines and air coolers.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia, aged 38 is a responsible mother and living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fourth loan with the BRAC. She is an old member, and has been taking loans according to the needs of her family. She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfil all the household expenses with her poor earnings. 

In fact, her husband is a hawker by profession: he sells and purchases engine oils by bicycle. His practice is to buy used engine oil from different workshops then sell it to the refinery factories. He wants to buy large quantities of engine oil for reselling so that he can generate a reasonable income for the family so they can overcome poverty. Therefore, Ruqia has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more quantities of used engine oil. She is very impressed with this honorable support. She gives thanks to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy used oil from workshops to sell to the refinery companies.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman who is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a small business that sells beauty products to the ladies of her hometown by door to door. She roams from door to door to offer products in her community by lifting the basket of beauty products over her head. She purchases local cosmetic products such as nail polish, lipstick, talcum powders, face powder, etc. from the market at a low price and sells them on at a high price. She wants to involve her husband in this business also, so he can offer these products to retailers. But she does not have cash in hand to buy beauty products for her husband.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan so she can buy more quantities of cosmetics for her husband to resell to retailers. She wishes for a bright future for her children and dreams of providing a better education for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures iron accessories with the help of his son. He has been manufacturing gates, windows, tables and providing door-to-door services to weld broken accessories as well.

A few days ago, his welding plant become out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have cash in hand due to a lot of household expenses. Therefore, Shanaz has requested a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for manufacturing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials like cement, iron corrugated zincs, etc. for the construction of a house

loans.name: Epie

texts.en:
Epie is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past three years.

Epie has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc. In the future, Epie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, ice cubes, etc.

loans.name: Toeung Leng's Group

texts.en: Toeung is a farmer from Thmor Kol district of Battambang province. She is 50 years old and a mother of seven children, two of whom are in school. To feed the family, she grows rice as the main source of income and works as a paid worker to supplement her income. She has been in her business for 15 years. Toeung has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for her past four loans, which have helped to improve her family's living conditions. Now, she is the team leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. The total amount of the loan is 1,300,000 KHR, of which 600,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She strongly hopes that her family’s income will increase gradually to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Emma works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fish vending. Emma is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Abdul Qayoom

texts.en:
Abdul Qayoom is the age of 40, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been running a small general store for many years. Earlier he was selling only general store items so that he could easily bear the household expenses. But with the inflation in household expenses, he decided to offer fruits as well. 

His shop is situated in a populated area and lots of customers are available here, to whom he can offer miscellaneous items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily usage. A few days ago he started to offer fresh fruits, due to offering additional inventory. This impacts positively on his net income, but does not remain as sufficient cash in hand to buy inventory for the general store. He wants to fully stock his general store again by purchasing inventory such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties etc. But the major problem is the lack of availability of funds.

Therefore, Abdul Qayoom has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy inventory such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties and additional fruits. He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be successful in fulfilling each request for any item, and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way, he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional inventory. He is very thankful to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory and fruits for resale for his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for restocking her business and building materials, such as cinder blocks, cement, and sand

loans.name: Dolores Eufemia

texts.es: La señora Dolores trabaja  en la alcaldia como operaria de limpieza publica desde hace 10 años, empezo desde jovencita a trabajar en la alcaldia para sostener a su familia y a su mamá,  es  madre soltera de dos hijos que estudian su mami tambien  depende de ella, es una señora muy humilde y con muchos deseos de superación, se esfuerza por sacalos adelante, solicita el financiamiento para gastos de operación de su mamà y gastos de medicamentos .
texts.en: Dolores has worked in the mayor's office as a custodian of public cleanliness for ten years. As a young woman, she began to work in the mayor's office to support her family and her mother. She is a single mother with two children who are in school and her own mother also depends on her. She is a very humble woman and has desires to improve herself. She works hard to move her family forward. She is requesting this loan for the costs of her mother's operation and the costs of the pharmaceutical medicine.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of her mother's operation and medicine.

loans.name: Salvadora De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Salvadora tiene la edad de 49 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 esta bajo su cargo, aunque tambien de ella dependen 2 nietos. Doña Salvadora es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora, emprendedora, con deseos de superacion, nos comento que desde muy jovencita se dedico a lavar y planchar, ya que tenia que mantener a sus 3 hijos y mantener los estudios de estos con su trabajo, pero fue hasta hace 2 años que ella encontro una oportunidad de trabajo en una institucion del gobierno en donde se desempeña como conserje de la casa materna, en donde se encarga de mantener limpio el local y ademas de hacer la comida de las mujeres embarazadas. Ademas de su trabajo fijo ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio (venta de granos basicos, detergentes, gaseosas) en su casa de habitacion desde hace 2 años y es para este negocio que ella solicita credito ya que su objetivo es agrandar el negocio el cual esta siendo administrado por una de sus hijas. Sus metas son que su negocio prospere para que su ingresos aunmenten y darles a sus hijos y nietos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Salvadora is 49 years old. She is unmarried and has three children, of whom one is still dependent on her. She is also responsible for two of her grandchildren. Doña Salvadora is a hardworking and enterprising woman, who is struggling to succeed. She mentioned that since she was very young, she did washing and ironing because she had to support her three children and underwrite their studies through her work. 

However, it was not until two years ago that she obtained a job in a government institution, where she works as caretaker in a maternal home. There she is in charge of keeping the place clean and in addition of fixing meals for the pregnant women. 

In addition to her steady job, she has also been operating a small business (selling basic grains, detergents, soft drinks) in her home for two years. It is on behalf of her business that she is requesting a loan. Her objective is to expand her business, which is currently being run by one of her daughters. Her goal is that her business prosper so that her earnings will increase and provide her children and grandchildren with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, sugar, beans, sweets and detergent.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru: Наталья работает продавцом в торговом центре в городе Виноградово. Наталья замужем, есть одна дочь. Раньше Наталья с семьей жила в квартире, но недавно она поменяла квартиру на дом. Дом хоть и больше по размеру, но старенький и требует ремонта. Наталья просит предоставить ей 8,000 гривен на ремонт дома. Она хочет поменять межкомнатные двери, пол и утеплить стены. Таким образом дом станет не только красивее, но и энергосберигающим.
texts.en: Natalia works as a salesperson in the shopping centre in the city of Vinogradovo. She is married with one daughter. Natalia and her family used to live in an apartment, but not long ago she exchanged the apartment for a house. While the house is bigger in size, it is old and needs repairs. Natalia is asking for a loan of 8,000 griven for home repairs. She wants to replace the interior doors and the floor and insulate the walls, so that the house becomes not just more attractive, but more energy-efficient as well.

loans.use: to do home renovations and make her house more energy-efficient

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Because Hiyam is a conservative lady, she asked her daughter to appear in the picture instead. Hiyam was born in 1966. She is married and has seven children. One of her daughters, 21 years old, is in her second year of a Nursing Diploma program. Hiyam does not currently have enough money to pay her daughter's tuition fees. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to pay the fees for the upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is a 24-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been doing his own stone polishing business for the past 10 years. Her husband is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Mehwish's husband wants to buy a new stone polishing machine and its supporting tools for his business so that he can provide better stone polishing services. But due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy these items to fulfill his business needs.

Therefore, Mehwish has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will provide financial assistance to her husband to buy the new stone polishing machine and accessories. 

Mehwish is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial support.

loans.use: To buy a stone polishing machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 30-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is a mother of six children. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering a larger variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well.  However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

His wife, Naseem, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a larger variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 30 years old and a responsible housewife living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Now, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize vegetable sales.

Shamim applied for loan so her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 46-year-old active borrower from BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family and has seven children.

Her husband is a flour bag maker by profession. He has been in this business for the past 26 years. He is the only one responsible for meeting the needs of the family and manages the entire household.

Shabana's husband wants to buy different types of accessories like needles and rolls of cord for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in a suitable condition to buy all of these things. Therefore, Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to buy above the items to fulfill his business needs.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy accessories for making flour bags

loans.name: Felipe Arnoldo

texts.es:
Felipe Arnoldo habita en el municipio de El Sauce ubicado a 90 kilómetros del departamento de León, conocido generalmente como tierra de leche y miel por ser meramente zona muy productiva de estos rubros.
Don Arnoldo es un señor de 59 años que se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a laborar como operador de pozo para la empresa que abastece el agua potable en dicho municipio.
El operador de pozo es quien se encarga de dar mantenimiento a los pozos que distribuyen el agua a los diferentes barrios de este poblado.
Don Arnoldo tiene tres años de trabajar con Ceprodel y ha obtenido 4 créditos de los inversionistas de Kiva los cuales le han ayudado en su desarrollo económico porque gracias a ello logró terminar de cancelar la moto que es su principal medio de transporte, ha mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, lo cual no hubiera podido lograr solamente con su salario y se siente muy agradecido por este apoyo que estas personas le han brindado.
En la actualidad tiene la necesidad de un crédito siempre con la visión se seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida para la compra de perlines, zinc y hierro con el fin de ponerle el techo a un cuarto que está construyendo.
Espera que le sigan apoyando con estos financiamientos que son de gran ayuda para las personas de escasos recursos
texts.en:
Felipe Arnolds lives in the town of El Sauce, located 90 kilometers from the department of León, and known generally as the land of milk and honey simply for being a very productive area.

Don Arnoldo is a 59 year old man, who has spent a great part of his working life as a well operator for a business that furnishes potable water in said town. The well operator is who is in charge of maintaining the wells that distribute water in different neighborhoods of this town.

Don Arnold has worked with Ceprodel for three years and has obtained four loans from Kiva lenders who have helped him in his economic development because, thanks to them, he succeeded in paying off the motorcycle that is his principal means of transportation and he has improved conditions in his home, neither of which he would have been able to do solely on his salary. Thus he is very grateful for the support these people have provided him.

With the vision of continuing to improve his living conditions, he currently needs a loan in order to purchase purlins, zinc and iron so that he can install a roof on a room that he is building.

He hopes that they continue supporting him with these funds, which are of great help for people of scarce resources.

loans.use: to purchase purlins, zinc and iron.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is 37 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Ma. Theresa has been raising ducks for two years and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is a responsible mother of six children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last few years. For the past many days, his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Rani has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rani is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gloria is taking out a bridge loan to restart her food vending business.

Gloria has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her food vending business.

Gloria is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a government employee.  

Ambreen has started a clothing business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. 

Presently, she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of finances, she is facing a problem. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: M. Tayab

texts.en:
M. Tayab is 34. He is a young and energetic person living in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. He is married and recently started a clothing business near his hometown. Now this garment shop is the only single source of income for his family, which is the reason he devotes all of his all time to the garment shop.
 
His shop is situated under the garment market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a high price. This competition becomes the cause of low sales and requires more effort as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing in the shop on a daily basis so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Now the major problem is that the summer season is about to start and he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy clothing for the summer season. If he could not replace the winter season’s clothing with the summer season, then it might be highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income. Therefore, M. Tayab has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy the summer season clothing. M. Tayab hopes that he will purchase clothing according he wants at the right time so that he can cope with the market competition and generate sufficient income to cherish his children. He thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: To buy summer season clothing and boutique style dresses for resale.

loans.name: Olia

texts.en: Olia is a 54-year-old woman from Terjola district. She is divorced and lives alone. Her son died several years ago. In spite of her high education, she couldn't find any stable job and had to go abroad to generate an income. It was hard for her to live in a different place, far from her relatives and she returned soon. Now Olia has a great desire to be involved in her own business. She requested a loan of 600 USD to purchase products for her grocery store. She will open the store in her own place near the local market. This business will be lucrative she thinks, as it will have a great location. She will work as a sales lady and earn a stable income. Olia will be grateful for your help and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To buy products to open a grocery store

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada y tiene una hija la cual esta en edad escolar, habita en la ciudad de chichigalpa desde que nacio, realizo estudios universitarios donde se graduo como Licenciada en Comunicacion Social. Labora para Enacal chichigalpa desde hace 5 años en calidad de permanente, y se desempeña como analista de cobranza. Cabe mencionar que antes de que ella asumiera el cargo que tiene actualmente, se desempeñaba como conserje en donde ella se dedicaba a mantener las oficinas impecables. Hoy dia se encuentra contenta, ya que la empresa le dio la oportunidad dandole un puesto que acorde a su nivel profesional. Ademas nos comentaba que se desempeña como locutora de radio, ya que es algo que le fascina realizar en una radio chinandegana. Una de sus metas es lograr terminar de construir su casa con la ayuda de los creditos que hasta el momento han sido de gran ayuda para tener una vivienda mas digna .
texts.en: Isabel is 38 years old, married, and has a school-aged daughter.  She's lived in the city of Chichigalpa since she was born.  She studied at the university, where she graduated with a degree in social communication.  For 5 years, she has worked as a collections analyst for Enacal (The Nicaraguan Water Supply and Sewage public utility) in Chichigalpa.  It's worth mentioning that before she took over the job she currently has, she used to work as a janitor.  In that job, she maintained the offices in perfect condition.  Today she is content, because the company gave her an opportunity, giving her a position suitable for her professional education.  In addition, she comments that she also works as a radio announcer, because she loves to perform on the Chinandegana radio. One of her goals is to finish building her house with the help of the loans that, up until now, have been a great help to her, enabling her to have a more decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, sand, and cement).

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Celedonia is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celedonia's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Celedonia has restarted her  and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Celedonia has taken a PHP 9660 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Celedoniais committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en:
Zohra is a 55-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 18 years. He is the only one responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Zohra's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business.  But due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products to resell. Therefore, Zohra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and help him to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. 

Zohra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, tea and cooking oil for her husband's business.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 25-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband has been running his welding shop for the past 10 years. He is responsible for feeding his entire family and fulfilling their needs.

Saba's husband has to purchase different types of tools and welding accessories for his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he cannot afford to purchase these items.

Therefore, Saba has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase this merchandises to fulfill his business needs. This loan will also help her husband to increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profitable income.

Saba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and welding accessories for her husband

loans.name: M. Ahmed

texts.en:
M. Ahmed is a 37-year-old man. He lives with his parents and sibling in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. He owns a shop in his community where he sells gas cylinders, burners, ovens, and electric heaters. He purchases these items from manufacturers on order and sells them from his shop. He has been running this enterprise from many years and getting a lot of experience in the business. He is the sole earner for his entire family. He cares for his family because his father has grown old and his sibling is still too young. He does not have any other source of income except this enterprise. There has been a rapid increase in his household expenses and an increase in inflation. Therefore, he wants to grow his income as well. In fact he wants to provide a higher education to his sibling, which seems impossible in the absence of a healthy source of income. His current business is proving insufficient for generating the desired income to meet his household expenses and to bear the educational expenses of his sibling.
 
He wants to grow his business so he can prove himself a good son by providing a better living standard and higher education to his sibling. However, he is unable to grow his business without some capital. Therefore, M. Ahmed has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so he can buy more burners, ovens, cylinders, etc. for reselling. He hopes that this loan will prove productive and beneficial for his business, as well as for his family.
 
M. Ahmed thanks Kiva, its honorable lenders, and BRAC Pakistan for their honorable support.

loans.use: To buy more burners, gas cylinders, and electric heaters for resale.

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.en:
Cleotilde is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business for her food vending business.

Cleotilde has been in this business for 2 years. 

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
She is 45 years old and has six children. Edralyn is widow and has five children who are in school.

Edralyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Edralyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 9695.00 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

With your help, Edralyncan rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sugey De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Sugey tiene la edad de 28 años, es casada y su esposo labora para la zona franca Yazaki como obrero,tiene un hijo que esta en edad escolar, ella es nacida y criada en la ciudad de posoltega. Cuenta con una mini pulperia desde hace 2 años en donde vende de todo tipo de productos ( granos basicos, mini libreria, venta de medicamentos, chiberias, gaseosas, enlatados) ya que sus clientes siempre le estan demandando estos productos. Nos comentaba que antes de tener esta mini pulperia se dedicaba a la costura (confeccion de ropa de niños y adultos)y contaba con venta de hielo, bolis y choco bananos.Desde muy niña le a gustado trabajar porque eso le enseño su mamá.
