El credito ha sido de gran ayuda porque le ha permitido invertir aun mas en su negocio y en un nuevo producto (ropa interior)para mantener siempre fiel a su clientela. Doña Sugey es una mujer con deseos de superacion, emprendedora y luchadora.
texts.en:
Sugey is 28 years old, and she is married.  Her husband works in the Yazaki free trade zone as a workman.  She has a school age child.  She was born and raised in the city of Posoltega.  She has had a small grocery store for two years.  She sells all types of products (basic grains, mini-bookstore, medications, snacks, soft drinks, and canned goods).  Her customers are always demanding these products.  

She tells us that before having the mini-grocery store she made clothes for children and adults.  She had a business selling ice, ice pops, and chocolate bananas.  She has liked working since she was a girl because her mother taught her this.

The loan has been a big help because it has allowed her to invest even more in her business and in a new product (underwear).  She did this to maintain her customers' loyalty.  Sugey is a woman with the desire to improve.  She is enterprising and tenacious.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marife is 40 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marife's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what Marife lost. She is taking out a PHP 9605 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Marife has been with NWTF since 2 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Marife would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco es un señor de 56 años que se dedicó por muchos años a la agricultura, habita en el caserío San Ramón del municipio de El Sauce donde tiene 13 años de vivir desde que lo damnificaron para el huracán Mitch, porque habitaba en el cerro el guayabo donde debido a las lluvias su casita se le derrumbó.
Desde entonces su vida ha cambiado gracias a la bendición de Dios encontró trabajo como operario de limpieza en las calles de dicho municipio y a pesar de ganar tan poco se conforma porque lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar.
Don José Francisco en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para Compra de medicamentos, realización de exámenes con el fin de mejorar la salud de su esposa.
Con este objetivo se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento de los inversionistas de kiva que sabe que apoyan al más necesitado y tal es su caso porque con lo poco que gana apenas ajusta para la alimentación.
Confía en Dios que estas personas financien su crédito para que su esposa mejore su salud.
texts.en: Jose Francisco is a 56 year old man who worked in agriculture for many years, and lives in the village of San Ramon in the municipality of El Sauce. For 13 years he's lived there after being displaced by Hurricane Mitch from where he used to live in the hills of El Guayabo, where the rainfall caused his house to collapse. Ever since, his life has changed by the grace of God because he found work as a street cleaning operator in the aforementioned municipality. In spite of making very little he's satisfied that he puts food on his household's table. Jose Francisco currently needs a loan to purchase medication and have exams done, for the purpose of improving his wife's health. With this purpose in mind he went to the Ceprodel office to seek financing from Kiva lenders, because he knows they support the most needy and that's just the situation he finds himself in because the little he makes barely suffices for food. He has faith in God that they will finance his loan so his wife's health can improve.

loans.use: To purchase medication and have exams done

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 52 years old and living with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Her husband is providing polishing services for newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose, he uses a floor-polishing machine. He has been providing these services for many years. A few days ago, his floor-polishing machine failed due to fluctuations in the electricity. Nusrat's husband wants to buy a new machine but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy it. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a new floor-polishing machine so that he can continue his services smoothly. 

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a floor-polishing machine

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amalia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Amalia would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Reyna De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Reyna de Jesús es una señora de 56 años, casada, madre de cinco hijos todos independientes, habita en la comarca La Palma ubicada a 10 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce donde nació y creció bajo el seno de una familia humilde, campesina pero bien trabajadora que se dedicaban a la agricultura.
Doña Reyna con el objetivo de salir adelante y no quedarse solo como ama de casa optó por estudiar Magisterio para desempeñarse como profesora de primaria, profesión que ha ejercido por muchos años y que le ha permitido preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos los que hoy son hombres y mujeres de bien.
En este momento doña Reyna necesita que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le apoyen financiándole un crédito para mejorar su salud con el cual comprará medicina y se realizará ultrasonidos para ver qué es lo que le está afectando su salud.
Pone sus esperanzas en manos del señor para que ilumine a estas personas de buen corazón y con el crédito pueda mejorar su salud siempre con la ayuda del señor.
texts.en:
Doña Reyna de Jesus is a 56-year-old married mother of five children, all of whom are independent. She lives in the La Palma district which is located 10 kilometers from El Sauce, the town where she was born and raised by a humble, rural, and hard-working family of farmers.

Doña Reyna chose to study teaching in order to get ahead and not be alone as a homemaker. She became a primary school teacher, a profession she has practiced for many years, and which has allowed her to prepare her children to be the professional men and women they are today.

Dona Reyna currently needs Kiva investors, through Ceprodel, to support her financially with a loan to buy medicine and for an ultrasound to see what is affecting her health.

She is putting her hopes in the hands of the Lord to enlighten people of good heart, so that with the loan she can improve her health with the help of God.

loans.use: to buy medicine and receive an ultrasound

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is married and has a buy and sell fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fertilized duck egg to sell.

Raquel has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Raquel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fertilized duck egg to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jocelyn has restarted her  and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 7100 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jocelyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future she will save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 33 years old and has five children.  Salvacion is married and has three children who are in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Salvacion is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 8600.00 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

With your help, Salvacioncan rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: M. Saleem

texts.en:
M. Saleem is a 38-year-old married father of three children. He is living happily with his family in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. 

M. Saleem owns a clothing shop in the market where he sells fancy and high quality clothes. Some customers prove very poor and they do not purchase after asking the rates. He does not compromise on his quality and rates. He does not sell below his purchasing power but he does not like to refuse his worthy customers either. To win their confidence and to avoid the disappointment of his worthy customers; he wants to start a low rate clothing stall in front of his shop. This way, poor customers who do not have enough purchasing power can buy clothing easily.
 
M. Saleem invests his savings and profit in his current business but does not have enough cash in hand to start the new stall. For this reason, he wants financial support from Kiva. He contacted the field partner BRAC Pakistan who is the middleman between Kiva and the borrowers. 

M. Saleem is very delighted and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 32 years old and with four children, three of whom in school, Julie works very hard to provide for them.

Julie's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Julie has restarted her  and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 8350 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Julieis committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit-selling business. He has been selling fruit for many years. He sells seasonal fresh fruit in his hometown. He uses a four-wheeled manual cart for selling. As a hawker, he can easily reach out to people. His children are growing and so are their needs. To cope with the rapid increase in school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses; he wants to grow his business but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy fruit in bulk.

Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy fresh and seasonal fruit to sell. Allah Rakhi wants to save the excess profit and use this savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fresh and seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 38-year-old married woman living with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a bakery in their hometown where he sells all kinds of cakes, rusks, milk packs, biscuits, and juices. He purchases his inventories in a large quantity from a nearby bakery and sells it from his bakery. Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers but does not have sufficient income to buy these additional sweets.
 
Therefore, Shahida has requested a loan so that her husband can buy his desired sweets to sell. He wants to prepare these sweets at home in the future, so that he can earn the maximum income. He will save some of the profit and hopes in the future he will prepare all the sweets by himself. 

Shahida thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy additional sweets to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 46, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste papers, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and selling them to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to the household expenses, he does not have money to buy scrap goods and does not have a previous stock of scrap to sell to get money.

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband to buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet any sudden needs or incidents.
 
She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for resale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a hardworking person who is helping his family by providing tailoring services in his community. He has been doing this for many years. He knows the techniques of stitching very well. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns enough to lead a decent life. He has been doing his tailoring business at home for many years but now he wants to open a tailoring shop in the market.  For the tailoring business, he wants to buy a new sewing machine but he does not have money for this purpose. Therefore, Nasreen requested a loan for her husband to buy a new sewing machine for his tailoring shop.

Nasreen is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the leader of Nasreen's Group. She is a 52-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a very hard-working man and he loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to have a regular income for the family. He is involved in making and selling furniture, such as single beds and tables. He started this business from a young age, now he has grown old and weak, as well.  

Today, Nasreen's husband has many regular customers and he also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for her husband, but her family's needs are increasing day by day and she needs more money to afford household expenses. 

Now, Nasreen wants to buy more raw materials for her husband to make furniture in order to expand the business. This is why she came to BRAC Pakistan and she wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband can buy raw materials, such as chip boards, timbers, and planks for marking furniture. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for his business, as well as for his family.

Nasreen gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband to make furniture.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 38-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a garment business. His practice is to buy fabric from wholesalers, then sew the garments and sell them into the market. He has lot of customers who like to buy garments from him. 
Due to the new customers the demand is increasing day by day but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more fabric. Therefore, Nabeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partners BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more fabric to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeat loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already taken the loan from BRAC and is investing in the business. She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fabric to sew garments.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children.

Her husband is a very hard working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers types of delicious foods. He has been running this restaurant for many years and has generated a reasonable income from this business. He cooks delicious food for the people who like to eat in his restaurant. 

The condition of his restaurant is not good; there are scratched walls, poor seating arrangements, and a dark room; in addition there are no electrical supplies available. Customers have to face these problems and feel hesitant to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his valued customers.  

Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can properly upgrade the restaurant with white wash, new furniture and electrical wiring.  She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support.

loans.use: to upgrade the restaurant with white wash, new furniture and electrical wiring

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is 24-year-old lady. She is married and passing her life with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery materials for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles, and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive, but its turnover is very high. 

Due to high cost, he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Amna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can overcome the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount he will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones, and pearls of various colors.

Amna is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Julio Emilio

texts.es:
Don Julio pertenece al municipio de  Niquinohomo, municipio que fue elegido para el programa de creación de alianzas para el fortalecimiento de las capacidades locales para el saneamiento de Nicaragua, es casado, con  53 años de edad, de oficio Sastre, posee un pequeño taller de sastrería y a la vez venta de frutas.  Su núcleo familiar lo conforman su esposa y sus tres hijas,  una menor de edad. 
Actualmente están aplicando para el proyecto de agua y saneamiento, a través de  un financiamiento para   instalar un  sistema de mejoramiento de cerramiento lavamanos y ducha con su acabado, esto lo requiere  ya que por donde el habita no es posible el acceso a aguas negras, por lo que para su uso la familia cuenta con una  letrina, siendo su familia una de la miles que no tienen acceso al  saneamiento mejorado, con este proyecto que esta beneficiando a varios municipios del país, le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida  y  también contribuir con el medio ambiente. 
Sin la oportunidad de este crédito es imposible que Julio tenga acceso a un inodoro ya que es muy costoso. Estos programas vienen ayudar a familias en condiciones mas pobres, las letrinas causan enfermedades y contaminan el medio ambiente, es por ello que nace la idea de crear estas soluciones dirigidas al sector más pobres.
texts.en:
Julio lives in the municipality of Niquinohomo, a place that was chosen for a program of building partnerships to improve the sanitation of Nicaragua.  Julio is married, 53 years old, and works as a tailor.  He has a small tailoring workshop and he also has a business selling fruit.  His nuclear family consists of his wife and their three daughters, one of whom is a minor.

At this time, Julio is applying to the water and sanitation project.  Through this loan, he will install a better sanitation system for his enclosed bathroom, including a sink and a finished shower.  They need this because where they live they do not have access to sewer lines.  The family uses a latrine because they are miles away from improved sanitation facilities.  With this project, which is benefiting various municipalities in the country, they will be able to have a better quality of life and also contribute to improving the environment.  

Without the opportunity of this loan it would be impossible for Julio to buy a toilet, as they are very expensive.  These programs are helping the families in the poorest conditions.  The latrines cause illnesses and contaminate the environment.  This is why the idea was developed to create these solutions directed at the poorest neighborhoods.

loans.use: to improve his enclosed bathroom: to buy a toilet, and to buy materials such as sand, stones, tile, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is passing her life with her husband. She is an educated lady. She has been running a private school in the town for the last twenty years. She is trying to provide quality education to the children. 

Due to her personal interest in the school, it has been showing good results every year. Now she feels that some furniture is not usable for school. So she requested a BRAC loan to buy furniture for her school. In this way, she would be able to provide good seating facilities for the students. Uzma is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy school furniture.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is aged 50, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family. She is the mother of four children; her one son has gotten married and is living separately. She is living with her three children and spouse. 

To manage her household expenses, Azra owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Azra and her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Azra wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her so that she can contribute her income by sewing clothes.

Therefore, Azra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a new Juki sewing machine for her younger daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. Azra thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a juki machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Nyeleni Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Nyeleni ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, macaronis, échalotes, Maggi…), jus, draps et habits. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Mademoiselle Neh (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons, macaronis, échalotes, Maggi, tomates concentrées…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 boites de tomates concentrées de tomate,  5 sacs d’échalotes, 10 sacs d’oignons, 15 paquets de macaroni, 8 corbeilles de tomates et 7cartons de cubes Maggi en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Neh compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the Nyeleni group are married women mainly living in monogamous  families. On the average, they are 37 years old, with three children. They all live in Kanadjiguila in the Mandé community, the municipality of Kati and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work as vendors at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members sell condiments (onions, pasta, shallots, Maggi cubes etc), juice, linens and clothing. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Neh (the one standing on the far right in the photo)  is a well-known vendor of condiments (onions, pasta, shallots, Maggi cubes, tomato paste etc). She plans to use her loan to buy wholesale in Bamako 10 boxes of tomato paste, five bags of shallots, 10 bags of onions, 15 packs of pasta, eight basket of tomatoes and seven cartons of Maggi cubes. She sells retail in Kanadjiguila, as a street vendor, mainly to female customers. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Neth plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 85,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and cover some minor household expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su rostro ya no pertenece al banco comunal Los Alamos de la Estacion.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of communal bank “Los álamos de la estación.” This group is from the Urcos district, located in Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Tania is in a relationship. She is 35 and has two children. She owns a grocery store and sells staple food such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. Tania has been doing this for five years and does very well. Her dream is to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The woman whose face is covered with a circle is no longer a member of the communal bank. The remaining members sell clothes, cakes, groceries or have a restaurant.

Tania wants to thank those who through this means make part of her dream. She promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ume Kalsoom

texts.en: Ume Kalsoom is a 50-year-old married woman. She is the mother of seven sons. Her husband is a government employee. She has started a clothing business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. Presently she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to lack of finances, she is facing a problem. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing for resale

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 28-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is the mother of three children. 

Shabana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker and an expert at his profession.  He has has a lot of experience as a shoe maker because he has been manufacturing shoes for many years.  He sews leather and rexine shoes through a machine and then hand stitches the sole.  He earns income for his family through shoe making.  

He has been making shoes at home, but now has established a shop to continue his business on a larger scale.  However, he does not have enough money to buy the initial raw materials such as raw leather for making shoes. Therefore, Shabana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy raw leather material for making shoes.  She is thankful to Kiva and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw leather material for making shoes.

loans.name: Mehboob

texts.en:
Mehboob, age 45, is a mother of five children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that, his wife, Mehboob, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of new embroidery materials. Mehboob is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes and embroidery accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as sand, grit, cement, blocks, iron, gravel, a toilet. accessories, etc.

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
La Joven María José,  posee un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios como es  pollo y papa frita en su casa de habitación, desde hace tres años, es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo, ella realiza esta labor para   el sustento de su familia. 

La Joven María José, inicia  sus labores desde las 11 am finalizando a la 9 pm todos los días de lunes a domingo en  este mismo horario.
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel fue utilizado para comprar mochila, zapatos, media de Niñas, camisolín y camiseta,  ya que además de vender pollo y papa frita vende ropa de forma ambulante para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
This young woman named María José has had a business selling food products such as chicken and french fries from her home for three years. She is the mother of 4 children but only 2 live with her. She does this work to support her family.

Young María José opens for business at 11 am and closes at 9 pm every day from Monday to Sunday with the same schedule. 

She has applied for this loan from CEPRODEL to buy backpacks, shoes, girls' stockings, camisoles, and shirts to sell door-to-door in addition to her chicken and french fries business to increase her income and improve the standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to start a new business selling clothing

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 51 years old and married with two children. Melva works very hard to provide for them.

Melva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melva has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Melva would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 37-year-old woman, and mother of four children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, selling fruits such as apples, bananas, and grapes, the income from which is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the house hold.

Kiran's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for resale so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit.  However, due to an unfavorable financial position he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purposes.  Therefore, Kiran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruits for resale.

loans.name: Octavio Benito

texts.es:
El Señor Octavio Benito se dedica a la elaboración de prenda tales como cadena, arete anillo y venta de relojes desde hace veinticinco años, es padre de  seis hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo,  realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su pequeña familia. 
 
Don Octavio inicia sus labores a las 8 am y finaliza a las 4 pm de lunes a sábados en este mismo horario.

Octavio Benito utilizo este crédito para Compra  de bloque, cemento, arena, piedrín y hierro  para realizarle   mejoras a  su vivienda, y así lograr a tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Octavio Benito has been making jewellery like chains, rings, earrings and selling watches for the past 25 years. He in the father of 6 children, only one of whom is still dependent on him. This is how he supports his small family. Octavio works Monday to Saturday from 8 am until four in the afternoon.

Octavio Benito will use this loan to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, gravel and re-bar to make improvements on his home and have a dignified place to live.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, gravel and re-bar.

loans.name: Luisa Damaris

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa Damaris  es madre soltera de dos hijos,  posee un negocio de venta de productos varios  de forma ambulante, se dedica a este negocio desde hace dieciséis   años para ayudar a su esposo en el sustento del hogar.

Doña Luisa Damaris inicia a ofertar su producto desde las 7 am finalizando a las 3 pm de lunes a sábado y los domingos  hasta el mediodía. 
  
El  crédito que  solicito a Ceprodel lo utilizo para comprar  tazas, platos, cucharas de  melanina, lámpara recargables, cuchillos y productos de aluminio por mayor lo que  le permite obtener mayores ventas y así lograr más ingresos y continuar  incrementando cada días más  su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Luisa Damaris is a single mother of two. She has a business selling various products as an ambulant vendor. She has dedicated herself to this business for sixteen years to help her husband support the household. 

Luisa Damaris begins her sales from 7 am to 3 pm from Monday until Saturday. On Sunday she sells until noon.

The loan she requested from CEPRODEL will be used to buy cups, plates, plastic spoons, rechargeable lights, knives, and wholesale aluminum products which will allow her to get more sales and earn more profits. She can continue to grow her working capital everyday.

loans.use: to purchase housewares to sell.

loans.name: Antonio Cruz

texts.es: Antonio es un señor emprendedor con visión al desarrollo, es productor pecuario, siendo la actividad principal  la producción de lechera en mediana escala, con 25 años de experiencia en el ramo, además tiene en su casa  un negocio de venta de concentrado y huevos la cual involucra a la esposa, es casado con un hijo  que ya es independiente,  actualmente tiene la necesidad de incrementar la producción para cubrir la demanda, por tal razón visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el objetivo planteado, ya que este señor ha obtenido  9 créditos con la empresa los que le han ayudado a fortalecer la unidad  productiva familiar y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Antonio is an industrious man with an enterprising vision. He raises livestock and his main activity is the production of milk on a medium scale. He has 25 years of experience in the industry. He also has a home business of selling animal feed and eggs which involves his wife and his grown son. He currently has the need to increase production to meet demand. For this reason, he has visited the office of CEPRODEL to apply for funding to achieve his stated goals. This gentleman has already completed 9 loan cycles with CEPRODEL that have helped strengthen the family production unit and improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three milking cows.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single young man from Deir El balah.  He lives with his mother in a small simple house.  His mother works as an employee at a local firm and she earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student at a local university where he studies engineering. He would like to finish his studies and find a good job in the future. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework using advanced engineering programs. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Abida's Group

texts.en: Abida is a 43-year-old woman and the mother of seven children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables like potatoes, onions, garlic, and tomatoes. He is only responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Abida's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables to resell so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business. Therefore Abida has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables for the purpose of reselling

loans.name: Mayra Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Mayra tiene la edad de 36 años, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar, esta con su compañero de vida el cual es obrero, ella habita en una comunidad llamada el Tololar. Mayra labora para una institucion del estado desde hace 10 años, en donde se desempeña como conserje, la cual tiene asignada una area en especifico para mantenerla impecable. Nos comento que antes de trabajar en la Alcaldia estudiaba su secundaria y a la vez laboraba como empleada domestica, ya que tenia que mantener a sus hijos. Debido a sus escasos recursos ella a recurrido a los creditos y que a su vez han sido de gran ayuda, ya que le han permitido realizar mejoras en su casa de habitacion, tambien le han servido para los gastos medicos de su mama ya que le realizaron una cirujia y para comprarle sus medicinas.
Mayra tiene como meta terminar su casa siempre con la ayuda de los creditos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en: Mayra is 36 years old. She has two children who are school-aged. Her partner is a laborer. She works in a community called the Tololar. She has worked for a state institution for 10 years where she works as a janitor. She is assigned a specific area to keep it in immaculate condition. She told us that before she worked this job at City Hall, she studied in high school and worked as a housemaid until she had to support her children. Because of their scare economic resources, she has turned to loans and has used them in helpful ways. They have enabled her to make improvements to her home and also to pay her mother's medical expenses to cover a surgery and medicines. Mayra aims to finish her house with the help of loans. She wants to improve the quality of life of herself and her children.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and medical appointments

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single young man from Deir El balah.  He lives with his parents, two brothers and five sisters in a small simple house. His father works as an employee at a local firm and he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud is a student at a local university where he studies English literature.  He would like to finish his studies and find a good job in the future. 

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and read articles.
 
Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oranges, watermelon, cocona, beans, etc.

loans.name: Aldren

texts.en: Aldren  has been in his business retailing and buying charcoal in their village to make a living. with his generated income, he successfully repay his previous loan used for buying more coconut shells. Aside from this, Aldren was able to start selling grocery items in their village and he earns more income for the family. Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He  wants to expand his business and use his returns to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCA FUERTE”  iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño, costura de polleras, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de comida, elaboración de peluches, venta de edredones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta material de limpieza; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia al observar que estos productos son muy vendidos en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de materiales de limpieza por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago del crédito, pues de aprender, puede visitar el consultorio y se reúne con sus amigas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ROCA FUERTE" ["Strong Rock"] begins their tenth cycle in ProMujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. The group consists of nine members headed by a board of which Patricia is President. Businesses that the members of this communal bank have are varied and include selling freeze-dried potatoes, sewing skirts, selling clothing, selling fruit, selling food, manufacturing stuffed animals, and selling quilts.

This loan will benefit a small entrepreneur like Patricia. She began working with ProMujer a year ago, entering on the invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her home. Today, she has a business selling cleaning materials. She reports that she began this business several years ago on her own initiative upon observing that these items are commonly sold in the market. 

This loan will provide an increase in working capital to buy wholesale cleaning materials in the shops of El Alto which will later be sold in her own retail space. This manner of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is a single mother of 4 children.

When asked what she likes about ProMujer, she says that she likes the meetings of  the group to make payments and to learn. She can visit the office to meet up with her friends.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 20-year-old single young man from Deir El balah. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee at a local firm and he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mahmoud is a student at a local university where he studies institution security.  He would like to finish his studies and find a good job in the future. 

Mahmoud took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and read articles.
 
Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is single and is studying in a university taking up Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. She became a new GDMPC member this current month. To buy books and transportation costs, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance. James wants to finish his studies and had a dream of working abroad in the near future.

loans.use: to buy books and transportation costs

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is single and is studying in a university taking up Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. His first loan was used books and transportation costs. James also had a second loan which he used to pay for the school tuition fees. James wants to finish his studies and had a dream of working abroad in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Carmelita is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like can goods, vegetables, egg, spices, etc for her food vending business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like can goods, vegetables, egg, spices, etc

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida works hard to support her family. Brigida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Brigida requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, tablia, coconut milk, baking powder etc..

Brigida has been in this business for 34 years now.

In the future, Brigida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy ingredients like rice, tablia, coconut milk, baking powder etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maricel is 30 years old and has four children who are in school.

Maricel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, rice, etc.

Maricel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, rice, etc

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato  has been managing his own farm to earn a living. With his generated income, he provides the family needs and had repay his previous loan successfully. He also has had engaged in a transportation business in their community. Recently, he took a new loan to cover motorcycle repair. He dreams to help his children fulfill their ambition to complete their education.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle repair

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 52 years old and has seven children. Nonita is married and has one child in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nonita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy piglet and additional feeds for her pigs.

Nonita has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglet and additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. Margie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase egg, milk, sugar, rice powder, coconut milk, etc for her business.

Margie has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase egg, milk, sugar, rice powder, coconut milk, etc for her business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sarah is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sarah has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is fifty six years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dioscora's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dioscora is taking out a bridge loan amounting to PHP 5000 to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Dioscorais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, egg, can goods, etc

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 26-year-old, married woman and leader of Razia's Group. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. 

Her husband recently started to drive a moto-rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and to cover small distances. Its body is made of polyester which is not strong enough to bear jerks over roads. Now, the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it’s rattling during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for the moto-rickshaw.

Razia has requested a loan, so that her husband can buy the moto-rickshaw body and he can drive it smoothly.  Razia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new body for her husband's moto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz es una clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Maria de la Luz tiene 34 años y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. A ella le gusta birlar en sus tiempos libres, hacer servilletas ó algún pedido que le hacen para alguna fiesta, también le gusta escuchar música. Ella vende donas y leche desde hace más de 5 años, tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende donas y leche en las mañanas, pero esta pidiendo el préstamo para salir a vender en las tardes y ofrecer a demás de donas, churros y empanadas. 
Se considera una persona trabajadora, responsable y honesta. Esta pidiendo un pequeño préstamo porqué siente que lo va a poder pagar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Maria de la Luz is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story. 

Maria de la Luz is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two children. In her free time she likes to bowl, make napkins or fill orders for parties, and she also likes to listen to music. She has been selling donuts and milk for more than 5 years, and has a small stall where she sells them in the mornings, but she is requesting this loan so that she can go out and sell in the afternoons and offer churros and empanadas in addition to donuts. She is considered to be a hard-working, responsible and honest person. She is requesting a small loan because she feels she will be able to repay it without any problems.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to sell donuts

loans.name: Linda Yanira

texts.es: Ella es LIinda Yanira el proyecto es poner a funcionar un spa cuando termine de estudiar, la idea es dar el trabajo a conocer, quiere aprender técnicas levantamiento de busto, maquillaje, ya que le gusta mucho, quiere aprender diferentes métodos para así poderse especializar en este medio de estética corporal, a manejado en salones muchas técnicas de maquillaje y le han servido para la vida, quiere ser parte de este equipo el cual enseña a personas como ella a pensar en un futuro diferente, el cual es muy importante para ella, desea de todo corazón poder contar con la ayuda de kiva, ya que en estos momentos no me puede pagar el semestre completo.
texts.en: This borrower is Linda Yanira, and her project is to open a spa when she finishes her studies. The idea is to learn bust-lifting and makeup techniques, which she really enjoys. She wants to learn different methods so that she can specialize in body aesthetics. In salons, she has learned many makeup techniques and they have been very useful in her life. She wants to be part of the team that teaches people like herself to think of a different future, which is very important for her. She wishes with all her heart to receive Kiva's support, because at this time she is not able to pay her whole semester's tuition upfront.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Barrio Sucre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Barrio Sucre está formado por 10 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió y su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, esta parroquia se caracteriza por su estructura de sus casas que están construidas de adobe y teja, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Leonor,  forman parte de grupo de crédito Barrio Sucre desde hace 5 años, en todo este tiempo ha llegado a fortalecer la amistad con todas sus vecinas, los créditos le ayudan a mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar y a salir adelante.
La Señora Leonor tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos de la casa.
Doña Leonor trabaja desde su casa en el oficio que aprendió de sus padres el cual es la crianza de animales,  tiene cerdos y gallinas. También se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 12 años, vende comida 4 días a la semana. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de víveres y también para la compra de cerdos. Su meta es de tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre group is made up of 10 female members who live around the Cumbe neighborhood of Cuenca, a cold neighborhood with warm-hearted people. They have preserved their local culture and traditions, and the neighborhood is known for the structure of its houses, which are made of adobe and have terra cotta roofs. The local people work in animal husbandry and agriculture, and many also do different kinds of work in the city.

One of the group members is Señora Leonor, who has been a member of the Barrio Sucre group for the last five years. Throughout that time, she has strengthened her friendship with her neighbors, and loans have enabled her to achieve more household economic stability and to get ahead in life. 

Señora Leonor is 31 years old and single with no children. She lives at home with her mother, with whom she shares the household expenses. Leonor works from home raising animals (pigs and chickens), a trade she learned from her parents. She has also been working 4 days a week selling food for the last 12 years. She will use her loan money to buy foodstuffs and pigs. Her goal is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and pigs

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a  Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be tolerant and a risk taker. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water. She will use the Kes 13000 loan to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: La Estancia  (Paute) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito La Estancia está formado por 8 socias quienes son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido, trabajan en diferentes actividades y en especial en trabajos del campo, como se desempeñan en diferentes actividades estas les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute, cantón que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes y varios lugares para visitar, su clima que es muy cálido, tiene variedad en su gastronomía típica y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmita,  se encuentra desde hace 4 años en el grupo de crédito La Estancia, este tiempo le ha permitido mejorar la amistad con todas sus compañeras del grupo.
La Señora Carmita tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de 7 años que esta estudiado en una escuelita de la localidad, vive en con su mamá, con quien comparte los gastos del hogar, la casa es propiedad de su mamá. 
Doña Carmita pasa en casa y se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas que son la principal fuente de sus ingresos, también cría pollos y cuyes que los vende en su comunidad o en la ciudad. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de varias marcas. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y cosméticos. Su sueño es que su hijo llegue hacer un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The La Estancia group is made up of 8 female members who are friendly, courteous and warm-hearted people that work in a range of activities, mainly field work. Since they do different kinds of work, they are able to contribute to their household economies and get ahead in life with their families. The live on the outskirts of the Paute region, a region that is known for the beauty of its landscapes and its many places to visit. Its climate is quite warm, its local cuisine is varied and its people have retained the local culture and traditions. 

Señora Carmita is one of the group members. For the last 4 years, she has been a member of the La Estancia group, and during that time she has been able to develop closer friendships with the other group members. Señora Carmita is 27 years old, and is the single mother of a 7-year-old boy who studies in a local school. She lives with her mother, with whom she shares household expenses, though the house belongs to her mother. Carmita spends time at home and works in agriculture, planting vegetables, which are her main source of income. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community or in the city. In her free time, she sells various brands of cosmetics. She will use her loan money to buy chickens, guinea pigs and cosmetics. Her dream is for her son to grow up to be a good professional.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and cosmetics

loans.name: Gladys Susana

texts.es:
La Señora. Gladys forma parte del grupo de crédito San Luís de Cumbe desde hace un año, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza. 
La Señora. Gladys tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad, su esposo labora en la construcción, la casa en la que viven es propiedad de su padre.
Doña Gladys se dedica al trabajo que aprendió de sus padres que es la agricultura y la crianza de animales como: cuyes, pollos, cerdos y en especial la ganadería, estos animalitos los vende en su comunidad. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar cuyes, pollos y  alimento de animales. Su meta es tener su negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Gladys has been a member of the San Luis de Cumbe group for the last year. She lives on the outskirts of Cumbe Parish in Cuenca, a parish that has a cold climate but warm-hearted people who work in animal husbandry and agriculture. The parish has beautiful places to visit and admire nature's beauty. 

Señora Gladys is 23 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has two children who are 2 and 3 years old, and her husband works in construction. The house where they live belongs to her father. Gladys works in agriculture and animal husbandry, trades she learned from her parents. She raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and especially cattle, and sells them in her community. The loan money will be used to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed. Her goal is to have her own business, such as a store.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Juvy works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Juvy is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make a dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Juvy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make a dried fish

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 70 years old and widowed with four children.

Angeles works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, etc.

Angeles has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Angeles aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 37 years old and married with four children, three of whom in school, Ailyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ailyn's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ailyn is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Ailyn has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Ailynis committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, egg, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 52 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alicia has a general store business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Alicia requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, bread, chips, egg, etc to restart her business activities.

Alicia has been in this business for 4 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, bread, chips, egg, etc

loans.name: Auxilia

texts.en:
Auxilia is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Auxilia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Auxilia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is 49 years old and married with six children, three of whom in school, Charito works very hard to provide for them.

Charito's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Charito is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Charitois committed to rebuild, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, chips, noodles, etc

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is  25 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Cherry Mae requested a PHP 3000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy spare parts like tire, paints, etc for the maintenance of her bicycle.

Cherry Mae has been in this business for 4 years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Cherry Mae would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: buy spare parts like tire, paints, etc for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Elizabeth is taking out a bridge loan to restart her butcher shop business.

Elizabeth has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her butcher shop business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of meat to sell. 

Elizabeth is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business .

loans.use: to buy more meat for her business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is 34 years old and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purhase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle transport.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purhase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Janice has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be determined and organized . She operates a salon where she offers hair dressing services. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her family challenge to be lack of modern toilet to serve the family . She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy cement, sand and other materials to build a modern toilet. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family health. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan  of kes 120,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy cement, sand and other materials to build a modern toilet

loans.name: Herlina

texts.en:
Herlina lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Herlina is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Herlina began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has around $16 – 17 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is widow and has a fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional duck egg to sell.

Lourdes has been in this business for 18 years now. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional duck egg to sell

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Abdoulaye est un cultivateur âgé de 36 ans il est marié et père de 3 enfants, il est établi dans le village de mbane, il a commencé à exercer cette activité de maraîchage d'onions de puis qu'il est tout petit avec ses parents, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il envisage à l'avenir d'augmenter sa production mais aussi sa surface cultivable afin d'avoir une production de qualité et gagner d'autres marchés au niveau des villages environnants.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a 36-year-old farmer, married with three children. He lives in the village of Mbane, and began gardening onions since he was little with his parents.

With this credit loan, he will buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer. 

In the future he plans to increase his production but also his acreage to have a quality production and spread to other markets in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa est un cultivateur âgé de 68 ans, il est marié et père de 8, il vit dans le village de mbane, il a commencé à exercer cette activité de maraîchage d'onions de puis qu'il est tout petit avec ses parents, avec ce prêt, il va acheter du semence d'onions, de l'engrais, d'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il compte augmenter sa production afin de pouvoir toucher d'autres villages environnants et augmenter sa clientèle.
texts.en: Moussa is a 68-year-old farmer.  He is married and the father of eight children.  He lives in a village called Mbane and has been growing onions since he was very young, with his parents.  He will use his loan to buy onion seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and compost.  His goal is to increase his agricultural output so that he can sell his production in nearby villages and have more customers.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and compost.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un cultivateur âgé de 29 ans établi dans le village de mbane, il est marié sans enfants, il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage depuis son enfance avec ses parents, avec ce prêt il va acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants mais il compte augmenter sa qualité de production et la quantité ce qui va lui permettre de toucher d'autres clients qui sont au niveau des villages environnants.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a 29-year-old farmer, living in the village of Mbane. He is married without children, and began this gardening activity in his childhood with his parents.

With this credit loan, he will buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer.

He hopes to increase both the quality and quantity of his production, which will enable him to reach other customers from the surrounding villages.

loans.use: buy onion seeds, herbicide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is 50 years old and living with her husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a catering services provider at ceremonies. He provides the decoration lights and wedding tents for weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is at peak but most of his tents have become clumsy due to lack of use. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers. Therefore, Nazeeran has requested a loan for her husband to buy new tents. Nazeeran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new wedding tents

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en: Mwangi is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be strong and a go getter. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a conducive environment and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and stock of shoes for sell in his business. The water storage facility will enable his family store clean water for domestic use. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a big shop. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and stock of shoes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a  Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be strong and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of goods. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and stock of shoes. The water storage facility will enable her family store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be wealthy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and stock of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cooking gas package

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be kind. She operates a green grocery where she sells groceries to earn income. She describes her family challenge to be lack of sufficient clean water.She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and stock of groceries. The water storage facility will enable her family store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and stock of groceries

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be polite. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries. She also operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water supply. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a water storage facility and buy stock of groceries. This will enable her family store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will purchase a piece of land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility and buy stock of groceries

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte desde hace 2 años del grupo de crédito San Luís de Cumbe, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza.
La Señora Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 21, 20, 16, 14, 9 y 6 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están casados y viven  independientes, su tercera hija trabaja y ayuda en casa, su cuarta hija pasa en casa ayudándole en los quehaceres y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y labora como jornalera todos los días, se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y gallinas, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar y la venta. El dinero de su crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para arreglar su casa. Su meta es tener más animales y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the credit group ´San Luis de Cumbe’ for two years.  She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Cumbe de Cuenca.  This area has a cold climate, but its people have a warm heart.  They work in commerce, raising animals and agriculture.  There are some nice places to see where you can enjoy the beauty of nature.

Rosa, 39, is a widow with six children aged 21, 20, 16, 14, 9 and 6.  Her first two children are married and live independently.  The 16 year-old daughter works and helps in the house while the 14 year-old daughter just helps with the household chores.  Her two youngest children study at the local primary school.  They all live together in their own home.

Rosa takes care of the house and also works as a land laborer every day.  She raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She also grows her food for the household or to sell.  With this loan she will buy building materials to repair her house.  Her goal in the future is to have more animals and extend her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Segunda Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora.
