Segunda es socia del grupo de crédito San Luís de Cumbe desde hace 2 años, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió pero su gente de un corazón muy cálido, quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, cuenta con hermosos lugares para visitar y admirar la belleza de la naturaleza. 
La Señora. Segunda tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 21, 16 y 14 años de edad, su primer hijo es discapacitado y pasa en casa, sus dos hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad.
Doña Segunda se dedica a las tareas del campo las mismas que aprendió de sus padres como es la agricultura y crianza de animales, este trabajo le da la oportunidad de pasar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales, para así continuar creciendo en esta actividad. Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Segunda has been a member of the credit group ‘San Luis de Cumbe’ for two years.  She lives on the outskirts of the parish of Cumbe de Cuenca.  Although this area has a cold climate, its people have a warm heart.  They generally work in commerce, raising of animals or agriculture.  The area boasts some picturesque places to see where you can enjoy the beauty of nature.

Seguna, 39, is a single mother with three children aged 21, 16 and 14.  Her first child is disabled and has to stay at home.  The other two children are studying at the local school.

Segunda follows on from her parents and works in agriculture and raising animals.  This job also allows her to spend time at home and look after her children.  She will use the money from the loan to invest in chickens, guinea pigs and animal food, so that she can continue progressing in this line of work.  Her aim is to be able to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, and food for her animals.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit membres du groupe Dembagnouma ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila (commune du Mandé /cercle de Kati) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, légumes (laitues, tomates et concombres), condiments, ustensiles de cuisine, ignames, restauration et  pagnes wax. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Balengue (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de légumes (laitue, tomates et concombres). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 corbeilles de tomates, 3 corbeilles de concombres et 15 corbeilles de laitues à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Balengue compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the eight members of the Dembagnouma group are on average 38 years old with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila (in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

The group members are retail traders of vegetables (lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers), condiments, kitchen utensils, yams, food preparations and pagnes wax (colorful West-African fabric). To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Balengue (the woman sitting in the second position from right to left in the photo) is a great vendor of vegetables (lettuce, tomatoes and cucumbers). She intends to use her loan to buy three baskets of tomatoes, three baskets of cucumbers, and 15 baskets of lettuce in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Balengue expects this loan will generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his new business and pay for professional marketing

loans.name: Maraimpun

texts.en:
Maraimpun lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Maraimpun is married and lives with more than six persons in the family home.
	
Maraimpun began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $8 - 9 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 22-year-old single young lady from a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. Her father works as a farmer on the family's land. This is the only source of income for the family. Fatmeh is a student in a local university where she studies English literature. She would like to finish her studies and find a good job as a teacher. 

Fatmeh took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Fatmeh will be able to complete her studies and take the BA degree.

Fatmeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Ani is married and lives with six persons in the family home.

Ani began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has around $44 – 45 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined and humble. He operates a clinic where he offers clinical services. He describes his family challenge to be lack of enough water storage facilities. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. He hopes that in the future, he will economically sustain his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan  of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows flowers for sell in a green house. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small scale customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility. This will enable her family store clean water for domestic use.. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility

loans.name: Cruz Edilma

texts.es:
Cruz, a sus 51 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante y esposa amorosa.
Durante 15 años ha trabajado como  vendedora ambulante, tiene una chaza en la que ofrece variedad de dulces, cigarrillos y mecato, esto le ha permitido generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de surtido para su chaza, como mecato, dulces, cigarrillos, gaseosas y otros, esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos y generar mejores ingresos por ventas.
Cruz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un negocio cerca de su casa, para así poder estar pendiente de su hogar, mientras trabaja por el bienestar de su familia, además sueña con ver a su hijo menor convertirse en un profesional idóneo y exitoso.
texts.en:
Cruz, 51, is a charismatic and hard-working woman.  She is the mother of three children who she has raised well and is married to a loving husband.

For 15 years she has worked as a street vendor.  She has got a small stall selling a variety of candies, cigarettes and snacks.  This has allowed her to generate an income to support her husband with the household expenses.

The loan she is asking for is to buy supplies for her stall such as snacks, candy, cigarettes, soft drinks and other things.  This will allow her to satisfy the customer demand and generate more profit from her sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her street stall such as snacks, candy, cigarettes, soft drinks and others.

loans.name: Hamam

texts.en:
Hamam is a 23-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as a farmer on the family's land. This is the only source of income for the family. Hamam is a student in a local university where he studies Marketing. He would like to finish his studies and find a good job in the future. 

Hamam took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Hamam will be able to complete his studies and take the BA degree.

Hamam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is charged with a responsibility of taking care of two children, one is attending school. She runs a salon and earns additional income from selling charcoal. 

She desires to grow her business into new market areas. However, limited capital and competition hinder her business.She needs a loan to buy braids, salon equipment and add some capital to the charcoal business.

loans.use: to buy braids, salon equipment and add some capital to the charcoal business.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es:
Henry es un hombre de 28 años de edad, con un carisma y don de gentes que lo impulsan a buscar el beneficio de las demás personas.
Desde el año 2006 comenzó su propio negocio de artesanías en madera y, luego de un tiempo inició su labor social llevando oportunidades de empleo a los presos de las cárceles de la ciudad, los reclusos trabajan por horas en busca de sentirse útiles mientras cumplen sus condenas, además con esta labor logran obtener una pequeña retribución económica y rebajas de pena por buena conducta, la labor se realiza todos los días con los respectivos permisos de la autoridad competente, y la producción es vendida en las calles de la ciudad, generando recursos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio y pagar la nómina de los reclusos.
El crédito solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima como madera y pinturas, con lo que podrá cumplir con la producción necesaria para satisfacer la demanda actual que sobrepasa los niveles de producción, así tendrá la capacidad de cumplir con los pedidos y mejorar las ganancias.
Henry manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder seguir apoyando a más personas que tienen privada su libertad, pues es una labor social que realiza con el corazón y le brinda alegría saber que tiene un impacto grande en la sociedad y en el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de los presos.
texts.en:
Henry, 28, is charismatic and charming young man who likes helping people to feel happy.

Since 2006, he has had his own wooden craft business.  Soon after setting up, he started a social project in which he offers work to the prisoners in the local prisons.  The inmates work for hours on crafts, allowing them to feel useful while they serve their sentences.  In addition, they get a small income from this work and reduction in their sentences if they show good behavior.  They do this work every day, under the supervision of the prison authorities.  Their products are sold on the streets in the city and the income from the sales is used to invest in the business and pay the prisoners’ wages.

The loan will be used to buy raw material such as wood and paint, which will allow them to increase production to satisfy the demand.  At the moment they are unable to meet the customer demand for their products, but they hope to be able to meet it soon and improve their income.

Henry says that his dream is to continue helping more people in the same situation.  He does this social work in good faith and he feels satisfaction knowing that it helps society in some way and improves the life of the prisoners.

loans.use: to raw materials such as wood and paint.

loans.name: Perry

texts.en:
Perry appreciates the great work that Kiva is doing in her community. Using the previous loan, Perry has already harvested profits from the cows that she bought and bred. The profits so far have paid tuition for her children who went back to school recently, 

She has applied for another loan to buy more cows that she will breed and later sell. She is hard-working and resilient. Thank you Kiva lenders for the great job done.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six membres du groupe Sabali ont en moyenne 26 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques (pommades, parfums et mèches), chaussures plastiques, sables, riz, ustensiles, boissons et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une vendeuse de produits cosmétiques (pommades, parfums et mèches) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 cartons parfums, 5 cartons de pommades et 10 paquets de mèches à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married in monogamous households, the six members of the Sabali group are on average 26 years old with three children. They all live in Kanadjiguila (in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.

The group members are retail traders of cosmetics (ointments, perfumes and hair extensions), plastic shoes, sand, rice, kitchen utensils, beverages and clothing. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Aminata (the woman at the far right in the photo) is a vendor of high-quality cosmetics (ointments, perfumes and hair extensions). She intends to use her loan to buy three cartons of perfumes, five cartons of ointments, and 10 packages of hair extensions in Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Kanadjiguila to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Aminata expects this loan will generate an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy cosmetics

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a trucking transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Lucy is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her trucking transport business for her trucking transport business.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her trucking transport business

loans.name: Walegnoumadon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Walegnoumadon est composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila (commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures, produits cosmétiques, sables, boissons et restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Hadiaratou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes pointures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 90 chaussures plastiques au grand marché. La revente se fait en espèce et à crédit à Kanadjiguila et parfois en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Hadiaratou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter son volume.
texts.en:
The Walegnoumadon group is mostly composed of married women in monogamous households. They average 30 years of age with four children. They all live in Kanadjiguila (in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle) and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Members of the group are retail merchants of plastic shoes (men and women) of all sizes, cosmetics, sand, beverages and food preparations. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Hadiaratou (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation in selling plastic shoes (men and women) of all sizes. She intends to use her loan to buy 90 pairs of plastic shoes at the main market. Retail sales are made ​​for cash and on credit in Kanadjiguila and sometimes as an itinerant vendor, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Hadiaratou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business to increase its volume.

loans.use: buy plastic shoes

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gina is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Gina has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as shampoo, soap, noodles, sugar, and other groceries. 

Ginais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo,toothpaste,soap,sugar,groceries,etc.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en: Naira is 33 years old married woman, from village Birliki. She has 7 members-family and the only source of family's income is from agricultural activity. They are involved in cultivating a plot of family owned agricultural land, where greens are grown. Naira sells it with local retailers and generates 200 GEL monthly. She has her loyal costumers and always has high quality products. In order to become her activity more profitable Naira wants to enlarge the assortment and start trading with fruits and vegetables also. She requested a loan and was approved with the start up program, that enables people to start or re-start businesses. Naira will purchase stock of fruits and vegetables and sell it at local market from her rented place. With the help of this new products she will be able to tackle financial difficulties more effectively and increase her family's living condition. Naira and her family rely on a good will of lenders and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start trading business with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 58 years old and has two children.  Lourdes is married and has children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Lourdes is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business, Lourdes requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

She has been for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

With your help, Lourdesis committed to rebuild her business. In future She  would like to save enough money to expand business .

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 40 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

Luzviminda's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Luzviminda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Luzviminda has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Luzvimindais committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business .

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, toothpaste ,soap, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Luz is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Luz has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, plastic, etc to restart her business activities.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 1 year and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, plastic, etc

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business Marilyn requested a PHP 5000 bridge loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 3 years now. With your help Marilyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 58 years old and married and she works very hard to help her husband to generate an income from family.

Susan's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Susan is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Susan has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Susanis committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, noodles, egg, milk, can goods, etc

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.fr: La cliente Rose est une vaillante commerçante et membre de la banque villageoise « Shalom », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse de poissons salés. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est un tailleur. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de poissons. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroître son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente accroupie porte son bébé sur le dos
texts.en:
Rose, age 50, is a valiant merchant and a member of the village bank Shalom. She's very energetic, and an experienced senior entrepreneur. She's the mother of nine children, who all go to school.

Rose sells salted fish. She sets up her products in a central market of the town. She started her business with help from her husband, who is a tailor. Later on, she benefited from a loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima.

She's been running this business for the past 22 years. This new loan will be used to buy two sacks of fish. Thus, she wishes to increase her working capital, feed her children, and send them to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

It has to be noted that one of the members crouching in the photograph is carrying her child on her back.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fish

loans.name: Thione

texts.fr:
Thione est un cultivateur âgé de 48 ans établi dans le village de mbane, il a commencé cette activité de maraîchage d'onions depuis qu'il est tout petit accompagné de ses parents, avec ce crédit, il va acheter des semences d'onions, des herbicides et des fertilisants.

Il envisage d'augmenter sa qualité de production et sa quantité afin de pouvoir toucher d'autres clients qui sont établi au niveau des villages environnants.
texts.en:
Thione, age 48, is a cultivator who lives in the village of Mbane. He started his onion farming business when he was still a young child, with help from his parents.

With this loan, he will buy onion seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers. He foresees increasing the quality of his production, in order to reach new customers living in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Marco Ovaldo

texts.es:
Marco es un joven emprendedor y dinámico de 19 años de edad, padre de una hija de 4 meses de nacida, por quien lucha incansablemente para brindarle sustento.
Desde pequeño tiene un gusto especial por las motos, es por ello que con ayuda de su padre, logró realizar dos cursos de mecánica y desde hace 3 meses inició su propio taller, en el que presta el servicio todos los días; así logra generar los recursos económicos suficientes para velar por el bienestar de su pequeña hija.
El crédito que solicita está destinado para la compra de una máquina hidrolavadora, que le permitirá prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, lo que le ayudará a lograr reconocimiento en el sector y a fidelizar los clientes actuales, esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ganancias por la prestación de sus servicios.
Marco, con su espíritu emprendedor y sus deseos de progreso, manifiesta que seguirá trabajando arduamente para acreditar y fortalecer cada día más su negocio, así podrá garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita dar sustento a su hija y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco, who is 19 years old, is and enterprising and dynamic young man. He has a 4-month old daughter and works tirelessly to provide for her. Since he was young he has had a particular interest in motorbikes and so, with the help of his father, he was able to study two courses for mechanics. He set up his own workshop 3 months ago where he works every day. By doing this he manages to generate enough income to take care of his daughter's wellbeing.

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy a pressure washer, which will enable him to give a more complete service to his customers. This will help him to become known in the business and ensure that his current customers become regulars. This will be reflected in an increase in the income he gets from providing his services.

Marco, with his entrepreneurial spirit and desire for progress, says he will continue to work hard to continually strengthen his business and build his reputation. This will guarantee him a stable financial situation which will allow him to provide for his daughter and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a pressure washer.

loans.name: Gustavo Alonso

texts.es:
Gustavo, a sus 32 años de edad, es un campesino humilde y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hija de 8 años.
Durante 16 años de su vida, se ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente, prestando el servicio de transporte de productos en un vehículo de tracción animal, en el que carga materiales de construcción y cualquier otro tipo de mercancía que el cliente requiera, esto le ha generado los recursos suficientes para velar por el sustento de su familia.
 El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de un caballo, pues el que tiene se encuentra enfermo y a pesar de los gastos veterinarios, no ha mejorado; esto le permitirá continuar con su labor, pues es la única fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Gustavo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad económica y física para velar por el bienestar de su familia y brindarle educación a su hija, para que tenga un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Gustavo, who is 32 years old, is a modest and hard-working man from a rural background. He lives with his wife and their 8-year-old daughter. He has spent the last 16 years of his life working independently, providing a goods transport service by horse-drawn vehicle. He uses this to transport construction materials and any other type of goods which the customer requires. This has given him sufficient income to be able to support his family. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a horse, since the one he already has is sick and in spite of the money he has spent on veterinary costs, the horse has not improved. Buying a new horse will allow him to continue with his work, as it is the only source of income for his family.

Gustavo says his main aspiration is to have the physical and financial ability to look after his family's wellbeing and provide an education for his daughter so that she can have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Sahada

texts.en:
Sahada, 47, lives in Parandih, Deoghar, Jharkhand. Parandih village is 12 kms from Deoghar town. For years, the village was cut off from Deoghar, as there was no bridge over the Ajoy River. Things changed over the last four years, when the bridge was constructed and the village became accessible. 

Sahada is married and a mother of five children. One son is working as a driver, while others are still studying. Her husband has been a masonry worker for the last seven years and earns Rs. 4,000 per month. 

Sahada sells accessories and makeup items like bangles, powder, lipstick and face creams in different villages. She also sells them in the weekly market of her village and earns around Rs. 3,000 per month. As an asset, she has one acre of land.

Sahada has repaid her first loan from MESP successfully and now is requesting a second one. She needs a loan of Rs. 8,000, with which she will be able to buy more items and stock up. 

Sahada wants to increase her family’s income, and she hopes to save enough for her children’s education. She wants to engage her son in the contractor business.

loans.use: to stock up on items like bangles, powder, lipstick and face creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is an ideal entrepreneur; she always looks for growth. Her business plan is simple: demand and supply. Bina lives in Parandih, Deoghar, a highly populated rustic town. Most people in this area work as laborers in the construction industry; her husband is also a mason. She has three kids, two of whom are in school.

Not many families produce agricultural products in this area, and people normally buy food. This is where Bina’s business model comes in. Bina wants set up her own small poultry farm. She is asking for a loan to buy hens for breeding.

Bina wants to see her husband become a part of her farm, as she believes that the supply and demand will allow her to have more customers if only she can produce more. Poultry will for sure give her enough income to have her husband join the business, which will save him from the tough and long hours as a construction worker.

Bina believes that the surging market has more to demand and hopes to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy hens for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Parandih village is 12 km from Deoghar town (Jharkhand). This village is located at Devipur block and consists of a minority community with big families. 

Sakina, who is in her 30s, is from the Parandih. Her family consists of eight members. She is married and a mother of four children. Two of her sons go to school while the other two go to ICDS centre (Pre-school). Her husband is a contractor and earns Rs. 8,000 per month.

She wants to help her husband in his business and for this reason, she needs a loan to buy different equipment for construction. This will enable them to generate income to support the family. 

Sakina wants to save enough money for her children's education and for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a 25-year-old woman who lives in Parandih, Deoghar, Jharkhand. Parandih rural village is 12 kms from Deoghar, which is the nearest town. Pramila never had an opportunity to climb the stairs of school, and hence remained illiterate. She is newly married and a housewife. 

Just three months ago, they opened a shop to repair and service mobile phones. Earlier, Pramila’s husband was working in a mobile shop in Deoghar town. After taking a loan from MESP, a local NGO, they opened their own shop and earn around Rs. 3,000 monthly.

Since the shop is doing good business, Pramila came up with an idea to expand it by buying more electrical material, which will be used to repair cell phones. That’s why she is asking for a new loan.

Pramila's confidence is boosted after having repaid her first loan easily without having to struggle. She is sure this loan will bring her more income. She plans to reinvest her savings, grow and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy more electronic components to repair cell phones.

loans.name: Khatun

texts.en:
Khatun’s life has not been a smooth one. She has a big family of fifteen around her to support. Her husband is a motor mechanic. She has five children and out of them, two are working. Her elder son is 20 and also works as a mechanic. Her other son is a truck driver. 

To change the family’s income status, her husband has given their old shop to their son and has started a new shop on a highway near their village, Parindah. Their new shop is likely to have more business after the government constructs the bridge, which was washed away sometime back.   

Khatun is a housewife and plans to support her husband at his new shop. The loan will help the family to double their income and provide the basic amenities to the other children.    

She earlier helped her husband in setting up the first shop and paid back the microloan she had taken from the local field partner, MESP. 

The family is a hardworking one, and honest. The success of the shop is important to the family, as it will give them income, which could turn into savings.

loans.use: to buy stock for the cycle repair shop.

loans.name: Dimple

texts.en:
Dimple is 24 years old and has two children.  Dimple is married and has one child who is in school.

Dimple is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Dimple requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dimple has been raising pig for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es: José es un hombre soltero, es trabajador y emprendedor, desde hace 10 años inició su tienda con un bajo presupuesto pero cada día ha ido creciendo,  Tiene como sueño ampliar su tienda y comprar mucho surtido (gaseosas, mecatos, viveres, en general, etc) por lo que recurrió a la Corporación a solicitar el préstamo con el cual realizará parte de su sueño y adquirir mercancía al por mayor obteniendo descuentos y mayores ganancias, de esta forma José podrá ofrecer mejores y más varias productos a sus vecinos y amigos de tantos años como clientes. Sus ingresos se incrementarán y disfrutará de una mejor calidad de vida .
texts.en:
José is a hard-working and enterprising single man. He started his shop 10 years ago with a small budget but it has continued to grow steadily.

His dream is to extend his shop and buy a wide variety of stock (fizzy drinks, cakes and general groceries), which is why he has approached the board to ask for a loan. He will use this to make part of his dream come true and will buy stock wholesale, which will give him discounts and better profits. 

By doing this José will be able to offer a better and more varied range of products to his neighbours and the people who have become his friends after so many years as customers. His income will increase and he will enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a lot of stock (fizzy drinks, cakes and general groceries).

loans.name: Japio

texts.en:
Japio is 48 years old and married with 4 children, two of whom are in school. Japio works very hard to provide for them.

Japio runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Japio has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Japio would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delirosa

texts.en:
Delirosa is 38 years old and has two children. Delirosa is Married and both of her children are in school.

Delirosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Delirosa requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Delirosa has been raising pigs for 13 years.

In the future, Delirosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario, tiene 48 años,vive en zona rural y  toda su vida se ha desempeñado en labores la agricultura y distribución de los diferentes productos que cosecha, actualmente tiene sembrados frijol, repollo y arvejas. Mario sueña con tener una gran diversidad de productos con éste préstamo el comprará insumos  (riegos, abonos, semillas, etc)  para poder sacar unas cosechas abundantes y de muy buena calidad para ofrecer en el centro del acopio del municipio donde reside y donde ya tiene mucha demanda por la amplia clientela que él maneja. Sus ingresos se verán afectados positivamente y podrá seguir disfrutando de un bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Mario, who is 48 years old, lives in a rural area and has spent all of his life working in agriculture and selling the various crops which he produces. Currently he has planted beans, cabbage and peas. 

He dreams of having a large variety of crops and with this loan he will buy supplies (irrigation equipment, manure, seeds etc.) so he can have abundant harvests of a very high quality. He will sell these in the crop collection centre of the the town where he lives, where he already has a high demand from the wide clientele he has built up. This will have a positive effect on his income and he will be able to continue to look after his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as irrigation equipment, manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 40 years OLD, married, with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Socorro has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Socorro requested a PHP 26000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Socorro has been in this business for three years. In the future, Socorro would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: TO buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Muzafari

texts.en:
Muzafari aged thirty-five. He is married and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He takes care of four children and three of them attend school. He is a fish monger and runs a lodge for additional income. In the lodge business, Muzafari faces the difficulty of late rent payments from debtors.

Muzafari saved money from his produce business before venturing into fish mongering. He gets customers from Hoima and Kampala. In the future, he hopes to buy land for his children and educate them to a high level.  He is acquiring a loan to buy fishing nets.

loans.use: buy fishing nets

loans.name: Inderjiet

texts.en: Inderjiet is fifty-four years old and lives with his wife and two sons. He also has four other children who are already married. Inderjiet works as a field worker in a banana company. His income was not enough to pay for his children's marriage expenses, so he also started cultivating rice. After his retirement, Inderjiet wants to leave behind a stable business for his sons. As a field worker in a banana company, he had no choice but to work with Seva MFI. Inderjiet wants to borrow SRD 6,000 from Seva MFI to buy a grader. With the grader he will be able to equalize his land on time, in order to increase his rice production and income.

loans.use: To buy a grader

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is a twenty-two-year-old, hard working, single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of maize and coffee as his main source of income, although he also practices farming to earn extra income. He started this business to have a better standard of living and to pay his school fees. His produce business faces challenges of price fluctuations and prolonged drought. Enock has a vision of becoming a prominent business man.

Enock is requesting a loan to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.name: Tarasisio

texts.en:
Tarasisio is a forty-three-year-old married man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. He has been a farmer for fifteen years and his main hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather. 

Tarasisio has a vision of buying land to grow more bananas and expanding his business to new markets. He hopes to own a modernized farm.

He needs a loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en: Yovan, a forty-year-old married man, has depended on cattle for his own livelihood and that of his family. He reared cattle as a child and then later translated this experience into a source of income by buying and selling the cows. Yovan thanks UGAFODE for facilitating his dream of increasing his income through funding him to acquire more cattle. He is hard working and optimistic. He hopes to grow the relationship with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells new and secondhand clothes as his main source of income. He also farms and owns a video hall. 

He started this clothing business to earn a living and take care of himself. He faces hardships from competition, seasonal customers and price fluctuations, but has hopes that, in future, he will become rich and own a wholesale boutique.

Michael is requesting a loan to buy more new and secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more new and secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man who lives in the rural area of Lyantonde District in Uganda. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the good work they are doing and to UGAFODE for reaching out to the rural poor who were once marginalized. 

With little education, Amos resorted to cattle fattening to earn a living, which would prove to pay off according to his uncle's experience in the same business. 

With financial assistance from Kiva lenders and UGAFODE, Amos hopes his business will go miles, since he is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Allakabo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Allakabo ont en moyenne 32 ans et 1 enfant. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila (commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (brodés, pagnes wax et légers), des produits cosmétiques et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aïchata (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (brodés, pagnes wax et légers). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 70 pièces de pagnes wax  en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aïchata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of Allakabo Group average 32 years of age and one child. They are married, and most live in monogamous households in Kanadjiguila (Mandé commune, in Kati Cercle).

They got to know each other through bonds of community and through their money-earning businesses at the Kanadjiguila market. They retail clothes, such as  embroidery, pagnes Wax (colorful African cloth), and light clothes. They also sell cosmetics and run food-serving businesses.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Aïchata is the woman standing on the right in the photograph. She's a big seller of clothes (embroidery, pagnes Wax, light clothes). She intends to use her loan to buy 70 pieces of Wax pagnes wholesale at the Grand Market.

She retails in Kanadjiguila to a clientele comprising mainly women. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000, to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to cover the daily needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy 70 pagnes Wax (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Finesse Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Finesse sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Djalakorodji dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes), sables et bois de chauffage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariétou (femme assise en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur  la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes); Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 660 paires de chaussures plastiques de tous les âges  au grand marché et la revente se fait à Djalakorodji à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariétou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The six members of Fitness Group average 41 years of age and five children. They are married, and most live in monogamous households in Djalakorodji, a neighborhood in Bamako District.

They got to know each other through bonds of community and through their money-earning businesses at the Djalakorodji market. They retail plastic shoes (for men and women), sand, and firewood.

In order to be able to pay cash for supplies, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Mariétou is the second woman from the right in the photograph. She's very well-known as a reseller of plastic shoes for men and women. She intends to use her loan to buy 660 pairs of plastic shoes for all ages at the Grand Market.

She retails in Djalakorodji to a clientele comprising mainly women. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 85'000, to be in part reinvested in her business, and in part used to cover her children's healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy 660 pairs of plastic shoes

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en: Nunu, who is 31 years old married woman, lives in Tbilisi city. She has husband, 3 children and brother, who works as an operator at private company and monthly gets 400 GEL. Nunu doesn't have her own activity, as she can't get high education and isn't able to start any stable job. For her family's welfare and children's further development Nunu plans to start her own private business. She requested a loan to MFO Credo and was approved with the start up program, that gives people chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use loan for opening coffee store, particularly she will buy coffee grinder machine, serve clients herself and will sell wide assortment of coffee. Nunu will generate income and will take care with her family. She will be really grateful for giving chance make better life for her children. Nunu awaits your support.

loans.use: To open coffee store

loans.name: María Liliana

texts.es: María, con tres hijos menores de edad, por dificultades con su esposo y separación, se vio en la necesidad de irse para otro municipio a trabajar, le cedieron un café bar y con este negocio María  anhela y sueña con seguir adelante con sus hijos, y comprarse una casa donde vivir con sus hijos, con el préstamo solicitado ella comprará surtido (gaseosas, frutas para los jugos, mecato)  ya que necesita tener más variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y obtener mayores ventas.  Todo esto le representa mejores ingresos para pagar las cuotas del préstamo y también ahorrar para comprar su propia vivienda y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en: María has three minor children and is divorced because of difficulties with her husband.  She felt the need to move to another town to work where she started business in a coffee-bar.  Through this business María hopes to be able to get ahead with her children and buy a house for the family.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of items (sodas, fruits for juices, pastries) since she must offer variety to her customers to increase sales.  This will improve her income so she can pay back the loan and also save money to buy a house and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy varied items (sodas, fruit for juices, pastries)

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is a hardworking woman from Miasnikyan village. She lives with her husband and two sons. 
Karine's elder son drives a taxi and the other one attends local village school. 
Karine and her husband are farmers. They keep 3 cows and cultivate different types of vegetables (tomato, cucumber pepper and watermelon). The gathered harvest they sell in local open markets and earn income for family’s living. This requested loan will be a big support for their farm. Karine asks that to be able to purchase watermelon and tomato seeds, fertilizer and also hire workers for organizing cultivation process. 
As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for watermelon and tomato seeds, fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Naheed is 52 years old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and she has been running business selling cloth for many years. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 60,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: José Casimiro

texts.es: José es un adulto mayor que desde hace más de 30 años se vino para la ciudad, se desempeñó muchos años en el sector de la construcción, pero a su edad ya era demasiado desgastante y por ello tomó la decisión de iniciar otra actividad como es la venta de guarapo, desde hace 8 años tiene su negocio y le ha ido muy bien, José sueña con ampliar su negocio y brindarle un buen servicio a su clientela, con el dinero solicitado él arreglará su máquina y también comprará materia prima (caña de azúcar, limones, hielo, etc) para ofrecer un producto de buena calidad, tiene mucha demanda y le genera buenos ingresos y puede de esta manera continuar brindándole a sus hijos una buena educación para el día de mañana y tener  un bienestar familiar con mucha calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is an older man who moved to the city over 30 years ago.  He worked many years in construction but because of his age the work was too draining so he decided to go into business selling "guarapo" (sugar-cane liquor).  He has been in business for eight years and things are going well for him.  His goal is to expand the business and provide good customer service.

The loan he is requesting is to fix the machine he has and also buy ingredients (sugar cane, lemons, ice, etc.) to offer quality products.  There is a lot of demand which generates a nice income so he hopes to be able to give his children a good education for the future as well as provide a quality lifestyle for his family.

loans.use: To fix a machine and buy ingredients (sugar cane, lemons, ice, etc.)

loans.name: Shafqat

texts.en: Shafqat had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Nine years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers. It will her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate an healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.  She dreams of providing better standard of living to her three children.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en: Bano is 54 years old married woman and is running business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 39 years old married woman, from village Pshaveli. She lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from local government. Nana's husband is an artisan and has seasonal orders. His estimate income is 300 GEL monthly. Family owns a plot of agricultural land, cultivate it and consumes harvested products for family use. However, they don't have significant income for covering all daily costs and expenses they need. According to this Nana has great desire to start business, that can give her stable income and she requested a loan. Nana will use this requested amount for purchasing a car and stock of used clothing for trading business. Nana and her husband will sell it in their and nearby villages. They will be grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide for their business development.

loans.use: To start trading business with used clothing

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 31 years old married woman. She is successfully running a business of cattle sale from the past 10 years. She has 4 children and 2 of them is school going. Her husband is doing job and earns insufficient income to meet their household expenses. That is why she started her business selling animals in her community. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices and after bringing them up for a year or two, she sells them sells in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase goats and calves. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase goats and calves.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, age 45, is a married woman.  She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices and after bringing them up for a year or two, she sells them sells in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is 57 years old, married woman. Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Perveen has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers.  She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 59 years old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past ten years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. Her husband is a carpenter, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Naseem’s embroidery patterns are very popular in her community and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of customers. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 5 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 31 years old married woman and dedicated mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem's husband. Her husband runs a donkey cart as a transportation service. He started this business with a single donkey cart. He makes enough to meet the family's needs. For the improvement of her husband’s business Naseem applied a loan of PKR 40,000. In this way her husband will be able to purchase another donkey. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be productive one for husband plans to spend the additional revenue on improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase another donkey.

loans.name: Mehreen

texts.en: Mehreen is 30 years old married woman. She is running business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 40 years old married woman doing business selling milk for many years. She has 1 cow and few buffaloes for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her decent life. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. It’s 3rd year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to have increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 48 years old, widowed mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adela has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Adela requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

Adela has been in this business for three years. In the future, Adela would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida, age 38, is a married woman and the mother of four children. Three years ago she started selling dressmaking supplies including threads, cloth and zippers, etc., as her husband’s income is not enough to meet their family's requirements. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. Currently she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase spools of threads, cloths, ribbons and buttons in various colors. This loan will help her to improve her sales and profits.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, cloths, ribbons and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Jairo De Jesús

texts.es: Jairo es casado y tiene aún mucho tesón para salir adelante, desde hace cuatro años tiene una tienda en un barrio del municipio, labor que desempeña desde las 8 am hasta las 9 pm,  Jairo sueña con tener una tienda más grande y con mucho surtido ( lácteos, gaseosas, implementos de aseo en general, etc) y quiere además invertir en cervezas, y variedad de licores para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia gama de productos. Con el préstamo surtirá su tienda para manejar un stock  suficiente ya que al comprar al por mayor obtiene grandes beneficios  y ofertas lo que le representa ganancias y con las ventas generar mejores ingresos, teniendo así un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is married and has a lot of determination to succeed. He has had a store in a city neighborhood for 4 years. He works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

Jairo dreams of having a bigger store with much inventory (dairy products, drinks, cleaning products, etc) and wants to invest in beer and a variety of liquors to offer his customers and increase his range of products. 

With the loan he will stock his store to better manage a sufficient inventory as he gets great deals and benefits when when buying in bulk. This means better sales and income, and therefore a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy inventory, in order to increase his income and one day have a bigger store

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: At the age of 21, Rukhsana is a married woman and having two children.  She deals in business selling goats. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She earns good amount of income to bear her household expenditures. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 3rd loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to purchase more baby goats.  She hopes to get increase in her earnings and wishes to improve her standard of living through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 41-year-old married woman. From the past two years she has been selling spices which are used in cooking for taste. She purchases spices in bulk from the wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to spend a decent life.  Currently she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity. It will help her to inflate her sales.  She is in her 3rd  loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantity.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani, age 32, is a married woman. She deals in business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Alba Areli

texts.es: Alba, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo menor de edad, ella tenía unas confecciones a terceros y en vista del incumplimiento de sus pagos tuvo inconvenientes económicos y decidió cambiar de actividad desde su casa vendiendo desayunos y arepas rellenas de diversas carnes, pero ella usa la nevera de su casa y no tiene buena capacidad de almacenamientos, Alba sueña con tener su negocio en un local independiente de su casa y por ello recurre a la Corporación para la solicitud del préstamo, con el cual comprará un enfriador y se surtirá de los diferentes productos para el desarrollo de su actividad ( arepas, carnes de pollo, cerdo, salsas, etc) dando gusto a su fiel clientela con lo cual aumentarán las ventas y sus ingresos y asi mejorar su nivel y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alba lives with her common-law husband and young son.  She used to run a sewing business but ran into economic difficulties when customers did not fulfill their payment commitments.  She decided to go into another business and now sells breakfast food and corn tortillas from home.  She uses her own refrigerator for the business but it does not have enough storage capacity.  Alba dreams about opening an independent shop away from her home, so she is requesting a loan.  She plans to buy a cooler and a variety of different products to carry out her activity (corn tortillas, chicken, pork, sauces, etc.).  By giving her customers what they want, she will increase sales and income and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a cooler and a variety of products for her business (corn tortillas, chicken, pork, sauces, etc.)

loans.name: Ghulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ghulam Fatima is 33 years old married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute in the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en: Ruqiya is 42 years old, married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Ruqiya’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Ruqiya has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and needs to get engine repairing work for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Ruqiya is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and needs to get engine repairing work.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing buckles for many years which are used in the embellishment of shoes. She beautifully makes buckles at home and then sells them in the local market. By the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide quality life for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers she requested a loan of PKR 40000 to purchase metals, pearls and threads in various colors to increase her production. She hopes to get boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Shahnaz wishes to utilize part of revenues to provide better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase metals, pearls and threads in various colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 52 years old married lady. She is very talented and excels in work of stitching clothes. She has received a lot of appreciation from her community as she has been doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of PKR 40000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet up with the increasing demand. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her two children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 32 years old and a married woman and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some tools.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 49 years old and married with three children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alma has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Alma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and single.

Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rose requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rose has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Erma Isidra

texts.en:
As a married married of three children, Ma. Erma Isidra works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Ma. Erma Isidra is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Ma. Erma Isidra has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Taperakan village with her husband, mother-in-law and three school age children. The family has been involved in agriculture for many years. Near the village where they live, Narine owns a plot of land where she cultivates tomato. The family also keeps grape orchard with love and care and sells the gathered harvest locally.
Narine has now applied for this loan to be able to pay for workforce and organize the cultivation process. 
She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Narine has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for workforce for organizing

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 39 years old and married with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fishing.

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old, married, and has eight adult children. She is from the community of Valencia, Bohol. For five years, she has been operating a sari-sari (general) store selling household basic items such as seasoning, toiletries, candies, chips, vegetables, and canned goods. 

Myrna requested a loan, which she will use to buy more merchandise such as canned goods, chips, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks. She dreams of becoming a successful businesswoman and hopes that she can save enough for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, chips, noodles, cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a 35-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.
