He deals in produce selling of maize and coffee as his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like farming where he earns an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and have better standards of living. 

He faces challenges of inadequate capital and weather changes that affect his produce business. 

He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce in some years to come.

Abel is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a 44-year-old married male with nine children who all go to school and are living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been selling local brew for 14 years; he works two days a week and seven hours a day.  His business is located on a busy street.  He also  farms as additional income. Deus started his business to have a better life and wants money to buy local brew. 

Deus hopes to have a wholesale business, however, he faces competition as a challenge. 

Deus is a hardworking man who needs a loan to pay for local brew to sell.

loans.use: to pay for local brew to sell.

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 29 years old from the community of Valencia, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest is 12 and her youngest is 2 months. 

Nelfa's husband work as a habal-habal (motorcycle for transport) driver. Nelfa helps him by making pots out of clay. She also raise hogs for additional income. 

With her present businesses, she is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more piglets and feed. 

She hopes that by working hard, she will be able to raise her children well and give them a proper education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married with five children; all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and father).   

She has a retail shop business, and has been in this business for 10 years. She works in the shop and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters.

Milly has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.  

She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also to educate her children up to university. 

She decided to join MCDTSACCO because of the low interest charged. 

Milly resides in the family house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and pans of bread.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo lives in Hoima Uganda. He is 58 years old and married with 8 children.   Four of his children attend school.  He runs a general merchandise business and earns additional income from rentals. 

His dream is to build a permanent house, educate his children,and inspire them to become independent. Limited capital hinders his business expansion.Leo has asked for a loan buy sugar, soda,soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar,soda,soap and salt.

loans.name: Mariah

texts.en:
Mariah, a rural agriculturalist, is married and is responsible for meeting the daily needs of her children. She has managed to do this through farming and rearing pigs which she says has high demand and grows in a short period. 

She is thankfull to Kiva lenders for accepting her loan appolication because her business challenge is having limited capital. She believes that her business will grow and this will increase her income. She is hard working.  Mariah and her husband are shown in the photo with the pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Mary Queen

texts.en:
Mary Queen is a 25-year-old woman from the municipality of Valencia in the province of Bohol. She has a two-year-old daughter. 

For five years, she has made clay pots for a living. Mary Queein asks for a loan to buy clay,cement and firewood which are the raw materials needed to make pots. Once these are available, she can be assured of increasing  productivity. 

Mary Queen hopes that someday, she can have more business so she can educate her child.

loans.use: to buy clay, cement and firewood.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth  is married and has five children, all of her children go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She has a business to sell second-hand clothes and has been in this business for 8 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothing. She works at the market and from home and sells both on a retail  and wholesale basis seven days a week. 

Her major business challenges include theft and weather conditions. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to get a permanent business location. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest they charged. 

She resides in the family house with access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, feeding the family, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 42-year-old woman  from Valencia, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 5-17. 

For five years, she has made pots for a living. She asks for 8,000 PHP to buy clay and firewood necessary to make pots. 

She is determined to be successful  so she can provide for her children's needs. In the future, Nida wishes see her children finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy clay and fire wood.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Baghramyan village with her husband, son, daughter, daughter-in-law and three school age grandchildren. The whole family is engaged in agriculture. They keep a livestock (3 cows and a pig) and also cultivate some grass. Anush also owns grape orchard and the gathered harvest sells in local market. 
Anush and her family are very enthusiastic about making their farm successful and rich so they work really hard. Anush's daughter-in-law is a teacher at local school and her husband is an army officer.
 Unfortunately only their salaries are not enough for covering even living costs, so agribusiness is very important for the family. 
Now, Anush has applied for this loan to be able to purchase two cows, two pigs, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs. This will be a huge support for their farm and Anush hopes for lenders' support.
As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, two pigs, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Greens Laxmidevi-Thugunasi Group

texts.en:
Renuka is 38 years old. She is married and living with her husband and three children. All the children go to school.
 
Renuka's (wearing a blue sari, raising her hand in the photo) family owns a small piece of land in their village and are dependent on rain for cultivation of crops. Due to this they are forced to look for an alternate source of income to maintain the family. Renuka and her husband work as day labourers in agriculture fields and as coolies with building contractors. The earnings are not sufficient to lead a satisfied life.
 
Renuka and other like-minded ladies joined together and started a Joint Liability Group (JLG) to take on some income-generating activities. A local NGO, Future Greens, trained the group members on all the aspects of the goat- and sheep-rearing business.
 
The loan she is seeking is to buy lambs and rear them so that she can sell them at good prices in the market. The NGO will be providing the market link for them. Renuka dreams of a good future for her children. 

This is the first loan of this group called “Greens Lakshmidevi”.

loans.use: to buy lambs and sheep.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a 24-year-old woman from the town of Valencia, Bohol. She has a four-year-old son whom she supports from operating a Sari-sari store. Her business started five years ago. 

Vanessa would like to increase her inventory and sell items that she does not previously carry. She asks for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, seasoning, toiletries, coffee, sugar and shampoo. 

She hopes that she can further expand her business and support her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, seasonings, toiletries, coffee, sugar and shampoo.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Hoima Uganda.and is a 21-year-old single man who is responsible for taking care of three children.

Peter wants a loan to buy meat to roast and sell.  He started this business to take care of his family and fight poverty.  Changing weather conditions affect his business especially during the lent season when people don't consume a lot of meat. 

He desires to have a motorcycle to start a bodaboda (motorcycle) business.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is married with two children that go to school. She also takes care of her mother. 

She has a business selling used hand bags and has been in this business for three years.  She works at the market five days each week and is in retail sales . She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy used hand bags.  

Her major business challenges include transportation, theft, and customers that default on payments. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to buy land  and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy used hand bags.

loans.name: Bughoye Thuyihimbe Group

texts.en:
Oliver is a thirty-year-old married woman living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has six children; 4 go to school.

She has been in the retail business for fourteen years and works six days a week and eight hours a day.  Her retail business is located  in a rural area and she has a motorcycle transport business to earn additional income.

Oliver started her business to generate income and wants money to buy rice. Oliver hopes to have more profit. However, bad debts and seasonal changes are challenges she faces. 

She is a member of a group where members guarantee eachother to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy  rice to sell.

loans.name: St Clare 1 Group

texts.en:
Matia is an eighty-two-year old widow with five children, all attend school, He is in agriculture and also receives a pension as additional income. 

Matia started his business to become self-sufficent and wants money to pay to have electricity installed. 

Matia hopes to educate his children however, lack of medicine and theft are challenges being faced. Matia is a hardworking man and appreciates services he receives. He is a member of a group where members guarantee each other to get a loan.

loans.use: to pay for electricity installation.

loans.name: Greens Shree Saraswati-Bandhakeri Group

texts.en:
Nanda (lady with hand raised in the picture) at the age of 24, has gone through a lot of hardship. She is married and has a daughter and two sons, all of whom are studying. She is illiterate as her parents could not afford her schooling due to acute poverty. Her husband works in agriculture and earns INR 150 per day.
                                                                                                                                     
Nanda is a fighter and is ready to face all odds to achieve her goal of having her own business. She a quick learner and had acquired the skill of sheep and goat rearing before she got formally trained by the NGO.
 
Her little village Bandhkeri is situated in North Karnataka’s Bagalkot district. Nanda has joined a Joint Liability Group (JLG) along with five other women, named as “Greens Shree Saraswati,” which is named after the goddess of education/wisdom.                                                                                                                                            
 
She learned the scientific procedures of how to preserve and nourish the livestock. She has already started her goat rearing and has also earned first profits. 

She seeks a loan to the purchase more lambs so that she can expand her farm. The income she would generate will be use for her children’s education expenses and future savings. Nanda wants to live an independent and confident life and use the money to support her husband as well.

loans.use: to buy sheep and lambs.

loans.name: Wilson Ferney

texts.es: Wilson, tiene 40 años, es casado y tienen un hijo de 10 años, toda su vida ha estado la actividad de cría de ganado bovino y lechero, tiene gran experiencia, actualmente labora en una finca lechera y con la cría de ganado.  Se la ha presentado una oportunidad de tener su propio ganado lechero y le ofrecieron 6 terneras holstein,  por dicho motivo paso la solicitud del crédito  a la Corporación, para comprar las terneras y criarlas para la producción de leche  y con este dinero también debe adquirir insumos para el sostenimiento y cuidado del ganado.  Esta actividad representa buenos ingresos lo que le brindará una mayor estabilidad económica  y brindarle a su hijo el estudio que él desea, todo esto le brindará  un mejor  futuro con solvencia económica para toda su familia.
texts.en: Wilson is 40 years old, married, and has a 10 year old son. All his life he has been in the activity of raising cattle and dairy farming. He has a lot of experience, and right now he works on a dairy farm and raises cattle. He has been presented with the opportunity of having his own dairy farm, and he was offered 6 young holstein cows. For said motivation, he requested the loan from the corporation in order to buy the young cows and raise them for the production of milk. With this money he should acquire supplies for the support and care of the livestock. This activity represents good income which will provide him greater economic stability and his son the studies that he wants. All this will afford him a better future with economic solvency for his whole family.

loans.use: to buy 6 young holstein cows for milk production.

loans.name: Sahim

texts.en:
Sahim lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Sahim is married and lives with more than three persons in the family home.
	
Sahim began working with Ruma one month ago because he is interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, he has around $18 to 19 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a Ugandan hardworking man. He is married, aged 50 years and  living in Kagadi. He has 10 children aged between 29 and 2 years; only four attend school. He has been dealing in selling motorcycle spare parts to earn a living. He also earns as a mechanic and hopes to educate his children despite challenges of competition and high license fees. Julius is requesting a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is a farmer from Goris town. She lives there with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and 4-years-old grandchildren.
Silva's son is an army officer and other family members are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock which includes cows, chickens and 10 colonies of bees. The family also grows 4 nut trees.
The gathered agricultural harvest they sell locally.
Now, by applying for this loan Silva asks financial support of USD 1500 to be able to enlarge the cattle with a cow and a calf. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions of her family, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Silva has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and a calf

loans.name: Stone

texts.en: Stone wants a loan to buy pork to sell. He has a pork joint where he earns a living. He lives in Hoima, Uganda, and is aged 34. He is single and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. He started a business so as to improve his family's welfare. The high price of pork affects his business, yet he desires to expand his business and open up outlets since pork is in high demand. Stone intends to use the loan to buy pork to sell.

loans.use: to buy pork to sell.

loans.name: Egi

texts.en:
Egi lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Egi is single and lives with four persons in the family home.
	
Egi began working with Ruma one month ago because he is interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, he has around $18 to $19 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Shree Ram-Arkeri Group

texts.en:
The Joint Liability Groups (JLG) creates a circle of empowerment for women who participate in livestock, tailoring and many such activities. Though each member works in their own individual enterprise, the sharing helps as they work in teams.  

“Shree Ram” is one such group in North Karnataka. It is enabling women to create sustainable models for their families. The Shree Ram group was set up by five women from the village of Arkeri to start their own microenterprises.
 
Prema is their group leader. She is married and has four children, and all are studying. She has finished her high school education and maintains the books of the group, which were set up with the help of a local NGO, Future Greens.

Prema’s husband works as a labourer on the farms and has a daily income of INR 150. Prema desires to increase her family income and bring more financial stability to the family. Future Greens gave her the training in how raise the livestock. She started a small sheep-rearing farm with her savings.  

After selling her first stock successfully, Prema now wants to expand her business and for that she is requesting a loan. She is a dynamic lady who also speaks and fights for the rights of women in her village. The loan will empower her further and will help her to give a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and lambs.

loans.name: Misran

texts.en:
Misran lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Misran is married and lives with three persons in the family home.
	
Misran began working with Ruma one month ago because he is interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, he has around $26 to $27 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Kurniasih

texts.en:
Kurniasih lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Kurniasih is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Kurniasih began working with Ruma one month ago because she is interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, she has around $24 to $25 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Casilda es una joven madre soltera, nació en la provincia Chapare ubicado en el trópico de Cochabamba, actualmente su mamá se dedica a la agricultura y su papá no tiene un trabajo estable, ella nos comenta que fue la única que estudió de sus siete hermanos pero no pudo titularse ya que sus recursos económicos no eran suficientes, además tenía que cuidar a su pequeña hija. 
Casilda actualmente trabaja como educadora en un centro educativo en la población de Colcapirhua ubicado a 8 km del centro de la ciudad de Cochabamba, sus ingresos le sirve para mantener a su pequeña hija que tiene 2 años y para ayudar un poco a su familia. Ahora ella solicita un crédito educativo para poder titularse en la carrera de ciencias de la educación y así poder recibir un ascenso, mismo que le ayudará a cumplir su sueño de ser una excelente profesional y le permitirá mejorar su situación económica, lo que más anhela es poder ser un ejemplo de superación para su hija.
Casilda de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a ella se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en: Casilda is a young single mother who was born in the province of Chapare located in the tropics of Cochabamba. Right now her mom works in agriculture and her father doesn't have a stable job. She tells us that she was the only one of her 7 siblings who went to school, but she couldn't get her degree because her economic resources weren't sufficient. In addition she had to take care of her small daughter. Casilda works as a teacher now in an educational centre in the city of Colcapirhua located 8 km from the center of Cochabamba. Her income serves to take care of her small daughter who is 2 years old and to help her family a little. Now, she requests an educational loan to be able to get her degree in education and be able to receive an advancement. It will help her complete her dream of being an excellent professional and allow her to improve her economic situation. What she most longs for is to be an example of overcoming for her daughter. Casilda appreciates beforehand the people who through their economic resources help others and create new opportunities of growth like they are bestowing on her now.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani and her family are occupied in land cultivation. They own a greenhouse where greens are cultivated. In family's own plot of land potato also is cultivated. Ani is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s social condition. Ani lives with her husband, mother-in-law and three little children (ages 7, 6 and 4 years old). She has now applied for this loan of USD 2000 to be able to purchase green seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and medicine for fighting against diseases of the land. 
As this is Ani's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for green seeds, polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and medicine for teh land

loans.name: Ram Pechi

texts.en:
Ram Pechi is a 31-year-old widow lady who lives with her parents-in-law and her three children in a small village of Koraput district of Odisha state, India. She has two sons and a daughter and all are in their schooling. 

Ram Pechi is engaged in tailoring activity. Her father-in-law is a farmer engaged in paddy and vegetable cultivation. Ram Pechi earns 3,000 INR per month from this activity and she is the only regular earning person of her family. 

She wants to open a tailoring training center so that she can earn more to better support her family.

Ram Pechi has applied for a loan amount of 25,000 INR to purchase a new sewing machine, threads and other necessary items for tailoring. She hopes to build a house for her family and wants to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, threads and other necessary items for tailoring.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey, a married man, has been a farmer since his early childhood, since he did not have a chance to get formal education. It is from this that he learned to make local brew from ripe bananas. He will use the loan to buy better drums that he will use for storage of the brew. This will improve his hygiene and also attract responsible customers to him, increasing his sales and profit. He is a hardworking and resilient man.

loans.use: To buy drums to be used for storage

loans.name: Kasiatun

texts.en:
Kasiatun lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Kasiatun is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Kasiatun began working with Ruma two months ago because she is interested in the income for selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last 2 months, she has around $44 to $45 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en: Darejan is 59 years old widow woman, from village Kokhi. She lives with her daughter and 2 grandsons. The family has income from only agricultural activity. Particularly Darejan is extensively engaged in land cultivation, harvesting nuts, mandarin and walnut. She sells seasonally this products and generates small income. In order to start her own business and get some stable profit, she requested a loan. Darejan needs money for starting trading business, she will purchase stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will sell in increased price locally. With the help of this new business Darejan will make better life for her family and more effectively meet everyday expenses. She will get private orders and has her loyal costumers also. Darejan will be glad for giving her chance do her bit to the family's welfare.

loans.use: To start trading business with clothing

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 30 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop of general merchandise and earns additional income from brick laying plus produce buying and selling, mainly maize. His business dream is to expand business into new markets, while his personal dream is to buy a car to assist him in transporting the produce to his customers, though debtors hinder his business expectations. Henry is acquiring a loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith deals in produce buying and selling in Hoima, Uganda. She is 30 years old, married, with one child. She started business in 2006, so as to improve on her family's welfare, having vowed to look after her one child and avail him with all the necessary needs, being the sole breadwinner in her family. She dreams of expanding her business into a modernized produce store in her area. Theft is her major threat.

Judith is acquiring a loan to buy more maize, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 23 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop of general merchandise and earns additional income from buying and selling produce like beans and maize. He started in business so as to take of his family. His business dream is to expand his business and have a fully stocked produce store serving the whole of Hoima district and nearby towns. Debtors and poor roads hinder his business.

He is acquiring a loan to purchase beans, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew her business permit, so that she can increase her income and one day buy her own home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To paint and fix up her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and caustic to expand her soap business

loans.name: Manushaqe

texts.en: Manushaqe is requesting another loan to finish the seasonal planting; she needs to buy potato and onion seeds for planting.

loans.use: To buy potato and onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional clothes used mostly by women) for her business.

loans.name: Corazon Unido Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZON UNIDO”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janeth es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de fundas, venta de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de utensilios, venta de venestas, venta de flores, costura de mochilas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janeth es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche, queso y carne; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años ya que su madre tenia como comercio los mismos productos, pasado el tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra leche, queso y carne por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago del crédito, pues se reúne con sus amigas.
texts.en:
La A.C. “CORAZON UNIDO”  will begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II, it is comprised of 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Janeth is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied, and among them exist sewing covers, selling sweaters, a neighborhood store, selling utensils, selling laminated wood, selling flowers, and sewing backpacks. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the microbusinesses where Janeth is a member. She indicates that he has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining through the invitation of the institution's promoter who visited her house. Right now, she has a business selling milk, cheese, and meat. She says that she started it several years ago because her mother had the same products in her business. After some time she decided to start her own independent business. 
 
The loan that she will take out is to increase the capital to buy wholesale milk, cheese, and meat which she will obtain from the wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and afterwards she will sell them in her shop. This manner of job allows her to generate resources to support her family because she is single and has a son. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loan payment meetings since she meets with her friends.

loans.use: to buy wholesale milk, cheese, and meat.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann wants a loan to buy beans, tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell. She is a 50-year-old woman who sells fresh food in Hoima, Uganda. She started business so as to improve her well being. Limited capital and high transport costs hinder her business. She desires to have a stall in the main market so as to increase her sales and profits at large.

loans.use: to buy beans, tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ethyl

texts.en:
Maria Ethyl is a 28-year-old woman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.  She is married with three children ages 6 to 10. Maria Ethyl relies on farming okra, eggplant and chili to provide for her family. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides to ensure healthy growth of her vegetables.

In the future, she dreams of seeing her children successful in their education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and insecticides

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en:
Aghavni lives in Zorak village with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Aghavni runs a farm which includes 2 cows, 20 chickens and 2 turkeys. Aghavni also cultivates vegetables (tomato, onion and greens) and together with her husband sells the gathered harvest in nearby open markets. Agricultural income is highly important for Aghavni and her family to cover their daily costs and live with better living conditions. 
Therefore, Aghavni requested this loan of USD 2500 to purchase a cow, pig, forage for the livestock and renovate the barn. This will be a huge support for Aghavni's farming business and she hopes for lenders' support.
As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history

loans.use: to pay for a cow, pig, forage for the livestock and renovate the barn

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en: Mrike is back; she bought a dairy cow with a little calf with your previous loan. The reason why she wants another loan this time is to cover her son's wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Laura Camila

texts.es:
Laura Camila vive con el Padre y es la hija mayor de tres hermanos, el hermano Juan Diego de 11 años que cursa el grado 5 y la hermana menor  Sol Mariana que tiene 4 años y está en Jardín.
Laura Camila estudia en el Colegio Manuela Beltrán en la jornada de la mañana y cursa el grado 10º Bachillerato destacándose como una buena alumna ocupando los primeros puestos del  colegio.
Ellos viven en un apartamento en arriendo, el Papa es músico y recreador,  trabaja entre semana dictando clases de música a personas particulares y algunas horas en colegios privados, y los fines de semana le salen eventos ocasionales cantando e  interpretando el piano, o en eventos de recreación.
La situación económica de la familia es un poco difícil y no muy estable; ya que el padre no tiene un trabajo fijo y la  Mamá no hace parte presencial ni económica de los hijos, pero el Papá que hace las veces de Madre y Padre trabaja duro por conseguir el dinero para la alimentación, el pago de los servicios, el  arriendo, los útiles y uniformes, el vestuario, el  transporte y demás gastos de la familia; también se esfuerza por enseñarles muchas cosas, el amor a la vida, el orden y la disciplina, el ser emprendedores, y en el fijar metas así cuesten mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Desde muy pequeña el Papá vio la disposición a ayudar; a averiguarlo todo, segura de sí misma, de preguntar, hablar e interrelacionarse sin ningún problema; y al no temerle, ni sentir asco por la sangre ni las heridas, hablaba de las investigaciones, de los homicidios impunes, ella había soñado con ser CRIMINALISTA y al descubrir que había un instituto acreditado y de alto renombre con una carrera que existía en Colombia y de fácil acceso; como un gran paso para acercarse a las metas; ella se entusiasmó muchísimo y el Padre decidió apoyarla para estudiar  en el Instituto CAMPO ALTO, haciéndole ver que era un reto difícil, de trasnochar, de madrugar, de no dejar a un lado las obligaciones personales y el apoyo como la mayor de la casa y de asumir este reto con responsabilidad y madurez.
Aunque no hubiese dinero,  él se rebuscaría el dinero para pagar el técnico, por lo que quiere él ver a la hija más avanzada y que tenga muchas más oportunidades en la vida, ella tenía que esforzarse mucho para cumplir con las obligaciones en el colegio, y en el técnico, prometió mantener buenas calificaciones y ser de las mejores estudiantes y también para ser un mejor ser humano, Por querer crecer, intelectualmente y tener mejores oportunidades en la vida, por querer apoyar en un futuro muy cercano a la familia, ella quiere continuar con los estudios y solicita a KIVA el apoyo para que al padre pueda estar al día en el pago de las mensualidades para que la hija no pierda la oportunidad de ser una tecnóloga y luego una gran profesional exitosa.
texts.en: Laura Camila lives with her father and is the oldest of three siblings. Her brother Juan Diego is 11 years old and he is in fifth grade, and her youngest sister Sol Mariana is 4 years old and she is in Kindergarten. Laura Camila studies in " Manuela Beltran" school in the morning schedule, and she is in 10th grade, a very good student, who is in one of the first places of the school. They live in a rented apartment. Her father is musician and entertainer. He works during the week as a music tutor to private students and some hours at private schools. On the weekends he has occasional events in which he sings or plays piano or works in entertainment events. The family's financial situation is a little difficult and not very stable since the father does not have a fixed job and the mother is neither a physical nor a financial presence in the life of the children. The father takes the mother's place and he works very hard to earn money to feed the children, pay the utilities, rent, school supplies, uniforms, clothing, transportation and all other household expenses. He also works hard to teach them many things: love of life, order, discipline, to be hardworking and set goals even when they cost a lot of sacrifice and effort. Since Laura was very young her dad saw her tendency to help, to be inquisitive, very sure of herself; to ask, talk and relate to others without problems; to not fear or be repulsed by blood or wounds. She talked about the investigations and unresolved homicides. She dreamed of being a criminal investigator. When she discovered there was an accredited and prestigious institute where this profession existed in Colombia, she got very excited, and her dad decided to support her to study in the Institute CAMPO ALTO. He made her see this would be a difficult challenge, studying till late at night, getting up early and continue with her personal obligations as older sibling in her home, and face this challenge with responsibility and maturity. Even when there was no money, he would find the means to pay the institute because he wants to see his daughter advance so that she has more opportunities in life. She had to work hard to meet her school's obligations, and in the institute she promised to keep her good grades and be one of the best students and also be a better human being. In order to grow intellectually and have better opportunities in life, and to support her family in a short future, she wants to continue with her studies. She requests KIVA support so that her father can keep up with the payment of the monthly tuition and his daughter does not miss the chance of specializing in this field and later become a successful professional.

loans.use: To pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Lisset Carolina

texts.es: Lisset es una joven de 32 años, honrada, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación,  soltera, con 2 hijos. Actualmente se desempeña como maestra en la escuela San Antonio del municipio de Somotillo. Se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales para la reparación de un cuarto, perlines, zinc, clavos, gastos de mano de obra y así optar a una mejor calidad de vida de ella y sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
32-year old Lisset is honest and hardworking with a great desire to do well in life. She is a single mother with two children. She currently works as a teacher at the San Antonio School in the municipality of Somotillo. 

Lissa has approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy supplies to renovate a room: studs, zinc sheeting, nails, and labor costs. She and her children will then have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy studs, zinc sheeting etc. to repair a room

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 56-year-old woman with eight adult children. She is from Jagna, Bohol. She has been farming rice for 36 years now. Her livelihood paved the way to raising and providing for her children when they were young. Pacita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds so she can better look after her crops.

She knows that fertilizer will positively impact her farming and she can expect a better harvest when used. In the future, Pacita hopes to save and expand her land for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine intends to use the loan to buy cassava, bananas and potatoes to resell. 

She is a 40 year old woman who sells fresh food in Hoima-Uganda. Christine started her business to improve her well being and to raise school fees for her children.  She is the only bread winner in her family.

Debtors who don't pay her on time hinder her business, yet she desires to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava, bananas and potatoes to resell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey wants a loan to buy piglets for rearing. He has a pork joint and earns side income from building. He lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 36, single and charged with the responsibility of taking care of three children. He started business so as to improve on his family's welfare. The high price of pork meat and bad debtors affect his business. He desires to diversify his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret wants a loan to purchase more clothes for selling. She sells second hand clothes in Hoima town Uganda. She is a hardworking lady and aged 48 years. She started her business so as to improve on her general welfare. She has hopes of owning a fully stocked boutique in the future. She is challenged by seasonal variations especially the rainy season since she operates in an open market.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey wants a loan to buy shoes, bags, shirts and dresses for reselling.  He lives in Hoima-Uganda and owns a retail shop. 

He is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of four children.  He earns additional income at a saloon by video shows. 

Geofrey desires to expand his sales although price fluctuations hinder his business. Geofrey is a hardworking man who hopes to transform his business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, shirts and dresses for reselling.

loans.name: Marilie

texts.en:
Marilie is a 35 year-old resident of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol.  She is married and has a 16 year-old son. 

For 15 years Marilie has been farming tomatoes, chilies and papayas to earn an income.  She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides to maintain her crops.  Marilie knows that fertilizer will impact her crops and result in a better harvest.

In the future, Marilie hopes to expand her farming work to increase her profits for her son's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a 44-year-old hardworking, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce whereby he sells maize and coffee as his main source of income though he also carries out farming where he earns extra income. He started this business to pay school fees for his children and have a better standard of living. He faces challenges of competition and weather changes. He has a vision of becoming a rich man and owning a big store of produce.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en: Getrude wants a loan to purchase beans and pork for selling. She has a pork joint in Hoima town Uganda. She is a hardworking lady and aged 45 years. She started her business so as to improve on her welfare. She has hopes of opening other pork joints in the nearby towns despite being challenged by seasonal variations.

loans.use: to purchase beans and pork for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Dulce Maria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DULCE MARÍA” iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa, venta de ropa, fabricación de tambores, venta de regalos, venta de condimentos, confección de deportivos, fabricación de sorteos, librería

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria Luisa es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio desde niña, pues su padre tenia un taller en el cual toda la familia trabajaba, con el pasar del tiempo este negocio fue heredado a ella y por eso está en el negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá  de las Ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la ciudad de Santa Cruz una vez por semana. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “DULCE MARÍA”  communal bank is starting its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Maria Luisa is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling hot dogs and chips, selling clothing, making drums, selling gifts, selling seasonings, making sportswear, putting together raffles, and a bookstore.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Maria Luisa is a member. She says she has joined Pro Mujer this year after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a handicrafts business. She says that she started this business when she was a girl, because her father had a workshop where the whole family worked. After a period of time she inherited the business and that is why she is in this business.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy wool wholesale, which she will buy in the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro. After using it in her work she will sell the finished items in the city of Santa Cruz once a week. This type of work enables her to generate an income to support her family, since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health training and the savings which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Bendicion Barrio De La Paz Group

texts.en:
Quetzaltenango, located in the highlands of Guatemala, is the second largest city in the country. In one of its neighborhoods, a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, called “Bendición Barrio de la Paz" or “Blessed Neighborhood of Peace” was formed and consists of ten Maya-Kiché women. The ladies work in various commercial ventures including a “tortilleria” or a storefront where tortillas are freshly made three times each day and a store for daily consumption. Still other women work in agricultural endeavors and grow vegetables. The ladies are quite excited because it is almost time for them to secure their second loan which they will use to expand their businesses and support their families.

Maria is a 42-year-old member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank. She is a businesswoman who wants to improve her life and leave poverty behind. She has a mill where she makes “nixtamal” which is usually made from dried corn that is soaked in a mixture of water and a mineral called calcium hydroxide. The mineral adds important nutrients to the corn, making it easier to digest. In addition, Maria has a small store where she sells items for daily consumption. She wants to expand her inventory in the store and so she is applying for a loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy items like sugar, rice, noodles, beans, oil, and a variety of other things such as snackfoods.

Maria is happy to be a member of Friendship Bridge because, besides having the opportunity to secure a loan, she expands her knowledge with the educational trainings offered at the monthly meetings by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. In a recent meeting, Maria, along with the other ladies in her group, learned about the use of medicinal plants. The group also gains valuable and useful information about effective business practices and indebtedness so that they can be smart and successful businesswomen.

The ladies have recently learned about Kiva and are aware of the kind and generous investors who read about them and their dreams. The small loans combined with the educational trainings are so beneficial to these women. Maria and the nine Trust Bank members of “Bendición Barrio de la Paz" face a brighter and more empowered future which will benefit not only them but their families and their community as well!

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, beans, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 32 years old from Jagna, Bohol. She is married with a one-year-old son. Marilyn owns a sari-sari store that caters to the needs of her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more canned goods and soft drinks. She is hoping that with the loan she will not experience lacking items needed by her customers. Her income will be for family daily consumption, diapers and milk for her baby.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 21 years old. She is a mother of a 3-month-old baby. Ginalyn is from Jagna, Bohol. She has been engaged in farming vegetables like eggplant and okra for five years now. Ginalyn is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. This will help so she can take care of her crops.

Ginalyn is motivated to work hard on her farming so she can be better prepared for her child. In the future, she hopes to have other businesses so she can give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Anielka Paola

texts.es: Anielka es una joven de 33 años casada,honrada, trabajadora con muchos deseos de superación actual mente se desempeña como maestra en una pequeña escuela en el municipio de Somotillo, se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, y cerámica y pago de mano de obra  para la reparación de su vivienda
texts.en:
33-year old Anielka is honest and hardworking with a great desire to get ahead. She is currently a teacher in a small school in the municipality of Somotillo.

She has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy bricks, cement, tiles, and pay the labor costs to repair her house.

loans.use: Buy bricks, cement, tiles and pay the labor costs to build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish, and others items to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 24 year old married woman.  She sells cassava flour seven days a week and twelve hours a day at a local market.  Scovia started business to have a source of income. 

Scovia hopes to expand business, however competition is challenge she faces.  Scovia is a hardworking woman and appreciates the loan being offered.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is a hard working agronomist from Dashtavan village. She lives there with her husband, 24-years-old son and 22-years-old daughter. Gohar runs a farm. She keeps there 3 calves and cultivates potato and greens. Because the barn that Gohar owns isn't in good conditions she isn't able to keep more livestock. So, by applying for this loan Gohar asks financial support of USD 3000 to be able to make improvements in her farm. The loan will help her to purchase a cow, forage for the livestock, make renovation of the barn and hire workers for organizing cultivation process. Gohar will be very thankful for lenders' support.
As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, forage for the livestock, renovation of the barn and hire workers for organizing cultivation process

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte will be using this loan to plant corn and animal fodder. The amount she is requesting from Kiva lenders is an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek. 

Marte’s main activity is agriculture/livestock. She has three milk cows and 100 chickens. She sells cheese that she makes with the raw milk from her cows and she also sells eggs and little chickens. Her husband works as a farmer in the neighboring villages on an hourly basis. He plows the soil and vineyards and also hoes corn for other villagers. Marte’s activity and her husband’s pay are the only sources of income for their family of five. 

Hospitality and friendliness is what distinguishes their village amongst other ones in the region.

loans.use: to plant corn and animal fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Flor De Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ESTRELLAS” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de macramé, venta de golosinas, venta de jugos y batidos, tienda de barrio, pensión, servicio de construcción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de deportivos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio desde niña, pues su padre tenía un taller en el cual toda la familia trabajaba, con el pasar del tiempo ella decide tener un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá  de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación en salud y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “FLOR DE ESTRELLAS” communal bank is starting its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Julia is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: macrame crafts, selling sweets, selling fruit juices and milk shakes, local shop, guesthouse and construction services.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Julia is a member. She says this is the second year she has been a member of Pro Mujer, after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business making sportswear. She says that she started this business when she was a girl, because her father had a workshop where the whole family worked. Over a period of time she decided to set up in business independently.

The loan she is taking out is to increase capital to buy fabric wholesale, which she will buy in the wholesale stores. She will use this to make up items to sell which customers have ordered. This type of work enables her to generate an income to support her family, since she is married and has eight children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health training and the savings which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años de edad, solamente logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, ahora ella está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Maria se dedica al comercio de frutas, ella se levanta a las 4:30 AM. junto a su esposo  para realizar sus actividades diarias mientras sus hijos van a la escuela, el oficio lo aprendio de su madre, su esposo trabaja en la parcela y camina 2 km para llegar al lugar y en el transcurso de la tarde ella busca más frutas para salir a venderla al día siguiente.
 
		El crédito solicitado, lo necesita para comprar dos vacas que le producirán leche para la elaboración de queso, el cual sale a venderlo a sus alrededores y le genera ingresos para mantener a su familia.

 Sus planes a futuro son que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta frutas y de la siembra y  del préstamo para la compra de las vacas, podrá en un futuro  incrementar el numero de vacas y así la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old with a grade 9 education. She is now married and her husband works on the land. Maria earns her living selling fruit. She gets up at 4:30 am along with her husband so they can do the daily chores while their children are in school. It was Maria's mother who taught her about selling fruit. Her husband walks the 2 km to his parcel of land. In the afternoon she looks for more fruit to sell the following day.

Maria is seeking a loan to buy two milk cows so she can make cheese to sell in the surrounding areas. In this way she would generate income for her family.

In the future she wants to use the income from fruit sales, the harvest, and the cows bought with the loan money to buy more cows and increase milk production.

loans.use: Buy two cows

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad tranquila y hospitalaria, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos desde hace tres años en la parte posterior a su domicilio, también brinda servicio como jornalero agrícola ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de cerdos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un precio mayor.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a quiet and hospitable community, located in the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Peru.

For the past three years, he has made his living with his wife, raising and selling small animals like pigs in the area behind his house. He also works as an agricultural day laborer.

He has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy animal feed to fatten up the pigs, so that he can sell them at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: María Socorro

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad,  es una persona que estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona soltera. 
María se levanta a las 4:30 a.m para realizar sus actividades diarias. Trabaja en unos terrenos que para llegar ahí, camina 3 kilómetros; en el transcurso de la tarde, ella se dedica a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar queso y venderlo. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para  comprar una vaca y podrá producir mas leche para la elaboración de queso y así incrementar sus ingresos para su sustento.

 María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la elaboración del queso y de la siembra de maíz y del préstamo para la compra de la vaca podrá comprar en un futuro un terreno donde pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, and only attended school until sixth grade.  She is single.  María wakes up at 4:30am to perform her daily activities.  She works on a plot of land that is a 3 kilometer walk for her.  In the afternoons, she works milking the cows to make cheese to sell.  

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase a cow that will allow her to produce more milk to make cheese, thereby increasing her income.  María believes that with the income she receives from making cheese and growing corn, as well as the loan to purchase the cow, in the future she will be able to purchase a plot of land where her animals can graze.

loans.use: purchase a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Laura Yesenia

texts.es:
Laura Yesenia es una persona que nació en Bogotá, desde siempre ha sido una mujer que le gusta aprender y estudiar porque considera importante salir adelante, cumplir las metas y buscar un mejor bienestar.
Cuando cumplió los 12 años, decidió que se inclinaría por el área de la salud, así que emprendió los estudios enfocados en la enfermería como profesión, siempre ha sido una persona con el anhelo de ayudar a los demás y demostrarles que aunque no se nace con muchos recursos, los sueños se pueden cumplir con esfuerzo y dedicación.
La familia está compuesta por la madre Mireya, el padre Jaime, el hermano Jhohan Sebastian y la abuela Catalina. 
Aunque aún está en una formación bachiller, ha empezado a trabajar por los proyectos profesionales y con la ayuda de los padres ha logrado ingresar en un instituto llamado Campo alto, para empezar a construir el futuro.
Actualmente Laura busca más y mas oportunidades, dando siempre lo mejor, siendo muy respetuosa y dedicada; tiene varios conocimientos, pero considera que le faltan demasiados y que las oportunidades de estudio son un medio para conseguirlos, ella se entero del convenio que tiene campo alto con kiva y le pareció una buena alternativa para poder pagar en la valor de las cuotas un poco mas económicas, ya que siempre los gastos en las casa son un poco elevados y mas que ella aun no ha terminado el bachillerato tiene el gasto del colegio y el de la carrera que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Laura Yesenia was born in Bogota and has always been a person who likes studying and learning because she thinks it's important for making progress in life, fulfilling goals and increasing personal wellbeing. When she was 12 years old she decided that she was interested in working in healthcare, so she chose studies geared towards nursing as a profession. She has always been a person with a desire to help others and to show people that even if you come from a poor background, your dreams can be attained through hard work and dedication.

Her family consists of her mother Mireya, father Jaime, her brother Jhohan Sebastian and her grandmother Catalina. Although she is still studying at high school, she has started working towards her planned profession and with the help of her parents she has managed to be accepted into an institution called Campo Alto, to start building her future.

Currently Laura is looking for opportunities all the time, always giving of her best and being very respectful and dedicated. She has a lot of knowledge but thinks she has a lot more still to learn and that the opportunity to study is a way to achieve this.

She found out about the agreement that Campo Alto has with Kiva and it seemed to be a good alternative for her to be able to pay the instalments a bit more cheaply. The household costs are always quite high and since she hasn't yet finished high school she has to pay her college costs as well as the cost of the course she is doing.

loans.use: to pay a term's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas y y repuestos para su mototaxi y de esta manera brindar un servicio seguro a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mateo is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Pucará district, a community that makes its living in farming, commerce and ranching. It is situated in the Jaén Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He offers public transportation services, taking his passengers to the hamlets neighboring his district.

He has applied for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy tires and spare parts for his mototaxi, so that he can provide his customers with safer service.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pucará una comunidad con clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz, café y frutales, también se dedica al comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de piña, dedicándose este rubor desde hace tres años, Edith ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edith is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Pucará, situated in the province of Jaen which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The area has a hot climate. The local people earn a living from agriculture, particularly growing rice, coffee and fruit trees. They also work in commerce and livestock.

Edith works in agriculture with her husband, especially growing pineapples, which they have been growing for three years. Edith has asked for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to pay for labour for looking after the pineapple crop. This will give her a good harvest to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to pay day labourers for looking after her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Nedime

texts.en:
Nedime is a widowed lady and a mother of two. She needs to cover her medical expenses and this is why she is requesting a loan from lenders. Both of her knees have been hurting for some time now. The doctors have told her that she suffers from excess fluid accumulation in and around her knee joints.

Nedime lives in the city of Korca, in the southeastern part of Albania. Nedime lives with her married son who works as a driver in a private firm and with his wife who works in a shoe manufacturer that is owned and operated by foreign investors. Shoe and garment manufacturers run by foreigners are plenty in Albania and 5,000 or more women in large cities are employed in such businesses.

loans.use: to cover her medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice and milk for her business.

loans.name: Amelia Leticia

texts.es:
Amelia Leticia tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutas, café y arroz, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace tres años, son una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para el pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amelia Leticia is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and children in the Pomahuaca district, a community with a warm climate. Its population makes its living in agriculture, particularly growing fruits, coffee and rice. It is located in the Jaén Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She makes her living farming with her husband, growing rice in particular. They have made their living doing this for the past three years. They are a united family that works hard at what they do.

She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to pay day laborers for the upkeep of her rice crop so that she can have a timely harvest to offer her customers.

loans.use: to pay for day laborers to maintain her rice crop.

loans.name: Normal Group

texts.fr:
Alexandre fait partie du groupe Normal. Il a 38 ans et est mariée  à Angélique, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés   de 12  à   15 ans.

Il fait le commerce des  ustensiles (casseroles, assiettes, thermos,…)  depuis 11 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’ustensiles de cuisines (casseroles, assiettes, thermos,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait construire une   maison dans sa parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Alexandre, age 38, is a member of the group “Normal”. He is married to a farmer named Angélique, and together they have five children aged 12 to 15 years old.

Alexandre has been selling kitchen utensils (pots, plates, thermos, etc.) for 11 years. 

This is his first loan with Turame. He plans to use the funds to bolster his working capital and stock up on kitchen utensils that he will sell to increase his revenue. 

In the coming years, he wants to build a house on his land, and he also hopes to see his children continue their education.

loans.use: to bolster his working capital and stock up on kitchen utensils that he will sell to increase his revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes such as plates, bowls, cups, etc.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agrcultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece variedad de abarrotes y cerveza, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio desde hace dos años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceite y otros productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodolinda is 43 years old and lives with her husband and their children in the Buenos Aires district, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the Morropon province, which is in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.  

She has a small store that sells a variety of groceries and beer.  Her business has been located in her home for the past two years, and she has a considerable amount of customers.  She has requested a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase products in bulk like rice, sugar, oil and other products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: purchase products in bulk such as rice, sugar and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, es una persona casada que estudio hasta sexto grado, convive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad.  Él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa e hijos que le apoyan en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana y en la tarde sus hijos asisten a la escuela.

José  junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de su padre; para llegar al terreno  camina 2  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche en los alrededores.


El  préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla,  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Él planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, de la siembra y del préstamo para la compra de la novilla podrá comprar más animales.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and studied as far as sixth grade. He is married and lives with his wife and their two children aged 8 and 10. He gets up at 4.30am with his wife and children who help him with the agricultural tasks in the morning. In the afternoon the children go to school. 

José and his wife make a living from agriculture, which he learnt from his father. He walks 2km to get to his land and he works hard during the morning. His wife does the domestic tasks and looks after the cows they have so she can sell milk in the local area.

José is asking for a loan to buy a heifer which will in the future help to increase the production of milk to sell and provide extra income for his family. His plan is that with the income he gets from selling milk, from his crops and the loan for buying the heifer, he will be able to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: El Hdji

texts.fr:
El hadji est un cultivateur âgé de 35 ans il est marié et père de 7 enfants, il est établi dans le village de Témeye, il a commencé cette activité de culture maraîchère depuis qu'il est tout petit avec ses parents, avec ce prêt, il va acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il envisage entre autre d'augmenter sa zone d'intervention et de vente des produits maraîchers et la quantité produite par campagne.
texts.en:
El Hdji is a 35-year-old farmer who is married with seven children. He lives in the village of Témeye. 

El Hdji became involved in market gardening at a young age alongside his parents. He will use this loan to buy onion seed, herbicides and fertilizers. 

His goals are to expand his area of operation and sale of produce, and to increase the yield produced per campaign.

loans.use: to buy onion seed, herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, gallinas, cerdos desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento y ladrillos para construcción de corrales para una mejor distribución de sus animales.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district in Chiclayo Province, which belongs to Lambayeque Region on the North Coast of Perú. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Together with his wife Jorge has been raising and selling farm animals like ducks, chickens and pigs for 4 years. His business is located at his house. Jorge has requested a loan of 3000 PEN to buy cement and bricks to build corrals for a better distribution of his animals.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to build corrals for his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene un horno artesanal donde se dedica a la elaboración de diversos tipos de panes, galletas y otros, su esposa le apoya en las ventas que lo realizan en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos en mayor cantidad sacos de harina, azúcar, polvo de hornear entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Rogelio is 39 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Lagunas. Located in the Chiclayo province of the Chiclayo region on Peru's northern coast, it's a community that works in farming, commerce, and livestock. He has an artisanal oven where he's employed in the production of different types of breads, cookies, and more. His wife helps with the sales, which are transacted in their home, and he has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to purchase larger amounts of supplies such as flour, sugar, and baking powder among other things. This would allow him to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, and baking powder to make his bakeries' products

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a las ciudades cercanas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is 30 years old and lives with his wife and children in Pucara district. The climate is hot and the population is dedicated to agriculture, especially to cultivating fruit, rice and coffee.
