Pucara is located in Jaen Province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern Andes mountains.

Cesar Augusto provides public transportation services with his own mototaxi, transporting his passengers to nearby cities in his district. He is soliciting a loan of 500 sols to purchase replacement parts for his vehicle hoping, in this manner, to offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: buy replacement parts for his moto-taxi, to give customers better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter-ball, plantain, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
Grimaneza se dedica con la venta de comida y continua al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo fideos, verduras, carne, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.

(La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Grimaneza sells food and is still a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as noodles, vegetables, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other items. Grimaneza appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy noodles, vegetables, meat, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LOMAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabeth es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de overoles, venta de chompas, venta de negocios, venta de chamarras, venta de mantas, venta de alfombras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabeth es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por al ayudar a su madre en su negocio, posteriormente decide implementar un negocio independiente iniciando este con el préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The community bank Las Lomas will begin its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office. It consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors in which Elizabeth is Secretary. The businesses managed by the community bank's members are varied and include: selling overalls, selling sweaters, selling businesses, sellling jackets, selling blankets, and selling rugs. The loan they will receive will benefit micro-entrepreneurs like Elizabeth. She says that she's been a member of Pro Mujer for four years, joining after being invited by a friend who was a member of the institution. Currently she has a sewing and clothes selling business, and states that she first undertook this line of work to help her mom's business, and then decided to set up her own shop with a loan she obtained from Pro Mujer. The loan she's going to get now is to increase the capital (the purchase of fabric) she will acquire from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and after production she'll market the goods in her shop. This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she's single and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Wael  Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Wael Al-Hodeidah Group is a group of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Salamah is a leader of the group. She is a 33-year-old widow, living with her three children in a poor family. Although she is an uneducated woman, she is very dynamic and active. After the death of her husband, she became the sole breadwinner of her family. The condition of her family became more miserable, so she decided to take care of her children. 

Three years ago, Salamah started up her business as a door-to-door seller. She began selling incense, perfumes, accessories, and other simple goods. From this humble business, she earned a good profit, and she decided to continue. Since most of what she earns goes to cover family expenses, she applied for a loan of YER 30,000 from AMB in order to purchase more incense, perfumes, and other goods.

Salamah looks forward to opening a small store to sell incense and perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase incense, perfumes, and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marino

texts.en:
Marino is an associate, running a special loan from Esperanza International Dominican Republic's (Esperanza) Water Project, which gives to associates and members from social groups in any community Esperanza serves, this type of loan to help their communities. 

In this special loan, Marino is representing his church from the community of Los Frailes, from the North of Santo Domingo. They (the church, called Iglesia de Dios Los Frailes II) started a water project in order to provide purified water to their community inhabitants, giving the service at a low price, but with high quality and the proper standard.

With this loan, they will invest in a generator to provide energy to the water plant, a pickup truck to distribute the water, a motorcycle to make deliveries, and also to improve their distribution point (where they sterilize gallons, fill bottles with purified water, and deliver them to the neighbors that go directly to the business to buy them or sellers that distribute them). By "improve," they mean to buy five-gallon water bottles and labels and change system pieces.

Marino is the pastor in this church and he is also in charge of the water project, called Agua Vaso de Vida (Glass of Life Water). In their neighborhood live around 20,000 people and their plan is to distribute purified water to 75% of the inhabitants, at a cost of USD 0.50 for a five-gallon bottle of water. With this, Marino said, they want to impact different areas: economic, health, spiritual, and many others. 

This community is an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo, with many salubrious problems, potable water scarcity, diseases, and distrust of people with other water distributors, etc. and with programs like this, the community could start changing their lives. This church is committed to start as many projects as it can, to contribute to the development of this community.

loans.use: to buy a generator, a pickup truck, motorcycle,  and other items to distribute water in his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Greens Ranganath - Anagwadi Group

texts.en:
At the age of 32, Hanumavva is married and has five children; four are in school, while another son rears sheep. Her husband has a small sheep farm in the village of Anagwadi, Bagalkot, Karnataka. Hanumavva has a primary school degree, but wants her children to have higher education and have access to a better life.   

Hanumavva wants to support her family, and for that she has joined the group “Greens Ranganath” along with four other women. The Joint Liability Group (JLG) has been trained in sheep agricultural practices. The women have set up their own microenterprises and are setting up their own sheep and goat rearing farms.  Hanumavva also has set up a farm along with her husband. 

The income she is generating from goat rearing mostly goes into her children’s education. She now wants to expand her business to secure savings for the future of her family and for the higher education of her children. 

She seeks a loan to expand her microenterprise. Hanumavva is a hardworking woman. Apart from working on her newly created small farm, she also works as a labourer in other village farms, where for a day’s hard labour she earns INR 100.  

The additional income is going to make her life easy and also will empower her to fulfill her dreams, which she so dearly endures for her children.

loans.use: to buy lambs and sheep.

loans.name: Greens Shreelaxmi-Anagwadi Group

texts.en:
This Joint Liability Group (JLG) was started by five women with a common background. All the group members are residing in Anagwadi village, Bagalkot Disrict. 

Yallavva is the leader (standing at the right in the photo with hand raised). She is married and 38 years old. She is the mother of three children (two girls and a boy). All are studying. Her husband is a fisherman. He fishes in the nearby river and sells in the local market. 

Yallavva is into goat rearing, and at times works in the agriculture fields of others as a day labourer. She wants a loan, which will allow her to buy more lambs and breed them. The loan will help her expand her farm and earn more profits. 

The profits made will allow her to take care of the basic family needs and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase lambs and sheep.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She lives with 4 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been operating a fishing business for 7 years.

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 1 loan from them.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a water tank and clean water filter.

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to build a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more auto repair parts for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman and a mother of two children from Trinidad, Bohol. Elvira earns a living through her food vending business. She cooks and sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place.

Elvira is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients used in making banana snacks, such as sugar, oil, and flour. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more homemade doughnuts, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Elvira has hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients used in making banana snacks, such as sugar, oil, and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tea, bread, biscuits, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Melati Putih Group

texts.en:
Kadek succeeded to maintain her three pigs. Although given the mixture feeds, with good treatment, the pigs grew healthy and fat. She sold them for 1,400,000 IDR each. Now, the price per kilogram is 25,000 IDR. She’s very happy about the result. She uses the profit for capital to buy a local sow and set aside for saving. Her husband also feels happy. The business helps the income of their family.
 
Because the price of feed is high, the Melati Putih group requested a loan for the same amount. Each member gets 1,500,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed. Kadek will use the loan to buy a saw and fix the cage. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feeds. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. If she already has enough savings, she will raise pigs with her own capital, and buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a saw and fix the cage.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hồng is 23 years old and she is married with two children.
Hồng lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hồng has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family share neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build toilet.

In the future, Hồng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet.

loans.name: Kiêm

texts.en:
Kiêm operates a business fishing, and has been involved in this business for 7 years. She is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Kiêm's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

The main hardship that Kiêm faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment for a toilet in order to repair a latrine/toilet.

In the future, Kiêm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment for a toilet in order to repair a latrine/toilet .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is married and has two children. She is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer who supports their family. Ronalyn is engaged in hog raising, which she has been doing for several years. 

Ronalyn requested a loan, which she will use to buy pig feed and maintenance supplies such as pig vitamins. With this loan, she will be able to improve her hog  raising business thus augmenting her profit and income. In the future, Ronalyn hopes to make her business more profitable so that she can save money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Ma. Vanessa

texts.en:
Ma. Vanessa is a married woman and a mother of  two children aged five and four. 

For two years now, Ma. Vanessa has operated a sari-sari store where she sells snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods, and soft drinks. She is also engaged in seaweed farming.

Ma. Vanessa is asking for a loan to buy straw, seaweed seedlings, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, and candies. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract more buyers, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy straw, seaweed seedlings, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning, and candies

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a married woman and a mother of four grown children. Dioscora lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Dioscora earns a living through selling home-cooked snack foods. This is the source of her income.

Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more snack foods to the people in her place. 

In the future, Dioscora has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter, cooking oil, and other items

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA” iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de vestidos, venta de chompas, venta de verduras, venta de chamarras, venta de papa, venta de busos, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por al ayudar a su madre en su negocio, posteriormente decide implementar un negocio independiente iniciando este con el préstamo obtenido en Pro Mujer.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le el ahorro que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Primavera community bank is starting their 27th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional center.  The group has eight members and is led by an executive board where Elsa is the president.  The group members have a variety of businesses, including dress sales, sweater sales, vegetable sales, coat sales, potato sales, clothing sales, and fruit sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit all of their small businesses, including Elsa's.  She joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution.  She has a business selling clothing.  She started the business after she helped her mother with her business and decided to open her own business with the help of a loan from Pro Mujer.

She is requesting this loan to increase her working capital and purchase fabric.  She will make the purchases at wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and later make and sell the clothing in her store.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the savings the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: El Altiplano Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL ALTIPLANO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yuli ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende chompas, pantalones, polos, medias entre otras ropas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones o sus amigos, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas, medias, polos pantalones y casacas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "El Altiplano" communal bank.  This bank is located in the Anta district, which is in the Cusco province and the Cusco region.  Yuli, a member of the bank, is 34 years old and has two children.  She works in her business that sells clothing.  She sells sweaters, pants, polo shirts, socks, and other clothing items.  She works from 8am to 7pm, taking her clothing to different places like schools or her friends.  She has been working in this business for eight years, and it has gone very well for her.  Her dream is to have her own store where she can sell her clothing.  She is requesting this loan to purchase sweaters, socks, polo shirts, pants and coats.

The members who are in the inserted pictures were photographed after the meeting because they could not attend the meeting due to work obligations.  The other members work selling clothing, selling shoes, in grocery stores, and selling purses.  The members are thankful to those who are contributing to their dreams through this medium, and they are committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase sweaters, socks, polo shirts, pants and coats.

loans.name: San Cristobal De Aparquilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN CRISTOBAL DE APARQUILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila ella es conviviente y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de carteras.

Las socias que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo después la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SAN CRISTOBAL DE APARQUILLA” communal bank, which is located in the Anta district, belonging to the Anta province and department of Cusco. Cirila, who is a member, is 52 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children. She has a business raising and selling animals and also has a grocery shop where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk. 

She rears guinea pigs and chickens, growing them on and fattening them for selling on at various markets. Through this small business Cirila is able to bring up her children. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the chickens and guinea pigs. 

Cirila is asking for the loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs as well as feed for them. 

The other members have businesses selling clothing, selling shoes, selling bags and a grocery shop. The members whose photos are attached to the group photo had their photos taken after the main photo because they asked permission for work reasons.

Cirila thanks those who form part of this dream in this way and promises to meet her repayments in the agreed timeframe.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Hường

texts.en:
Mrs. Hường operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Hường is 33 years old and she is married with two children.
Hường lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hường has been involved in this business for nine years. The main hardship that Hường faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Hường hopes to maintain a successful business, be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
The idea of Express Services Group was born while I was home for my maternity leave from my then employer, Concept One Staffing. During my leave, the owner of Concept One Staffing decided to close the industrial side of his company and expand more of his efforts towards the Las Vegas office and that market. Unfortunately, the industrial division was where I was focused and from where most of my income was generated, and with a new baby, travel to Las Vegas did not seem realistic.

So the decision was made to leave Concept One and start my own staffing solutions company. Since most of Concept One's clients were generated through me, it was not hard to convince them to follow me to the new company, especially since Concept One was redirecting its business model to exclude servicing them.

The first year was tough, with a new baby and growing a business, but 2005 proved beyond a shadow of a doubt that I made the right decision for myself and my family. Express Services Group not only serves several of my original clients, but has expanded its market to include many new companies.

I love what I do. Every day when I put people to work, people who really need to provide for their families, it makes all the struggles to get where I am today worth it. As my daughter gets older each year, she understands more about how important what I do is and gives her a great background in work ethics. With a single working mom, it is very important for her to realize how important what we do is and what it means to families all over the country.

There have been many challenges through the last few years. The economy and mass layoffs have changed the entire landscape of my life and business. I now have learned to do what I do without most of the bells and whistles of my industry. Sometimes it works against me because some larger companies want to work with agencies that have all those things. But what I offer is personal and detail-oriented service, something the larger companies have a very hard time providing. I work with small to middle-sized local businesses, helping them grow their companies; unfortunately those companies do not have deep pockets, so it's more of a labor of love with enough profit to live on, but not much more. Hopefully the future economy will be better, and my business will continue to grow and flourish.

I will be using the Kiva loan to help with some current operational bills that I need to catch up on. During the holidays, business slowed down a bit and workers compensation rates increased across the board, and things got really tough. Since then, business has improved by 80% at least, and while I am making enough now, making up for the amounts owed is causing a major drain on moving forward.

I look forward to a great year. I plan on trying to explore a couple of new markets to expand my base, and maybe invest in a sales-generating firm to assist me with bringing on new clients.

What I love the most about my business is putting people to work and the impact on everyone, from every walk of life. More people working means a stronger economy for all. It means families have food and shelter; it means our children can go to college and be part of the next working generation. This company means everything to me, and I will do everything in my power to keep these doors open and keep putting people to work.

loans.use: to pay for current operational bills and invest in a sales-generating firm to assist with bringing on new clients.

loans.name: Tính

texts.en:
Mrs. Tính operates a fishing business.

Tính is 48 years old and married with three children.
Tính supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tính's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Tính has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tính faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Tính hopes for her business to do well, be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and buy a land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase car engine parts and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Ruth Noymi

texts.es: Noymi vive en la  hermosa ciudad de Challabamba y se dedica  a la compra y venta de madera. Ella sigue participando en el banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Noymi lives in the beautiful city of Challabamba and has a business of buying and selling wood. She is still a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”. Noymi is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy wood. She appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a fishing business. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Bình is 39 years old and married with four children, who are dependents. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Bình faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Đông

texts.en:
Mrs. Đông operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

Đông is 37 years old and married with two children. Đông lives with three dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đông's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Đông has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đông faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a water tank and clean water filter.

With her business profit, Đông hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Ruth Iracema

texts.es:
Ruth de 27 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta bachillerato y es soltera, sus padres se dedican a la agricultura. Ella  se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a sus padres  para realizar sus actividades diarias.


Ruth se dedica a comercializar pollo de engorde,  oficio que le  enseño su madre, mientras su padre trabaja en las parcelas camina 3 K.m. para llegar. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas pollos para engordar, además de construir una galera más amplia para mantener a los pollos ahí.

 Ruth planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de los pollos,  en un futuro ampliar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Ruth is 27 years old. She studied until high school and is single. Her parents make a living in agriculture. She wakes up at 4:30 a.m. along with her parents to perform her daily activities.

Ruth makes a living selling fattened chickens, a trade that her mother taught her, while her father works the plots of land. She walks 3 km to get to her work.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase more chickens to fatten, as well as to construct a larger coop in which to keep the chickens.

With the income that she receives from selling the chickens, Ruth plans to grow her business and make a higher income to support her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens to fatten.

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es:
José Humberto tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa propia de material rustico, en el distrito de Pucara una zona de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, su esposa e hijos le apoyan en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José Humberto is 61 years old, and lives with his wife and their children in their own home made of rustic materials.  They live in the Pucara district, a zone with a warm climate whose population is devoted to agriculture, commerce and livestock.  It is located in the Jaén province which is part of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing rice.  His wife and children help him with his work.  He has requested a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to pay for labor to maintain his rice crops.  This way, he will have a good harvest to offer to his customers.

loans.use: pay day laborers to maintain his rice crops.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with ten children. She is 48 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

Fe sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 2000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Fe has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
After a 6 month loan period, Ni Wayan and the Srikandi 2 Group managed to pay off their previous loan without any problems. From the sale of 4 pigs, Ni Wayan made a profit of 250,000 IDR per month.
 
As a housewife who lives in the village, Ni Wayan wishes to pursue the pig business. In order to help her husband, who works as a farmer, and to finance her children, Ni Wayan has gone back to MUK to borrow 3,500,000 IDR. Together with Srikandi 2 Group, Ni Wayan plans to use this loan to buy 4 piglets for fattening at 400,000 IDR each, to be maintained for 6 months. Now she is also trying a new business as a chicken egg seller and retailer for daily needs.

Ni Wayan expects the price per kilo of pig to go up and feed prices to go down in the next 6 months, so the profits will be greater than in the previous period. The profits will be used to raise capital for her pig business.

loans.use: to buy 4 piglets for fattening

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la hermosa ciudad de Challabamba y se dedica a  la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo, verduras y otras cosas más.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sol Naciente de Mojopata” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 

Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (La comunidad Mojopata está ubicado en distrito de la Challabamba de la provincia de Paucartambo, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juana lives in the beautiful city of Challabamba. She is a farmer and has several plots of land on which she grows potatoes, wheat, vegetables, and other crops. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente de Mojopata”.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers. Juana appreciates and values this loan, so she promises to handle her monthly payments with great responsibility.

The community of Mojopata is located in the District of Challabamba, Paucartambo Province, Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Karen  en su actividad comercial; ella con su credikiva compró ropa femenina, prendas de acero y en cristal murano, que fueron muy importantes parea satisfacer los gustos y necesidades del cliente. El monto de su crédito fue significativo sus inventarios dieron una imagen elegante a su negocio y ha reinvertido sus ganancias en él. Por ello Karen cuenta con más clientela y lo mejor es que ha continuado sus estudios porque sueña con terminar su carrera profesional para genera muchos mas ingresos. Ella da el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores: “Estoy muy agradecida y espero que nos sigan apoyando para sacar mi negocio adelante poniendo una miscelánea mas grande”. En la actualidad Karen se encuentra aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará jeans sueteres para damas, caballeros e infantil. Para ello viajará a la ciudad de Medellin donde la industria tiene una gran oferta de confecciones de alta calidad, y adicionalmente disfrutará de los paisajes de tupidas montañas y las orquideas mas lindas del mundo.
texts.en: Thanks for supporting Karen in her commercial activity.  With her Kiva loan (credikiva) she bought women's clothing, steel and Murano crystal things, which were very important to satisfy the taste and needs of her customers. The amount of the loan was significant. Her stocks gave an elegant image to her business and she has reinvested her earnings in it. Therefore, Karen has now more customers and the best part is that she has continued with her studies because she dreams of finishing her professional career to generate much more income. She sends the following message to the lenders: "I am very grateful and hope that we keep counting with your support to move my business forward by getting more diverse products". Currently Karen is requesting a credikiva loan with which she will buy jeans and sweaters for women, men and children. For this she will travel to the city of Medellin, where the industry has a big supply of high quality clothes, and additionally she will enjoy landscapes of green mountains and the most beautiful orchids of the world.

loans.use: to buy jeans and sweaters for women, men and children

loans.name: Floripes

texts.en:
Floripes is married and has four children. She is 46 years old and lives in Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Floripes is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to redeem her 20 coconut trees pawned. Floripes has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Floripes hopes to supplement her family's income and to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to redeem her 20 coconut trees pawned

loans.name: Aizat

texts.ru: Айзат 27 лет, не замужем. В 2013 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 60,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Айзат имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Айзат смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Айзат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Айзат планирует вложить в товарооборот.
texts.en: Aizat is 27 years old and single.  She started a children clothing sales business in 2013, using a sum of 60,000 som (KGS) as her initial capital. Having been able to develop her business and obtain regular customers, Aizat has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work in business, Aizat was able to increase her goods turnover and grow her business. In order to further increase and expand her business, Aizat requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to increase goods turnover. Aizat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into goods turnover.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers to maintain the coffee farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Munara

texts.ru: Мунаре 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Мунары - среднее образование, вместе с мужем Мунара занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мунары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 15 овец, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 7,58 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -ячмень. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мунара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Munara is 60 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Munara has a secondary education. She and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Munara's hard work, today her business contains 5 dairy cows, 15 sheep and 2 horses. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). She also works on 7.58 hectares of land, where she primarily grows barley.  The obtained harvest is sold to wholesale distributors.  In order to further develop her business, Munara requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cows to increase livestock headcount. Munara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for holding a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Isabelito

texts.en:
Isabelito is a married man residing in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has been working in the hog raising business for several years now, and this is the source of his income.

Isabelito is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, he will be able to improve his hog raising business and augment his income and profit. In the future, he hopes to make his business a success and to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình operates a fishing business. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Bình is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Bình faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks, and equipment for a toilet to repair the latrine/toilet.

In the future, Bình hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks, and equipment for a toilet to repair the latrine/toilet.

loans.name: Ernesto Rodrigo

texts.es:
Ernesto es un joven paceño que vive desde hace cuatro años en Cochabamba. Es el séptimo hijo de diez hermanos, su mamá continua trabajando y su papá ya se jubiló. 
Ernesto se considera una persona muy emprendedora, por lo que está iniciando varios negocios, como limpieza de oficinas y decoración de globos. Él no pudo ingresar a la universidad ya que como su familia es numerosa los ingresos de su hogar eran escasos por lo que no todos los hijos pudieron estudiar. Es por eso que Ernesto solicita un crédito educativo, para cursar la carrera de ingeniería comercial y al concluir sus estudios lograr cumplir su sueño que es poder construir un hogar estable.
Ernesto de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a él se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a young native of La Paz, who has lived in Cochabamba for the past four years.  He is the seventh of ten brothers.  His mother still works and his father is retired.  Ernesto considers himself to be an enterprising person as he has started many business such as cleaning offices and balloon decoration.  He was not able to attend university because his family is so large that the household's income was not able to pay for everyone to attend school.  

For this reason, Ernesto is seeking an education loan to enter a career in commercial engineering.  Upon completing his education, he will achieve his dream of building a stable home.  Ernesto would like to thank the people who help others through their financial resources, and create opportunity for growth, as they are doing for him now.

loans.use: pay for tuition for his commercial engineering program.

loans.name: Warmicuna Llanqanchis Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WARMICUNA LLANQANCHIS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luciana ella es casada y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Warmicuna Llanqanchis community bank is located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Luciana is a member of the group.  She is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  She works selling and raising animals.  She raises guinea pigs and chickens, fattens them as they grow, and later sells them at different markets.  This small business helps her move her family forward.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens.  She is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for them.  

The other group members work selling clothing, selling chicha [traditional maize based drink], at a grocery store, and selling animals.  

She is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fotemogoban est majoritairement composé de femmes  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers  de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, basins, et  légers),  de la banane, du ciment et d’arachide. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Minata (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, bazins, et  légers). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 mètres de tissus légers et 18mètres de bazins (riches et moyens) à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji  et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Minata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif de subvenir aux besoins de la famille surtout les enfants dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The members of Fotemogoban Group average 46 years of age and five children. They all live in Djalakorodji, a neighborhood in Bamako, and most of them are monogamous women.

They got to know each other through bonds of community. They retail clothing, such as Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth), bazin fabrics, and lightweight fabric, as well as bananas, cement, and peanuts.

In order to build up their stock of products, the members of the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Mrs. Minata is the second woman from the left in the photograph. She's very well-known as a reseller of clothing (Wax pagnes, bazin fabrics, lightweight fabric). She intends to use her loan to buy 20 pieces of Wax pagnes, 15 meters of lightweight fabric, and 18 meters of bazin fabric (rich and medium) in Bamako.

She retails in Djalakorodji and as a traveling saleswoman, to a mixed-gender clientele. With this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000, to be in part reinvested in her business.

Her goal is to provide for the needs of her family, especially her children, thanks to this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy 20 pieces of Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth), 15 meters of lightweight fabric, and 18 meters of bazin fabric

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu  operates a fishing business.

Thu is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Thu lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thu  faces in her life is not having a latrine so her family share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

In the future Thu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 32 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine, so she is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business. She hopes that her business will do well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water filter

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen operates a fishing business. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Sen is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives with five dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Sen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Sen faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Sen hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga operates a fishing business. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She is 30 years old and she is married with four children. She lives with four dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Nga faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a water tank and clean water filter.

With her business profit, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a water tank and clean water filter.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is widowed with 3 children. Loreta is 54 years old and lives in Mialen Clarin, Philippines.
Loreta is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional palay seedlings and for labor expenses.
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future Loreta hopes to expand her rice land and to save more for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional palay seedlings and for labor expenses

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a farmer from Bohol, Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. Marjorie is engaged in vegetable farming business for more than 18 years  now. She grows onions, cabbage and other crops. This is the source of her income. 

Marjorie is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. With this, she will be able to improve the harvest of her farm, thus, allowing her to sell more to the market. 

In the future, Marjorie hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Aitilla

texts.ru: Айтиле 62 года, вдова, после смерти супруга одна воспитала детей. Все дети самостоятельные, живут отдельно. У Айтилы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айтила занимается животноводством, стартовав 7 лет назад, с покупки скота на 12,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айтилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 теленок, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айтила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айтила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aitilla is 62 years old, a widow and raised her children alone after her husband's death.   All of the children are now independent and live separately.  Aitilla has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Aitilla is involved in animal husbandry, having started 7 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aitilla's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 1 calf and 15 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Aitilla requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy a calf to increase livestock headcount. Aitilla plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Aracely Margoth

texts.es: Aracely de 33 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 3 a 11 años,  en la ciudad de Cartagena en un lugar  de hermosas playas, brisa y mar. Desde hace 10 años cada mañana  desde las 8 hasta las 2 de la tarde, con su alegria Caribe, Aracely sale en un triciclo, vendiendo arepas asadas, sanduches y  exquisitas bebidas como café y chocolate; su día empieza muy temprano, porque va  al mercado de la ciudad a comprar los insumos, para ella misma preparar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes día a día. Su meta es tener un número de 10 triciclos en varios sectores para aumentar sus ventas y finalmente lograr su sueño de prosperidad que es tener su propia casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará masa de maíz, termos para cafés y chocolate, y un nuevo triciclo. Con esta inversión aspira a aumentar sus ventas y poco a poco alcanzar sus mas importantes retos de vida.
texts.en: Aracely is 33 years old and she lives with her partner and their three children, who are between three and eleven years old, in the city of Cartagena in an area with beautiful beaches, breezes, and ocean.  For ten years now, from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m., Aracely has gone out on her tricycle with her Caribbean cheer selling grilled arepas, sandwiches, and delicious drinks, such as coffee and hot chocolate.  Her day starts very early because she goes to the city market to buy her ingredients so she herself can prepare the products she sells to her customers every day.  Her goal is to have 10 tricycles in various neighborhoods to increase her sales and finally achieve her dream of prosperity by having her own home.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy corn masa, thermoses for coffee and hot chocolate, and a new tricycle.  With this investment she hopes to increase her sales and little by little overcome the most important challenges in her life.

loans.use: to buy corn masa, thermoses for coffee and hot chocolate, and a new tricycle

loans.name: Felisardo

texts.en:
Felisardo is 46 years old and lives in Lawigan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 5 children.
Felisardo has a welding shop and earns approximately 10000 PHP each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase additional tools to be used for his shop.
Felisardo is a new member of PMPC. In the future Felisardo hopes to expand his shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools for his shop

location.town: Liloy- Lawigan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jeanth Faith

texts.en: Jeanth Faith is 21 years old with 3 school age children, married and lives in Doyong, Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  She has been engaged in fishing for 4 years and joined Paglaum in 2011. She earns a monthly income of 3000 PHP from her fishing.  She applied for loan in Paglaum of 10,000 PHP to purchase fishing net.  The profit she earnes from her business will be used to pay school expenses and savings for college tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Avegnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AVEGNON est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kaï Rachelle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 37 ans a très peu fréquenté l'école. Kaï Rachelle est mariée à un peintre du nom de Noël. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Kaï Rachelle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Kaï Rachelle vend de la farine de maïs, du manwè (la farine de manioc fermenté) et du agbéli(la farine de maïs fermenté) à son domicile et par la technique de distribution depuis trente ans. Kaï Rachelle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Kaï Rachelle ensemble avec le membre du groupe AVEGNON sollicitent un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Avegnon Group is made up of two women who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, whose name is Kaï Rachelle (the woman with her hand raised in the photo), is 37 years old and did not have the chance to regularly attend school. Kaï Rachelle is married to a decorator whose name is Noël. The couple have five children in their care and all of them attend school. Kaï Rachelle lives with her husband and children. The various family costs are met by the parents. In order to do this, Kaï Rachelle sells maize flour, "manwè" (fermented cassava flour) and "agbéli" (fermented maize flour) from her home. She has done this for thirty years. Kaï Rachelle gets her supplies from a market in Benin. In order to advance her business, Kaï Rachelle and the other member of the Avegnon Group are requesting a fourth loan from Alidé. All their previous loans have been paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 43 years old and married, with four children. 

Liza has a sari-sari store where she sells sacks of rice, cartons of mosquito killer, bread, candies, and other products. She has had this business for five years. 

Liza requested a loan to purchase different basic commodities to sell, like rice, corn, canned goods, and noodles.

Liza has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, she hopes to have a mini-grocery in their place.

loans.use: to purchase different basic commodities to sell, like rice, corn, canned goods, and noodles.

loans.name: Mian

texts.en:
Mian is 27 years old and married, with two infant-aged children. She lives in Punta, Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  

Mian has been engaged in fishing for two years and she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2011. She earns a monthly income of PHP 3,000 from the aforementioned work and she has applied for a loan with PMPC to buy additional fish nets.  

The profit she earns in her fishing business will be saved for future tuition fees of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Madické

texts.fr:
Madické est cultivateur de maraîchage âgé de 43 ans et établi dans le village de mbane, il a commencé cette activité de culture d'onions depuis son enfance accompagné de ses parents, avec ce prêt, il va acheter du semence d'onions, de l'herbicide et des fertilisants.

Il compte augmenter à l'avenir sa qualité de production et sa quantité afin de toucher plusieurs clients qui sont établis dans les autres villages environnants.
texts.en:
Madické, age 43, is a market gardener who lives in the village of Mbane. He started his onion farming business in his childhood, with help from his parents.

With this loan, he will buy onion seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers.

In the future, he intends to improve the quality and quantity of his production, in order to reach out to several customers who lives in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: buy onion seeds, herbicides, and fertilizers

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun, age 34, lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is a hard-working farmer and a very responsible mother of five children. 

Nun has been doing farming for nearly 15 years and has gradually improved it to be her major source of income. Her husband has given full support in managing their farm.

Since Nun’s house was built on the low part of land, which suffers from water in the rainy season, she is requesting a loan to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of her house. In this way, she will be able to keep her house from flooding. She is very delighted and grateful for the loan support. 

In the future, Nun would like to save enough money to expand her current businesses and to increase productivity in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of her house.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu operates a fishing business.

Thu is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2008, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thu has been involved in the fishing business for 6 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine so her family share a neighbor's latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is a merchant from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. The youngest child is 14 years old. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice to support their family. She is engaged in vegetable vending business. She sells beans, squash, eggplants, and other green leafy vegetables, to help augment the income of their household. As of now, Teresita is asking for a loan to buy a variety of vegetables. With this she will be able to improve her stocks thus allow her to sell more to her customers. In the future Teresita wants to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. Lolita has been in the farming business for more than 8 years now. She works hard in order to provide support to her husband. Lolita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm . Through this loan Lolita will be able to improve the productivity of her farm which will increase her harvest and yields. In the future Lolita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Evella

texts.en:
Evella is a fish vendor from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a widow and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. This is her source of livelihood.

Evella is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more fish to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Estrella,Sinacaban, Philippines where she operates a general store.

Sabrina requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to buy inventories of rice, soft drinks, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Sabrina hopes to improve her business, earn a profit, and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 45 years old and married, with six adult-aged children. She is from Punta Miray, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  She earns PHP 3,500 from the business monthly and she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in 2010.  

Basilisa applied for a loan from PMPC to buy fish nets. The profit she earns from this kind of work will be used for daily consumption and savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy fish nets.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti lives in North of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Siti is married and lives with four people in her family home.Siti manages a small shop selling snacks,drinks and mobile air time. Siti began working with Ruma three years ago because she was interested in gaining income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last three months, she has made around $101 to $102 in sales on average (just from mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on the weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает троих детей. В 2000 году, начала бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, 20используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 6,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Нилуфар имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Нилуфар смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Нилуфар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Нилуфар планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей.
texts.en: Nilufar is 28 years old, married and raising three children. She started a children's clothing sales business in 2003, using a sum of 6,000 som (KGS) as her initial capital. Having been able to develop her business and obtain regular customers, Nilufar has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work in business, Nilufar was able to increase her goods turnover and grow her business. In order to further increase and expand her business, Nilufar requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to increase goods turnover. Nilufar plans to invest the earnings from the loan into goods turnover and saving money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 33 años de edad,  logro cursar hasta un  noveno grado,  luego dejo de estudiar por la situación económica de sus padres. posteriormente se caso y empezó a trabajar en compañía de su esposo comprando y vendiendo verduras y pescado, sus cuatro hijos están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad ya que son los que dependen de ella.


Desde muy pequeña en compañía de su madre se  dedicaba a trabajar vendiendo pescado fresco y verduras luego cuando se caso no se le hizo difícil, ya que su esposo es pescador de la zona y trabaja en esta actividad también colabora en la distribución del producto, ella lo compra en el mercado  mas cercano y lo vende en la comunidad lo hace de casa en casa empieza desde la mañana y a medida lo va terminando puede ser todo el día hasta que lo termina, su esposo también se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en la época de invierno.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para trabajar y comprar mercadería como verduras para la posterior reventa.


Espera para el futuro darles el estudio a sus hijos, para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo y terminar de arreglar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 33 years old, managed to study as far as ninth grade. After this she stopped going to school because of her parents' financial situation. She later married and began working with her husband, buying and selling vegetables and fish. Her four children go to the local primary school and are dependent on her. 

From a young age she worked with her mother, selling fresh fish and vegetables, so when she got married it was not difficult to do this. Her husband is a local fisherman and as well as doing this he helps to sell the produce. She buys produce in the nearest market and sells it in her local community, going from door to door. She starts early in the morning and, depending on how it goes, it could be the whole day before she has finished. Her husband also works in agriculture during the winter months.

The loan will be used for work and to buy produce such as vegetables for subsequent resale.

Her hope for the future is to provide her children with an education, so that they have better work opportunities, and to finish improving the home.

loans.use: to buy produce such as vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Siti is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Siti began working with Ruma two years ago because she was interested in income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $74 – $75 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on weekends.

loans.name: Nurhabibah

texts.en:
Nurhabibah lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. She is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Nurhabibah began working with Ruma three months ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $59 – $60 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Nurhalimah

texts.en:
Nurhalimah lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. She is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Nurhalimah began working with Ruma one month ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, she has had around $7 – $8 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.
