Umar lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. He is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Umar began working with Ruma three months ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has had around $77 - $78 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Juaningsih

texts.en:
Juaningsih lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Juaningsih is single and lives with six persons in the family home.

Juaningsih began working with Ruma three months ago because she was interested in earning income by selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $44 – 45 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Tugiman

texts.en:
Tugiman lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Tugiman is single and lives with four persons in the family home.

Tugiman began working with Ruma six months ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $52 - 53 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Eko

texts.en:
Eko lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. He is married and lives with five persons in the family home.

Eko began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $9 - $10 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Pitriyanih

texts.en:
Pitriyanih lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Pitriyanih is married and lives with more than six persons in the family home.

Pitriyanih began working with Ruma one year ago because she was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has around $46 – 47 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Abu is married and lives with four persons in the family home.
	
Abu began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $30 - 31 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekend

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Saptana

texts.en:
Saptana lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Saptana is married and lives with four persons in the family home.
	
Saptana began working with Ruma three years ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has around $63 - 64 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Toto is married and lives with four persons in the family home.
	
Toto began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $33 - 34 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Bachtiar

texts.en:
Bachtiar lives in north Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Bachtiar is married and lives with four persons in the family home.
	
Bachtiar began working with Ruma one month ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last month, he has around $14 - 15  per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekend.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Señor De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS DE SEÑOR DE LA CRUZ” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Berta es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, venta de chuños, venta de papa, artesanía, costura de chamarras, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Berta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años y en la actualidad lo asumió como fuente de trabajo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The A.C. “TRABAJADORAS DE SEÑOR DE LA CRUZ” will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes (Focal Center of the Andes). It is formed by eight members and is directed by a board of directors, where Berta is Secretary. The businesses that the members carry out are diverse; among them they have: the sale of sports attire, sale of freeze-dried potato (chuños), sale of potatoes, sewing jackets, sale of coca leaves. The loan they will get will benefit the small micro entrepeneurs, where Berta is a member. She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for two years, entering the group through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a handcraft business in knitting. She wants to state that she learned this business many years ago and currently she has it as her source of work. The loan that she will get is to increase capital (to buy wool at wholesale prices) that she will purchase in the wholesale stores of the city of El Alto, and after production she will sell in her sales space. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has four children. When she is asked what she likes from Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training that the institution offers her.

loans.use: To buy wool at wholesale prices

loans.name: Al – Dobai Group

texts.en:
Al – Dobai is a group consisting of five women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.
Ibtisam is the leader of the group. She is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of 8 children, living with them in a rented apartment. Her oldest child is 35 years old and the youngest one is 15 years old. She studied till elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies because that she got married when she was very young. She works, but  her salary is not enough to cover the expenses of their family and it  is not enough to purchase new appliances.  For this reason Ibtisam applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to buy new home appliances. 
Ibtisam looks forward to opening a savings account in the bank in order to support her family and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances for the house

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She has been in the pharmacy business for three years, working 12 hours a day, seven days a week. Her business is located in the market. Juliet started her business to have a source of income. Her challenges are competition and inadequate capital.

Juliet requested a loan, which she will to use to buy more drugs to sell. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase drugs to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 30-year-old, married female, with three children, of whom two go to school, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Margret deals in tomato-selling, working in the market seven days a week and 12 hours a day. Margret started her business to have a source of income and she is in need of a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. Margret hopes to expand her business. However, competition and the rate at which her products get spoiled are challenges being faced. 

Margret is so hard-working that her future plan is to buy a preservative machine to keep her products fresh.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
Wilbroad is a 66 years old and married. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle grazing and fattening alongside agriculture where he earns a living. He started this business to increase his income and look after family. He faces the challenges of competition and theft of his cows. 

Wilbroad is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more cattle for fattening. He hopes to increase the number of his cows and expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro de 42 años de edad,  sus  padres  con mucho esfuerzo lograron que pudiese estudiar hasta un 4º grado, ya que la economía no era muy buena y no podían mantenerla estudiando, al pasar los años se caso con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lograron construir una vivienda y procrear 3 hijos; pero su esposo la abandono con sus hijos pequeños y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo los a enviado a la escuela y están cursando 6 y 7 grado, y su hija mayor  ya esta acompañada.

Desde muy pequeña Milagro se a dedicado a trabajar en el campo, la agricultura y en los oficios del hogar, le ayudaba a su padre quien se dedicaba a la agricultura y a su madre para mantener a la familia y darle los alimentos , después que se caso le ayudaban a su esposo ya que también se dedicaba a esta misma actividad; luego que su esposo la abandono no se le hizo difícil trabajar por su cuenta, hoy en día siempre esta abajando por su cuenta en el cultivo de maíz; ademas trabaja como empleada domestica en una vivienda este empieza a las 6:00 am y termina a las 6: pm tiene que trabajar todo el día, la agricultura la realiza en época de invierno.


Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados en la compra de 2 terneros,  ya que espera que crezcan y tener un buen ingreso para su familia.

Espera sacar adelante a sus hijos en el estudio y que tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro y con la venta de los bovinos tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro is 42 years old. With great effort by her parents, she was able to study until the 4th grade. Since the economy wasn't very good, they were not able to let her keep studying.

As the years passed, she got married. With much effort and work, they were able to build a house and have 3 children. But her husband abandoned her with her young children. With great effort and work, she has sent them to school. They are now in the 6th and 7th grades, and her oldest daughter is already in a relationship.

From a very young age, Milagro has spent her time working in the field, farming, and housekeeping. She used to help her father, who used to make his living farming, and her mother to support and feed the family. After she got married, she used to help her husband, since he also made his living the same way. When her husband left her, it wasn't difficult for her to work on her own. Now she is still working on her own growing corn. She also works as a housekeeper. This starts at 6:00am and ends at 6:00pm. She has to work all day, and she farms during the winter.

The funds from the loan will be used to buy 2 calves, because she hopes they will grow and provide good income for her family.

She hopes to move her children forward in their studies, that they have better opportunities in the future, and that she will have a better income for her family with the sale of the bovines.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Catherine Njeri

texts.en:
Catherine Njeri is a member of Shakaina Women's Group in Thika, Central Kenya. She is married and has four children, ranging in age between three and eleven years old. 

She has a small business near her home where she sells paraffin and is able to earn USD 5 per day. Through her group, she took her first loan to expand her business by stocking solar lanterns. This increased her income to USD 8 per day. The added income was used to pay back her loan and to restock her stall. Catherine chose to stock solar lamps after attending a training for promotion of renewable energy, held by VEP.

Catherine has also applied for a second loan. With this loan, she intends to restock her stall with more lamps and cook stoves. She hopes to encourage other women to replace their kerosene lanterns with solar lanterns that eliminate smoke and cook stoves that will help save more on fuel costs.

loans.use: to restock her stall with solar lanterns.

loans.name: Vigilina

texts.en: Vigilina is a married woman and the mother of eight children. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Vigilina and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. Vigilina is asking for a loan to buy a new fish net, lead weights, hooks and nylon. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Vigilina hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, Vigilina wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy a new fish net, lead weights, hooks and nylon

loans.name: Abdasbek

texts.ru: Абдасбеку 35 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Абдасбека - среднее образование, в настоящее время работает сантехником в школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Абдасбек вместе со своей супругой занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Абдасбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец, 1 теленок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Абдасбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Абдасбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство кухни.
texts.en: Abdasbek is 35 years old, married and raising 3 children together with his wife. Abdasbek has a secondary education. At the present time, he works as a plumber at a school.  To provide a supplementary income for his family, Abdasbek and his wife are involved in animal husbandry, having started 6 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Abdasbek's hard work, today his business contains 1 dairy cow, 10 sheep and 1 calf. The monthly income amounts to 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Abdasbek requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy calves to increase livestock headcount. Abdasbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Aiperi

texts.ru: Айпери 25 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Айпери - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айпери занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айпери, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айпери обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айпери планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Aiperi is 25 years old, married and raising 2 children together with her husband. Aiperi has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, Aiperi is involved in animal husbandry, having started 4 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aiperi's hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 2 calves. The monthly income amounts to 11,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Aiperi requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep to increase livestock headcount. Aiperi plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's continued education.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Soknan

texts.en:
Soknan is 27 years old and married. She grows and harvest rice, which she has been doing since she was a young girl living with her parents. Soknan gets up very early to go to the field where she has to remove weeds, balance the water, and apply fertilizers and pesticides to her crops in order to ensure a high productivity of her crops. Her business is going very well.

Soknan requested a loan,  which she will use to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members so as to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Soknan is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank

loans.name: Zef

texts.en:
Zef was sick for some months and, therefore, he not only had to spend money to cover his medical expenses, but he was not able to bring in extra cash, either. The sudden economic condition did not allow him to pay for water or energy consumption of his apartment. He has been way behind in the bill payments. 

As a result, he and his wife have been experiencing energy disconnection and water restriction for the past two months. Zef worked as a police officer for 30 years, is a married father of four, and lives in a little northern town, called Lezha. Residents of this town are known for home visitation as a way of socializing. 

Kindly note that Zef has been a client of VisionFund Albania for a very long time and he has always paid on-time.

loans.use: to pay for energy and water bills; he has been behind payments due to his sickness

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal was born in 1987. She is married and lives in Tafila, Jordan. Her husband serves in the military. 

For two years, Manal has been supporting her husband in improving their living conditions by raising sheep and goats and selling them and their products. She is now requesting a youth loan to expand her business. She will use the loan to purchase more sheep and goats to raise her productivity and profit.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep and goats

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina de 74 años de edad,  es una señora que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se casó y tuvo 10 hijos, ahora todos son mayores de edad solo vive con dos en su casa.  Ella aparte de los oficios domésticos y a pesar de sus edad se dedica a la agricultura, dice que los años no han sido capaces de vencerla su esposo murió hace 8 años y ella tuvo que sacar sus hijos adelante, algunos le ayudan en el trabajo y dos de ellos le ayudan con remesas desde Estados Unidos.

Ella dice que necesita el dinero,  para pagar alquiler de la tierra y comprar lo necesario para comenzar a trabajar un años más en la agricultura, a ella le gustaría que sus nietos estudien; pero más quisiera que aprendan a trabajar como ella ya que los obstáculos solo existen dice si uno no los quiere vencer.
texts.en:
Paulina, 74 years old, is a woman who did not have the opportunity to study. She got married and had 10 children. Now they are all grown and only two live with her in her house. Aside from household tasks, she makes her living farming, in spite of her age. She says the years have not been capable of getting the better of her. Her husband died 8 years ago, and she had to move her children forward. Some of them help her with the work, and two of them study with remittances from the United States.

She says that she needs the money to pay for the lease on the land, and to buy whatever is necessary to begin working in farming for another year.

She would like for her grandchildren to study, but she wants more for them to learn to work like her, because she says that obstacles only exist if one does not want to overcome them.

loans.use: to pay for the land lease and to buy whatever is necessary to begin working in farming for another year.

loans.name: Reba's Group

texts.en:
Reba is a member of this group in the Lugari District.  She is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 61 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Reba has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.							

Reba is 51 years old and has been a farmer for 32.  Reba works as a farmer to provide for her 5 children.  The community and other farmers know Reba as friendly and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community such as the women's group and prayer group.  Reba described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.							

The 2014 Long Rains season won’t be Reba’s first season with One Acre Fund.  She first joined One Acre Fund in 2013 and has continue working with One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, and get new farming methods.  As an active member in her community, Reba also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader and wants to help more farmers.  Reba plans on using future profits from the harvest to send children to school and save for the future.  Her life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training and was able to save money.							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Reba and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a forty-one-year-old hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce, selling maize and coffee as his main source of income though he has other side businesses like farming, where he earns an extra income. He started this business four years ago to sustain his family and have a better standard of living. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital to cater to his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce serving many customers around his area.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Twungubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Odette fait partie du groupe Twungubumwe. Il habite à Bujumbura et est marié à J. Claude un soudeur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés   de 1  à  10 ans,dont 1 étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala) depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est  à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de poissons (ndagala) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait faire le commerce d’importation des habits, des bassins, des casseroles,… et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Odette is a member of the Twungubumwe group. She lives in Bujumbura, ans she is married to a welder named J. Claude. They have three children aged 1 to 10 years old, one of whom is in school.

Odette has been selling fish (ndagala) for 15 years. This is her 4th loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to bolster her working capital and stock up on ndagala fish to sell and increase her income.  

In the coming years, she would like to become an importer of clothing, bowls, pots, etc. She wants to see her children continue their education.

loans.use: to bolster her capital and stock up on ndagala fish to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Shamilla

texts.en: Shamilla is a twenty three year old married woman with three children living in Bundibugyo Uganda.She sells cocoa from her garden and wants to buy more and supplement on what she has to make more profits.She dreams of having a very big cocoa store in future.She is so hard working and seasonality changes is a big challenge for her business. Shamilla needs a loan to buy cocoa and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rukiidi 111 Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Gorret is 37 years, married, and has three children who attend school. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling beers, salt, and sugar. She started this business to meet her dreams of educating her children to a level of self sustainability and also to have a personal source of income to meet her increasing demands. She faces the challenges of high license fees, bad debtors, and inadequate capital to reinvest in her business. 

Gorret requested a loan, which she will use to buy more beers to sell. She is a member of a group where members guarantee one another to receive a loan as they do not offer security.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Bihowa Senoudeme C.'s Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Bihowa Senoudeme C. (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans a  fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Bihowa Senoudeme C. est mariée à un certain Vitrice. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Bihowa Senoudeme C. vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Bihowa Senoudeme C. vend des tissus et des chaussures dans sa boutique depuis quatre ans. Bihowa Senoudeme C. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Bihowa Senoudeme C. ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Bihowa Senoudeme C. (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 29 years old and went to school until the secondary level. Bihowa Senoudeme C. is married to Vitrice. The couple has two children, both in school and under their care. Bihowa Senoudeme C. lives with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the variety of family responsibilities. To do this, Bihowa Senoudeme C. has been selling fabric and shoes in her boutique for four years. Bihowa Senoudeme C. gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Bihows Senoudeme C., together with the members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sidoine's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ADANDEDJAN est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidoine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans a  fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Sidoine est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Crépin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidoine vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Sidoine vend du tapioca, de la bouillie de tapioca et des tissus par la technique de distribution depuis trente ans ce qui lui permet de faire face à ses responsabilités. Sidoine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Sidoine ensemble avec le membre du groupe ADANDEDJAN sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The group Adandedjan consists of two people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Sidoine (the one whose hand is raised in the photo) is 45 years old and went to school until the secondary level. Sidoine is married to a refrigeration engineer named Crépin. The couple has four children, all in school and under their care. Sidoine lives with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the variety of family responsibilities. To do this, Sidoine has been selling tapioca, tapioca porridge and fabric by the distribution technique for thirty years which allows her to meet her responsibilities. Sidoine gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business Sidoine, together with the members of the group Adandedjan, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and tapioca.

loans.name: Al- Ehsan2 Group

texts.en:
Al- Ehsan2 is a group of three women members living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Mona is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest one is 11 years old, and the youngest one is 7 years old. 

Mona is considered one of many Yemeni University graduates who couldn't find any opportunities to work. Now, they are still unemployed. Mona is an example of them, but she didn't wait for the job; therefore, she decided to begin her own business. 

She started up her business a year ago as a door-to-door seller, selling women's clothes in her area in order to help her husband with the expenses of their family. The financial support of her husband in her business is very low because most of what he earns goes to the children's expenses, such as their school fees.

So, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy more women's clothes. 

Mona looks forwards to opening a small shop for women's clothes and selling them to all areas in the governorate. 

Her dreams are to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita lives at Libag Sur with her husband. She had two children, but they live separately from them. 

She sells curtains and clothes, while her spouse is a head carpenter. She only generates P5,000 each month, and wanted to increase her sales.  

That is why she is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more clothes and curtains to sell. 

She will keep offering good quality of products so she will satisfy her customer's needs, and gain more profits as well.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and curtains to sell

loans.name: Sidonie's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidonie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 47 ans a  fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Sidonie est mariée à un frigoriste du nom de Alexis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sidonie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, Sidonie vend du charbon de bois et divers produits alimentaires à son domicile depuis douze ans. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Sidonie ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: This group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Sidonie (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 47 years old and went to school until the secondary level. Sidonie is married to a refrigeration engineer named Alexis. The couple has four children, all in school and under their care. Sidonie lives with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the diverse family responsibilities. To do this, Sidonie has been selling charcoal and a variety of foodstuffs from home for twelve years. Sidonie gets her supplies at a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Sidonie, together with the members of her group, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and a variety of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Afepeb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFEPEB est composé de deux personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yvette Mondoukpè (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 45 ans a  fréquenté l'école jusqu’au niveau secondaire. Yvette Mondoukpè ne vit plus avec son mari. Yvette Mondoukpè a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Les diverses charges familiales sont supportées par dame Yvette Mondoukpè. Pour ce faire, Yvette Mondoukpè vend des boissons dans sa région depuis dix ans. Yvette Mondoukpè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Yvette Mondoukpè ensemble avec les membres du groupe AFEPEB sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Afepeb consists of two people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group, named Yvette Mondoukpè (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is 45 years old and went to school until the secondary level. Yvette Mondoukpè does not live with her husband anymore. Yvette Mondoukpè has three children, all in school and under her care. Yvette Mondoukpè takes care of the diverse family reponsibilities. To do this, Yvette Mondoukpè has been selling drinks in her region for ten years. Yvette Mondoukpè gets her supplies at a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Yvette Mondoukpè, together with the members of the group Afepeb, is requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is married with two children. She is 39 years old and lives in Gotocan Diot, Ozamiz City.

Mema sells beauty products like lipstick, face powder, shampoo, cologne, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy a second-hand motor unit for transport services. Mema has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mema hopes to save for her family.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motor unit for transport services

loans.name: Richelyn

texts.en:
Richelyn, 22, is married with 3 children and she lives in Lawis, Sindanagan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao, Philippines. 

From her desire to help the family, she engaged in dried-fish vending while her husband is a wage earner, but has no regular income. 

Starting with a capital of PHP 2,000, Richelyn began selling dried fish to their neighbors. Her business has operated for two years already. 

Now, she is planning to borrow  PHP 5,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, in which she became a member in 2013, to buy additional kilos and varieties of fish, to dry and sell. 

Richelyn wants to have a stall in the public market to display her dried fish. Someday, she will be happy seeing her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional kilos and varieties of fish, to dry and sell.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a widow with six children. She is 69 years old and lives in San Vicente,Sinacaban, Philippines.

Concepcion is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy a sack of feed.

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sack of feed

loans.name: Azal Group

texts.en:
Azal is a group of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Husina is a 28-year-old single woman, living in a poor family. She is the leader of the group. 

Husina studied till secondary school, but she couldn’t complete her studies because she was helping her mother in the work of the house. Now, she is an employee in a private factory with a very low salary. 

Due to the miserable condition of her family, she decided to help her father in improving the living standards of the family and buy some home appliances, but  most of the salary goes to her own expenses; therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.
 
Husina looks forward to opening a saving account in the bank in order to be able to help her family and shares the household expenses with them.

loans.use: To purchase appliances for the house

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en:
Gharam is a 21-year-old single lady. She lives with her family, which consists of nine members. 

She is a university student majoring in sports training and guidance; she is in her third year. 

Gharam is facing problems paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this education loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Al-Nada 2 Group

texts.en:
Al-Nada 2 is a group of four women members, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old single woman, living in a poor family. She began by raising cattle and selling it in order to help her family with the expenses. She started up a business as a door to a door seller one year ago. She earns a good profit but she sees this business is not suitable for her, so she decided to work selling women's clothes. Through this business, Fatima sees that she will earn a lot of money that will help her to improve the living standards of her family. The money that she accumulated from the first business is not enough to buy women's clothes, so Fatima applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy women's clothes. Fatima looks forward to expanding her business through selling accessories, makeup, perfumes, and other kinds of women's clothes. Fatima hopes to support her family with a lot of money that will help them to live in a better condition.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking season to expand her business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1967. She is married and has one son. Her husband is working as a bill collector. 

Amal has been working at selling clothes for one year She is planning to expand her project by increasing the amount of sales and the number of customers during the summer. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of clothes for her business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 60 years old, married and the mother of one child. Her spouse is a tricycle driver while she operates a "sari-sari"(variety) store in their village. To add to her income, she also offers manicure and pedicure services to her customers. She patiently provides good services to her clients. She wants
to increase her profits, that is why she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to invest in her business. She will buy more nail polish, acetone and cuticle remover for her manicure services. She will also buy grocery items to sell in her store. Any additional revenue will be saved to meet her family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy more nail polish, acetone, cuticle remover and grocery items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 38 años de edad,  es una persona casada que estudio hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos.  

 Rigoberto junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y así vender la leche.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para  comprar una vaca, para ordeñarla e incrementar la cantidad de leche que vende. 

Él  planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de venta de leche, poder  comprar otra vaca.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 38 years old. He is a married man who studied until the sixth grade. He lives with his wife and childen.

Rigoberto and his wife are farmers, a trade he learned from his parents. In order to arrive at his plot, he walks 5 kilometers and works in the mornings while his wife tends to her domestic duties and milks the cows they own to sell the milk.

The loan Rigoberto is requesting is to purchase a cow to milk nd increase the amount of milk sold.

He plans to buy another cow with the income from his milk sales.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Las Ovejitas Blancas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS OVEJITAS BLANCAS”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: carpintería, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta y tejido de mantas, tienda de barrio, ferretería, venta de chinelas, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de humintas(bocadito tradicional boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años iniciando al observar que este producto es muy bien vendido en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra choclo y harina de choclo por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago del crédito, pues se reúne con sus amigas

En la imagen no esta presente un socio, ya que por razones de trabajo se fue posterior al desembolso
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Ovejitas Blancas" (The Little White Sheep) will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Julia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association run are varied; among them are: carpentry, selling clothing, selling vegetables, weaving and selling blankets, neighborhood store, hardware store, selling slippers, and making sports clothing.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of which Señora Julia is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, entering at the invitation of a sister who is a member of the institution. She now has a business of selling humitas (a traditional Bolivian snack). She lets it be known that she began this business a number of years ago, beginning it after observing that this product sells very well in the market.

The loan that she will take out is to increase her capital in order to buy corn and cornmeal wholesale. She will acquire these items from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto, and after making the humitas she will sell them in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings for loan payments, since she meets with her friends.

In the photo, one member is not present, since for work reasons she left after the disbursement.

loans.use: to buy corn and cornmeal wholesale

loans.name: Tý

texts.en:
Mrs. Tý operates a business fishing.  Tý has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is 57 years old, and is married, with five children. Tý lives with two dependents in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Tý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tý has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tý faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family shares the neighbor's latrine.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tý hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives at Libag Sur. She is married and operates a small store selling grocery items. Her spouse is a farmer, planting and harvesting rice, corn and tobacco for income. She wanted to increase the capacity of sales from her store but had insufficient funds to do so. That is why she is asking for 15,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as sardines, eggs, breads, noodles, and soap to sell. This will help achieve good sales. Veronica hopes to keep improving her sales and become a succesful vendor. She will also keep supporting her spouse in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sardines, eggs, breads, noodles, and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her vehicle to transport construction materials.

loans.name: Lấy

texts.en:
Lấy works in agriculture growing industrial crops. She is 28 years old and she is married with 2 children. Lấy lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Lấy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lấy has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lấy has been involved in this business for 6 years.

The main hardship that Lấy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. With her business profit, Lấy hopes to maintain a successful business, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thuỷ operates a business of fishing. She is 44 years old and she is married with 4 children. Thuỷ lives with 2 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thuỷ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thuỷ has been involved in the fishing business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having latrine. Her family shares the neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thuỷ hopes to maintain a successful business, to buy land of her own, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 38 years old and is married with seven children. In 2008, Myrna applied for membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Myrna requested financial assistance of 14,000 PHP to have additional capital to purchase 100 pieces dressed chicken to grill for sale. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart. 

Myrna hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family and wishes to see all her children finish their college education and have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase chicken to grill for sale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Hello, this is Salamatu, a business woman from Waterloo, western rural area Freetown. 
Salamatu is married to a man who works in the local area. They have five children. Four of her children are still attending school. 
Salamatu started her business to take care of her family. She sells palm oil in a nearby town. Palm oil is heavily relied upon in local homes as it is the base for spicy local (and affordable) stews such as ‘crain-crain’ or ‘rice and cassava leaf’. She works from 8.00 am to 6.30 pm and then tends to her family. Even though Salamatu is proud of her business, it faces challenges from the poor transportation infrastructure in the area. This makes travelling to purchase stock or reach new markets slow and expensive. 
Salamatu would like to use this loan to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon). This would allow her business to remain profitable. She would like to thank BRAC Sierra Leone and the Kiva lenders for helping her and her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Isatu      B

texts.en:
Meet Isatu B. She is a 45-year-old woman from Waterloo, a western, rural area in Freetown, in Sierra Leone. She is married, with one child.  

Twelve years ago, Isatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, six days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and a proper business location.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap, to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Isatu plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap, to expand her business.

loans.name: Biện

texts.en:
Biện works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is 36 years old and she is married, with two children. Biện lives with two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Biện joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for six years.

The main hardship that Biện faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Biện hopes to buy land of her own, for her children to graduate from college, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Elizabeth Carolina

texts.es: Elizabeth de 31 años de edad, comenta que no pudo estudiar debido a una enfermedad que padecía. Ella  esta acompañada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad y aun no estudias;  su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ella dice se levanta muy temprano a cocinar para su familia e irse a veces con el esposo a trabajar, poseen 7,000 metros cuadrados  de pipián ya para cosechar pero necesita el dinero  del préstamo para poder abonarla por última vez  y están preparando otros 7,000 metros cuadrados ya que a veces, llegan a tener hasta 21,000 metros cuadrados en proceso y así no le faltan los ingresos por eso necesita otra parte para cancelar el alquiler de la tierra y asegurarla, a ella le gustaría que sus hijos estudien;  pero sobre todo que prendan a trabajar porque ella dice que no estudie pero sabe un oficio que es la agricultura.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 31 years old. She says that she wasn't able to go to school due to an illness she had. She is married and has three minor children who are not in school yet. Her husband works in agriculture and she gets up very early to cook for her family and sometimes go with her husband to work. They have 7,000 square meters of pipián to harvest but she needs the money from the loan to be able to fertilize it one more time. In addition, they are  preparing another 7,000 square meters, since some times they have up to 21,000 square meters in process. This way, they don't lack for income. That is why she needs another part of it to pay for the land rental and insure it. She would like for her children to go to school but above all for them to learn to work because she says she didn't go to school, but she knows a trade, which is farming.

loans.use: to be able to fertilize her pipian one last time and to pay for the land rental.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Adama from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown. She is married with 4 children and her children are currently attending school.  Adama established a fast food business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to take care of her family. She works at the business 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her area.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future Adama plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Faatutu

texts.en: Faatutu is a 37 year old mother of 4 children. She has operates a lawn mowing business, plus a billiard pool table game . Faatutu needs a loan to buy a new pool table, 3 lawn mowers, and also to help pay her kid's school fees. She reinvests her profits back to her lawn mowing business and to assist in any of her family's immediate needs. Faatutu joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a pool table, 3 lawn mowers, help to pay her kid's school fees

loans.name: Poutasi

texts.en: Poutasi is 54 years old and married with 5 children. She operates a small BBQ stall selling it to the public passing by her around her village. She has been doing this for 4 years. Poutasi has requested a loan to buy ingredients for her barbeque such as boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, Sacks of Rice, Onion, Soya, Paper cups and plates. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings,Poutasi will look at improving her business and also help out with her family's immediate needs.

loans.use: To buy in bulk boxes of chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, Sacks of Rice, Onion, Soya, Paper cups and plates.

loans.name: Ihana

texts.en: Ihana is 52 years old, married with 5 children. She has been operating her small grocery shop for six years now. She has reapplied for another loan to restock her shop and also things to renovate her home. These  things are stocks such as tin fish, laundry powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken leg quarters and etc. She also wants to buy iron roofing for her house.Ihana reinvests her profits on her shop and assist with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy tin fish, laundry powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken leg quarters ,  iron roofing

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from rural Waterloo in northern Freetown! This is Kadiatu, a local married woman.  Kadiatu has three children. Two of Kadiatu’s children are still going to school. 
Kadiatu sells over-the-counter medicines in a busy market place. She started this business in 2003 to help her children have a better standard of living. She works from 8am to 5pm each day. 
Kadiatu  is a well-regarded member of BRAC Sierra Leone, having already taken out and paid back four loans which she used to develop her business. 
She wants to use this loan to buy more medicines to sell in the market. In the future, she would like to have her own drug store to sell more products and reach more customers. She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell in the market.

loans.name: Blanca Evelin

texts.es:
Blanca de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado,  es soltera y con muchos deseos de superación, desde hace 2 años maneja una pequeña pupuseria junto a su hermana y su madre, aprendió a desempeñar este trabajo ya que cuando estudiaba las  personas donde vivía lejos de casa tenían una pequeña pupuseria y cuando dejo den estudiar decidió poner en práctica su conocimiento y experiencia en el negocio. Ella necesita el dinero para comprar maíz, chicharon, quesillo, frijoles, loroco, aceite, etc para incrementar su negocio,  ya que  de los ingresos que obtiene actualmente tiene que cubrir otras necesidades.

A ella le gustaría incrementar el negocio y emplear a otras personas de su familia o amigos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 20 years old. She went to school up to the ninth grade. She is single and really wants to get ahead. For 2 years, she has run a small pupusa business with her sister and her mother. She learned to do this work because when she was in school, the people where she lived away from home had a little pupusa business. When she stopped going to school she decided to put her knowledge and experience into practice in the business. She needs the money to buy corn, cracklings, farmer's cheese, beans, loroco, oil, etc to grow her business. What she is currently earning is used to pay for other needs. 

She would like to grow her business and hire other people from her family or friends.

loans.use: to buy corn, crackling, farmer's cheese, beans, loroco, oil, etc. to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Delmer Francisco

texts.es: Delmer, tiene 26 años de edad, esta soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Belén, Lempira. Con sus padres a cultivado maíz y frijoles y hace 5 años cultivo su propia finca de café, esta producción la vende en grano en oro en la misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 25,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y abonar bien la finca de café para mejorar la cosecha. Su meta es cultivar mas planta de café y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Delmer Francisco is 26 years of age, single, and lives with his parents in the community of Belen, Lempira. With his parents he cultivates corn and beans, and for the last 5 years, he has developed his own coffee farm. He sells his harvest of golden grains in his own area.

Now, Delmer is requesting a 2nd loan, amounting to 25,000 lempiras, to purchase fertilizers and to spread goodly amounts of manure on his coffee farm to improve the harvest.

His goal is to cultivate more coffee plants to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and spread manure around his coffee plants.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is a 21 year old woman living with her partner of three years but has no child. She operates a small canteen business selling snacks and finger foods around her village and has been doing this for 3 years.Annie has requested a loan to help her increase the quality of her business.She is looking at buing boxes of chicken leg quearters, sausages, sacks of flour, sacks of rice, cereals. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Annie has been able to assist in her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: To buy boxes of chicken leg quearters, sausages, sacks of flour, sacks of rice, cereals.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des poissons et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  15ème  prêt solidaire. BABA 1ère  femme à gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50Kg de poissons séchés. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women in the Danaya Group average 48 years of age and 5 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Tènè/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 
The women know each other through family ties and make a living trading fish and various products. After having successfully repaid their previous loans, the women in the Danaya Group are on their 15th solidarity loan cycle. Baba is the woman on the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 50kg of dried fish. She buys her fish locally. She sells her fish to a clientele consisting of both men and women for cash and often on credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 FCFA that she will use to cover expenses related to healthcare and food. She will reinvest the remaining amount into her business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia  Yaneth trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva papa y maíz y también la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yaneth works at her business of raising and selling animals. She also has a plot of land where she grows potatoes and corn. Yaneth also raises guinea pigs and chickens. Once the animals are grown and fattened, they are eventually sold at different fairs. Through this small business, she has been able to help her children move forward. Her dream is to have a location where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens.

Yaneth is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for these animals. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru:
Наталья торгует женской одеждой в городе Трускавец, который расположен в западной части Украины и является курортным городом. Наталья арендует помощениена рынке, которое является как местом торговли так и хранения вещей.  

Наталья уже пользовалась КИВА кредитом. В прошлый раз она закупила дополнительный товар и смогла увелисить объем продаж и как следстие свою прибыль.

Наталья ожидат, что в этом году весной увеличится приток туристов. Это значит что нужно делать дополнительные закупки товара. Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит, чтобы она смогла купить женские кофты, блузки, легкие свитера и пр. одежду. Наталья мечтает выкупить киоск, чтобы не надо было платить аренду.
texts.en:
Natalya sells women's clothing in the city of Truskavyetz, a resort town in the Western half of Ukraine. Natalya rents a stall at the market for selling and storing her items.

Natalya has already used a KIVA loan. The last time, she bought additional merchandise and was able to increase her sales volume, and as a result, her profits.

Natalya expects that this year, the influx of tourists will increase in the spring. This means that she needs to make a purchase of additional merchandise. Natalya is requesting a loan so that she can buy women's jackets, blouses, light sweaters, and similar types of clothing. Natalya dreams of buying her own kiosk so that she wouldn't need to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy additional seasonal merchandise.
